story:
New York urban planner Janet Sadik-Kahn wrote recently "What is a city, if not its people and its streets?" This is also one of the questions I explore in my new book entitled Ottawa at the Crossroads:  Streetscape Memories of 1912-1938.  

My name is Andrew Elliott.  I am an archivist and a freelance architectural historian, and I am also interested in good urban design.  You may have heard of me in another venue.  For the past three years, I've been writing articles about Ottawa in the online blog Apt613 under the tagline Streetscape Memory Bank.  http://apt613.ca/author/andrew-elliott/

The book, like the articles, focuses on building and streetscape design of the early 20th century.  I start by looking at some newly discovered images from 1912 of a lost neighbourhood of Ottawa: Uppertown. 

This crowd-funding campaign is to help me to 1. Pay for digitization costs of more photos that are to be found within the Department of Public Works photo collection at Library and Archives Canada; and 2. Publish this book professionally with Borealis Press, and price it for as wide a readership as possible. 

The book itself  is intended as a contribution to the ongoing conversation about Ottawa's architecture and streetscape planning. It asks: was the Greber Plan a good thing for Ottawa? Over the past 60 years, have we lost our way from good urban design? Can we learn from the past and move to a new " street code" that makes for better, more complete streets? 

I intend to publish this book for late 2016 (it will be available in time for Christmas and will make a great gift for all those who are interested in our city's history!). 

Help out in small ways (donate $15 and you'll receive the perk of 15% off the purchase price) or larger ways (donate $25 and you'll receive the perk of 60% off the purchase price)!

I am grateful for all contributions, and also very thankful to those who post, share, tweet or tell their friends and family about this crowd-funding.

Andrew Elliott

story:
...In Summary...

Namaste, 
      My name is Sean Fletcher. I am a full time jewelry & mandala-artist and poet. I spent four years studying and practicing as a monk, and have dedicated my life to the uplift-ment of society, humanity, and consciousness - through art, poetry and a life of BEing that which I know that I am, Divine Love.
      First and foremost, thank you for taking the time to read this and, if your heart feels moved to do so, thank you for your contribution.
     I will keep this short and sweet. I never intended to publish any of my poetry, but at the behest of a few dear friends, and after some introspection and meditation, my intuition led me to begin my book, entitled "A Revolution in Love". It has been several years in the making, in regards to the poems and mandalas included within. 
     The completed manuscript consists of 42 hand-illustrated, conscious-spiritual poems, 14 intricate, full page, color mandalas, a 17 page Introduction, a 3 page Conclusion and one page of Acknowledgements, a hand illustrated front cover and a back cover featuring art from a dear friend, Krystle Smith, aka Krystleyez.

What I Require... & What You Get!!! (The Perks)

   I have most recently decided to truly self-publish through a local, family publisher in Parker, Colorado, called Book Crafters.

I am not sure exactly how much it will cost.... but I have an appointment to meet with them to discuss publishing and printing my book Sept. 30th...

I will keep everyone posted on what the cost will be. Blessings

     In regards to the perks offered on my end - accompanying your generous donation.... They are as follows:

$1-24    Thank You, All My Love and Gratitude for your contribution! When the book is published and printed, I will make sure you get a copy at a reduced price! 

$25-29    Free Laminated Mandala Print & Reduced Price Copy of "A Revolution in Love"

$30-99   Complimentary, Signed Copy of "A Revolution In Love" as soon as it is published, printed, and available!

$100 + Up    ~Jewelry Option~ & Complimentary Signed Copy

                                                         The Impact

     Well... We require a revolution. But it must be peaceful, non-violent, revolutionary, spiritual in principle, radical, yet wonderful. This revolution, however must begin within, it must sprout and grow from a place of Love, in order to last, in order to have the most profound effect on all of we, on all of humanity, generation after generation... 

     This book is unique in that it is a non-demoniationally-spiritually-conscious work of art, that conveys profundity and simple truth, through sacred geometry and prophetic poetry, providing yet another light unto the darkness, so that all may see, a bit better, re-member a bit more, and ultimately to BE the instrument of Divine Love that they were, are and always have been....

                    Other Ways You Can Help....

   Honestly, I have received so many kind words and vernacular support since even introducing the idea of creating a book that would include my poetry and art-work! Thank you for that. Thank you for watering the seeds in my heart from beginning to completion. Thank you for being you, even just liking and sharing my poetry, art, and spoken word has been more supportive than you could ever know! If you do decide to give financially, I will consider it an even greater blessing! Aho Mitakuye Oyasin. Om Tat Sat.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! I’m Sophia. I’m passionate about fantasy fiction and a couple of years back, I began writing stories.

A few months ago, i had to leave my job because of debilitating pain issues. At the same time, I had this idea of gifting people personalized fantasy stories. I started with gifting my friends and they loved it. Then I decided I wanted to make it my business, if you can call something so pleasurable that!

Fb page link: www.facebook.com/fantastories42

See? It’s got 42 in it. It’s the answer to the universe!

So far in the personalized gifting market, we’ve got stories where the name is changed according to the customer’s wishes. But with Fantastories, you just have to tell me a few facts about the person to be gifted and I will create a delightful fantasy story around it, design it nicely and get it printed. Since no one can ever be too old for fantasy, stories are written for all age groups. You can view some sample stories at the link above.

Apart from the highly personalized stories, there will also be fixed stories where only names will be changed to suit the wishes of the customer.

Reasons you should contribute:

·  This is a relatively unique gifting idea that few people know about. Gifting shouldn’t be generic. It should be made with a lot of love which is what I do when I write any story.

·  With digital stuff overtaking the world, reading habits are dying. With your help to set up and promote, you might just save it from extinction. One day books might just be as much a myth as dragons. It is a scene to horrible to contemplate.  

·  Stories spread happiness and personal stories even more so. Happier people will make the world a happier place.

Setting up:

1.  Although I have already started Fantastories and received assignments, my current workspace is a netbook where I cannot use designing software and have to depend on others. The cost of the laptop I can work with: Rs 38,180 (around US$ 608 )

2.  I want to hire an illustrator to make original illustrations for my stories.

3.  While I have a logo in place, I want the website designed. I have designed it on wix, but my design is simpler than I’d like it to be. The cost of hiring a designer: Rs 1 lakh (around US$ 1557 )

4.  Apart from writing the stories, I want to sell merchandise related to the stories. Like original superhero costumes, props, stationery etc.

5.  A team of writers and designers will have to be hired when Fantastories goes viral and demand increases exponentially.

For promotion:

Digital is taking the world by storm and it’s necessary for Fantastories to ride the wave to make the best of the opportunities it presents.

·  Promoting the Facebook page and posts require money pumped in to facebook whose algorithm is such that without investing money, people would not be able to see the page.

·  As the creator of Fantastories, my busy schedule leaves me little time to regularly update the Facebook page. I have to hire someone to handle the Facebook and Pinterest page and keep it visible on timelines and fresh in memory. Cost of hiring someone: Rs 20,000 (around US$ 311 ) for a month.

·  Social media campaigns need to be created and promoted to generate buzz and excitement about Fantastories. Cost: depends on the campaign. Will include cost of the campaign and cost of promoting it

The Impact

Although Fantastories will be available for everyone, the main market is children. Making personalized stories the norm for parents instead of the generic stories in bookstores, will generate maximum profit for Fantastories. Therefore ad campaigns will be majorly aimed at this.


Risks & Challenges

Risk: It’s a new concept so the public may take time to catch on to it.

Solution: Before I started Fantastories, I was working in advertising as a copywriter so I have good idea of what it will take to publicize it and make it the norm for the masses.

Challenge: To bring scalability to Fantastories when demand goes high

Solution: I will hire and train writers to write Fantastories

Your contribution does not have to be monetary.

·  I would welcome all the help I can get if you’re a website designer willing to design my website.

·  It would be great if you want to and have the necessary skills to handle the social media pages.

·  Spread the word about Fantastories.

Please contribute! This is my only means of earning a living. Looking forward to hearing from you.

story:
The Harper Decade

The Harper Decade is a series that chronicles the changes that have occurred in Canada over the past ten years of Conservative rule. Compiling short and compelling editorials from a diverse group of experts, The Harper Decade provides Canadians with a non-partisan, critical, and comprehensive exploration of the various consequences of Conservative rule on Canada. Contributors include David Schindler, Magrit Eichler, Steve Patten, Faisal Bhabha, Lorne Sossin, Tzeporah Berman, Tyler Dawson, Rishi Nagar, Peter Russell, Raj Sharma, Ram Sankaran, Chloe Shantz-Hilkes, Marc Lee, Pamela Palmater, Aaron Wudrick, David Macflarlane, David Murakami-Wood, Ryan Mieli, Lisa Kerr, Anthony Doob, Michael Lynk, Micha Kurz, Trina Moyles, David Whitson, Richard Day, Eve Bourgeois, Alison Smith, Carey Doberstein, and others. 

By donating to The Harper Decade, you will be supporting the series' following initiatives and specific costs: 

  • Digital Series: web hosting, art and outreach costs.
  • Lecture Series: venue and marketing costs.
  • Print Publication: graphic design and printing costs.

The Harper Decade: Digital Series

The Harper Decade began as a digital series, publishing weekly and semi-weekly editorials exploring a particular facet of how Stephen Harper's leadership has impacted Canadian society. Each piece was accompanied with a unique art piece or illustration commissioned by a Canadian artist. 

Your support will ensure that the costs of the digital series are covered, including those incurred in relation to web hosting, art and social media outreach. 

The Harper Decade: Lecture Series

In late September and early October, The Harper Decade will be launching a lecture series across Canada with experts in various policy areas. By hosting these lectures, we aim on engaging Canadians in substantive discussions on the current and future trajectory of the country in areas such as the environment, health, law, Aboriginal relations and a host of others. Events are scheduled in Vancouver, Edmonton, Kingston and Toronto, with other locations to be announced shortly.

Your support will ensure that the costs of the lecture series are covered, including those incurred in relation to venue rental and outreach costs.

The Harper Decade: Print Publication

The Harper Decade will culminate with a publishing of a print version of the digital series. The publication will include all the editorials and art published online, and aims to preserve the series in posterity, ensuring that these reflections and insights into this moment of Canadian history are preserved. The publication will be available for purchase online and at select outlets across Canada.

Your support will ensure that the costs of creating the publication are covered, including those incurred in relation to graphic design and printing costs.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Examples of the commentary and editorials we have published so far:

Pamela Palmater — Harper’s 10 Year War on First Nations

 “…the Harper government stands out as one of the most racist and aggressive governments that First Nations have had to work with in many generations.”

Faisal Bhabha — Does Stephen Harper Care About Muslims?

"… an entire segment of the Canadian public have come to implicitly understand that they’re at risk of being the object of unfair suspicion or contempt. This is what it means to be a hyper-visible and distrusted minority. This is what it means to be Canadian Muslim during the Harper decade."

Ryan Meili — What We Don’t Know Will Hurt Us

“Decades of focus on a narrow economistic set of goals for Canada have resulted in minimal increases in quality of life and worsening circumstances for many Canadians. Our rankings in comparison to other OECD countries are among the lowest in many social factors, and our health outcomes are declining accordingly over time.” 

Lisa Kerr & Anthony Doob — The Conservative Take on Crime Policy 

"With the Conservative politicization of the field of criminal justice we have seen an uptick in rates of imprisonment, an increase in the severity of the punishment experience, and a new reliance on crime as a salient topic with which to mobilize political support. Harper’s Conservatives have overseen decisions to close prison farms, fire prison chaplains, strip judges of sentencing discretion, and increase the use of solitary confinement. The overrepresentation of indigenous people in our jails and prisons – already a problem under past governments – has also become worse during Conservative rule." 

David Schindler — The Erosion of Environmental Protection and Public Environmental Information

“…some of the world’s top experts in their fields are being told what to say by non- scientist PMO appointees. The last time I have seen such ideologically driven actions was in the former Soviet Union…”

story:
Short Summary

As an Industrial Designer, my job is to bring ideas to life. Somehow, that translated into bringing my Plushie Heroes came about by somehow bringing my travel companion to life through storytelling. Years ago, when I left home to study in Europe, I took my plushie travel companion with me. Everytime I would come back home, my little cousins would ask me about the adventures that Tyler had, while I was in school. I would make up bedtime stories for them and this tradition somehow brought Tyler to life. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Plushie Heroes has been on the works for years. It started out with a thought of turning my travel companion into the next "Winnie the Pooh." The first story has been written, and the illustrations have been drafted. To keep moving forward we need help with printing costs.  

We've tested out the charm of a plushie by creating a social media account, and have proudly gained a little bit of popularity within the community. We've even gained real friends and pen pals throughout the process. 

 

The Impact

Children's books are so important in a child's early development. Children's toys also earn a special bond with babies as they grow up. Using a plushie as a voice to teach kindness and life lessons can be effective.  For us this is just the beginning, we think that Plushie Heroes can be a series of stories, and one that we hope can be a part of future generation's lives. 

 

Risks & Challenges

We've never done a project like this before. As designers we're equipped with storytelling and problem-solving skills that comes in handy as we push through every challenges that a crowdfunding campaign and publishing a book might throw at us. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us make some noise about our campaign! We'll make sure to give you a shoutout on our instagram account just by sharing. We truly appreciate it. 

@tylersadventure #plushieheroes

story:
My name is J.T. McDaniel, and I write. I write books, I write plays, and now and then I write the odd essay. I'm officially retired, so I don't have much income these days. Back in the late 1960s, I did a tour in Vietnam with the 1st Aviation Brigade and the 101st Airborne Division. More recently, I've been a newspaper editor, an actor, and one of those nameless guys sitting in a cubicle. I also narrate audiobooks, though I don't plan to narrate the one I'm currently writing.

So, what's this campaign about? I'm writing a book. It's called Returning, and it's set 109 years in the future. When a giant spaceship shows up in orbit, people react differently. The Russians wonder if it's the prelude to an invasion. The British are nervous, but calm. The Americans dismiss it as propaganda, despite the fact that the ship is so big it can be seen from the ground without a telescope. It can't be real, the Americans say, because the people aboard it claim to come from the earth of 87,000 years ago, and everyone knows the earth is barely 6,000 years old. (Read excerpts on my official site.)

Why do I need money? Silly question, really. Authors like to eat. More pertinently, publishing a book means there are editing expenses, living expenses while writing (that eating thing), cover artists like to be paid, and, if you're doing a fund-raising campaign, there are perks to be paid for. 

What sort of perks? For starters, everyone who contributes anything gets his/her name in the contributors section of the book. There will be thank you cards, digital and paperback copies of the finished book, tee-shirts, polo shirts, and even a few leather-bound copies for particularly generous patrons of the arts.

This started out as a fairly straightforward science fiction adventure book, if perhaps a little unusual in having a female starship captain. But I couldn't help noticing the trend in this country, the tendency for too many people to prefer an authoritarian solution to every problem, and the increasingly strong efforts of the religious right to force everyone else to comply with their views on every subject. Then, too, there is the new regime, which so far seems bent on running the country as a business. It sounds good in the abstract, but when actually applied the results are likely to be appalling, as government begins to value the citizenry not as individuals, but as disposable parts in a machine, to be discarded once they become old or infirm. The United States of Returning simply takes these tendencies and allows them to reach the inevitable result if they're not stopped. An evangelist has been President for 29 years, having or performing an abortion will get you executed, as will any homosexual conduct. Everyone pays an annual tax that goes, not to the government, but to their church. Blasphemy is punishable by jail time. A corner of Wyoming, invisible in all satellite images, contains a vast compound that has become the last stop for anyone who causes the government too much trouble. And a 15-year-old girl from Denver, who unwittingly becomes the first person to talk to the returning space travelers via HAM radio, ends up having the adventure of a lifetime once she manages to escape.

Why $10,000? Simply put, it's a combination of production needs and living expenses. Social Security doesn't pay very much. Good covers help book sales, but I think it's fairly obvious I'm not the best cover designer, nor do I have the artistic skills needed to pull off what this book needs. All books need editing. The audio version of this book will need a narrator, and while I do that sort thing, in this case I think a woman would be more appropriate.  

What happens if the goal isn't met? Obviously, I hope that it will be met, or even exceeded. Even if it isn't, it all helps. Everyone who contributes will still get their name in the book, and on my official website. Perks will still be produced and distributed. Things like cards and shirts should be sent out within 30 days of the campaign's end. Books may take a bit longer, since there's still some writing to do, and there's editing and production after that. 

This book has an important story to tell. While it's wrapped in a science fiction tale, the story serves as a reminder that people, even politicians, sometimes mean exactly what they say. It's a reminder that "he's just saying that to get elected" isn't a reliable predictor of outcomes. Germans said that about Hitler's anti-Semitism, after all, and it turned out he meant it. It's a reminder that any democracy is a fragile thing, that people are too often willing to trade freedom for security (or the illusion of security). It's a reminder that many prefer an authoritarian government, which relieves them of the need to think, and that even "good" people can do horrible things in the name of conformity.

story:
Summary

BlunderWoman Productions is creating an audiobook that's a collection of diverse voices, narrated by professional actors, that tell stories of triumph. We're seeking submissions and hoping for pieces that together create a lovely audio story about being YOU, whoever that is. 

  • BlunderWoman Productions is owned and operated by award-winning narrator, Tanya Eby. This will be the first fully original production. 
  • We're hoping to cover production costs by fundraising. Any money received over the production cost will be donated to Planned Parenthood. 
  • After the audiobook is produced, profits will be used to create an eBook version of the collection. 25% of profits will be donated to Planned Parenthood. If there's anything left, we'll use profits to create future audiobook productions. 

But We Need Help To Make This Happen

We're fundraising to cover the significant expense of producing an original audiobook. Currently, funds will be provided solely by BlunderWoman Productions, a fledgling company without any capital. This production is important. Here's what we're trying to cover:

  • $1,000 to pay the writers. We are offering $50.00 to each participating writer
  • $2,000 to pay professional narrators (total) based on run time of book and paying industry standard
  • $1,000 to pay for post-production, i.e. editing, proofing, engineering post work
  • $250 to pay for a cover
  • $250 to pay for music 

We're not looking for profit through this campaign. We just want to cover expenses. Any money raised by this campaign that is over our production costs, will be donated to Planned Parenthood. 

The Impact

Stories are important. Stories help us understand our world and experience in it.

In the political environment we're living in, there's so much anger and shouting...and we want to offer something that's beautiful and told with a quiet strength. This is a chance to sort of sit across from someone and listen to their story. This collection is not a protest so much as it is a proclamation of the many different stories and truths that people are living today.

Stories can change lives.

We hope this audiobook will have an emotional impact. 

By seeking submissions from different writers, by using different narrators, by adding music in between the stories, and creating a cover, we're coming together and producing something important and real. And we'd love you to be a part of that. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't support this financially, that's okay! Even just sharing this campaign with others is a BIG help.
  • Consider submitting your own, original poem, blog or essay, or short story to BlunderWoman Productions. See here for more details: https://www.blunderwomanproductions.com/call-for-submissions/
  • Listen to the finished audiobook.

Thank you for help in this. We really appreciate any support we receive. We're so looking forward to sharing this collection with the world.

story:
Help us Share Daphne's Coloring Book

  • Karen Black : Artist & Author lives in Sullivan County, Pa. Although Self-taught during childhood, Karen received training from Masters from Society of Decorative Painting and a private Atelier. Karen specializes in murals, miniatures, and commissions of all sorts, and writing historical non-fiction. She loves the challenges of various mediums and venues.
  • Kathleen Godwin : A child of Swedish immigrants grew up immersed in the arts of all kinds. Her sisters and Kathleen, when young, performed as the Jonsonn Sisters. In college she fell in love and married a brilliant creative Irishman. After 31 years and his passing Kathleen moved to Southeastern Pennsylvania and still enjoys theater, music, song and dance.
  •  Daphne was born one memorable evening and her subsequent sporadic appearances during Kathleen's first marriage were always joyful, sometimes hilariously funny, occasionally bittersweet, but  always appreciated.  
  • Coloring Book : By creating an adult coloring book we hope to share with as many people as possible Daphne's joy and fun and help bring stress relief in this hectic world. Once the book is colored it can be used as a story book. Imagine a storybook that you colored yourself! How fun! You can enjoy it again and again.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Kathleen and I need $500 to print the minimum of 250 coloring books.  They will be 34 pages of fun and adventure to color. We know it's a meager sum, but we are hoping you will help us bring Daphne to print through the donations levels listed. If we go over the $500 we will print as many copies as the monies allow.
  • $15 USD +shipping : With a $15 donation you will receive a personalized copy of Daphne's Coloring Book. Karen will sign the inside cover with a personal message.  Relieve your stress with hours of coloring fun. Thanks for making this project happen.
  • $20 USD + shipping : With a $20 donation you will receive your personalized copy of Daphne's coloring book PLUS an exclusive 4 pack of Postcard Prints of Karen's work. You will be able to choose your set of postcards. Thanks for making this project become a reality!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal the money will be used to cover miscellaneous costs like copyright fees, ISBN Number, and prototype printing costs.

The Impact

  • The publication of Daphne would mean so much to us both. To see an idea from a creative mind and make it a visually enjoyable for young and old is an honor beyond compare. I hope this whimsical house fairy brings a smile to anyone who colors in her book.
  • Karen has published coloring books before through private funding and they have been well received in their target audience. Creating an Indiegogo  campaign is new to both of us and very exciting.  Karen, being retired, and on limited income Indiegogo seems a great way to continue sharing my artistic and creative books with the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that's okay. You can do these things for Daphne:

  • Ask friends and family to get the word out. Please share on all your social medias about our whimsical coloring book.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! Thanks so much for your help!

story:
Why Now?

Over these last 20 years, I have observed several other local LGBT publications from the regional mags (Guide, 99) to Seattle focused (Seattle Gay Standard, Mo' Magazine) and have weighed the pros and cons. Is print media truly dead? Hell No! Is blogging and online social media the only way to go? Yes and no: All it needs is a strategic business model.

I personally have experience in all aspects of journalism going all the way back to 1991 including TV, radio, film, print and blogging. I have been fortunate this past year to learn the publishing business from the master, George Bakan, as a contributor to the Seattle Gay News (SGN). Since the new magazine will be quarterly, I will continue working for the SGN.

  • Member of NLGJA since 2003
  • Past Member of the GSBA 2000, 2001,2002, 2004, 2010
  • Media Sponsor of GLAAD since 2010

Brian has spent the last 18 years at Business Wire, a news wire service. The first 15 years as a copy editor, and the last 3 years as a client services representative. He will serve as Unite Seattle Magazine’s Operations Manager.

So, how will this work? The Daily Online (blog/social media) will be all about breaking news, E-newsletters and reviews (FREE to all users).

The Quarterly print edition will be devoted to features (Interviews and Investigative pieces): columns, Serial short stories, Business and non-profit profiles, and more.  (Available by subscription and news stands at cost)

  • In-depth Interviews
  • Investigative Features
  • Business Spotlight
  • Movers and Shakers
  • Informative Columns
  • Dining and Recipes
  • NW Celebs
  • PRINT and DIGITAL Advertising

Bill Anderson has signed on as associate publisher and advertising director and most likely has reached out by now. After spending two years of building up Edible Seattle (20,000 copies) and then Edible Portland (20,000 copies) as Executive Publisher, Bill has agreed to spend the next two years building up Unite Seattle Magazine. 

Besides print, our website will have breaking news, reviews and multi-media, as well as online advertising. Bill served as VP of Sales for Gaytravel.com for 9 years. So far the response has been positive – the need for this kind of glossy LGBTQA magazine is clear. Even The Stranger is transitioning to a similar business model in the fall.

UPDATE: 6 pages of advertising have been sold so far.

Most of the revenue won’t be available until early October. We would love to get your support to raise between $5,000 and $10,000 to pay our marketing team and launch our website.

Some Great Perks include:

Be on the Cover or Create an issue, plus so much more!

With these troubled times, the timing for Unite couldn’t be better – the need for UNITY comes now. There are changes and new eras happening and I promise you Unite Seattle will be at the forefront of them.

  • To print quarterly with a new creative team for each issue at least the first year or two.
  • To be LGBT Certified with the National Gay Chamber of commerce to reach the large  database in order to secure advertising contracts with Fortune 500 and Government agencies.
  • To Print Fresh content, available nowhere else and stay exclusive and timely.
  • To Partner with all media platforms.
  • To provide training opportunities to design and communications students.

Embarking this year as a newly engaged couple, we hope you will join us on our journey in being part of the Unite family.

To learn more, please email or call us at unitesea@gmail.com or 206.306.5995. It is time to Unite the community!

story:
Artdigiland books is an Irish-based publisher dedicated to cinema, theatre, performance and visual arts, in contact with the Italian Cultural Institut in Dublin, too.

We would like to introduce our new editorial project: it is an interview-book (to be released in October 2017) to cinematographer Luciano Tovoli. The volume, entitled On Suspiria and Beyond: A Conversation with Cinematographer Luciano Tovoli, edited by Piercesare Stagni and Valentina Valente, will be issued worldwide (Italian and English version) during the release of the blue ray of a new restoration of the film Suspiria by Dario Argento, supervised by Tovoli himself and realized by the American company Synapse Films.  

Luciano Tovoli (AIC ASC) has worked with very famous directors, such as Michelangelo Antonioni, Marco Ferreri, Ettore Scola, Luigi Comencini, Liliana Cavani, Barbet Schroeder, Vittorio De Seta, Dario Argento and more. He has been awarded with two silver ribbon prizes, in 1976 for The Passenger by Antonioni and in 1989 for Splendor by Scola, plus a David di Donatello award for Scola's Captain Fracassa's Journey (1990).

The volume retraces all the stages of making Suspiria from test shots to printing. It describes in detail the making of various sequences, relations with the director, explores the cultural premises of this immortal work and the historical context of the struggle for innovation in the cinematography of the Seventies. Above all, it reveals Luciano Tovoli's passion and tireless search for an expressive use of color in films, providing us with a first-hand experience of an incredible adventure in aesthetics.

We need help to pay for the translators, the graphics, the images' copyrights: in fact, we need support just to cover our outcomes. And your support will make this work become a published and readable book!
We offer for each investor a pre-sale of the book at 25€ instead of 35€ (final cost after the end of this campaign).

Please,  get the word out and make some noise about On Suspiria and Beyond's crowdfunding campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you!

story:
Desde hace siete años, La Silla ha hecho un esfuerzo muy grande para mantenerse fiel a su misión de contar todo lo que sabe y saber todo lo que cuenta sobre cómo se mueve el poder en Colombia. Es un esfuerzo que todo el equipo de La Silla hace con mucha pasión y felicidad.

Es un esfuerzo que también cuesta plata. Operar La Silla Vacía y sus regionales nos costó el año pasado 1.500 millones de pesos. La mitad de esa financiación viene de cooperación internacional. El resto, de pauta, de las alianzas para patrocinar La Silla Llena, de charlas y talleres, de los debates del Sí y No, del servicio de IQ para las universidades y de los Súper Amigos.

Sabemos que, en general, no existe una cultura de donación en Colombia y que los que lo hacen ya le donan plata a gente que lo necesita más que La Silla para sobrevivir.

Sin embargo, el argumento para convencerlo de volverse o de seguir siendo Súper Amigo de La Silla es que la única forma en que uno viva algún día en un país en el que se sienta orgulloso de vivir es ayudando activamente a construirlo.  

Si usted cree que su vida y el país es un poquito mejor si existe un medio como La Silla, que haga el esfuerzo por investigar qué es realmente lo que sucede, independientemente de que lo que descubra le guste a Santos, a Uribe, a Vargas, a las Farc o incluso a los mismos usuarios, vale la pena apoyarnos.

Si le gusta leer textos todos los días que le cuenten la historia completa, que estén redactados con cuidado, que tengan información verificada, y que parta del supuesto de que la gente que nos lee es inteligente, vale la pena apoyarnos.

El año que viene va a ser un año de transición complejo. El tránsito de las Farc de un grupo armado a un partido político, el arranque de la campaña presidencial del 2018, el fin del gobierno de Santos, el cambio de Obama por Trump y la irrupción del conservadurismo social en la política implicarán grandes cambios en la configuración del poder en Colombia. La Silla intentará tener la mejor información sobre lo que se mueve detrás.

Con los fondos que recaudemos haremos una serie de investigaciones en profundidad sobre temas que discutiremos con nuestros Súper Amigos.

Dénos la mano. No importa qué tan pequeña o tan grande sea su donación. Que usted se vuelva nuestro Súper Amigo nos confirmará que lo que hacemos vale la pena. 

Un abrazo y gracias de antemano,

Juanita León
story_txt: Desde hace siete años, La Silla ha hecho un esfuerzo muy grande para mantenerse fiel a su misión de contar todo lo que sabe y saber todo lo que cuenta sobre cómo se mueve el poder en Colombia. Es un esfuerzo que todo el equipo de La Silla hace con mucha pasión y felicidad.Es un esfuerzo que también cuesta plata. Operar La Silla Vacía y sus regionales nos costó el año pasado 1.500 millones de pesos. La mitad de esa financiación viene de cooperación internacional. El resto, de pauta, de las alianzas para patrocinar La Silla Llena, de charlas y talleres, de los debates del Sí y No, del servicio de IQ para las universidades y de los Súper Amigos.Sabemos que, en general, no existe una cultura de donación en Colombia y que los que lo hacen ya le donan plata a gente que lo necesita más que La Silla para sobrevivir.Sin embargo, el argumento para convencerlo de volverse o de seguir siendo Súper Amigo de La Silla es que la única forma en que uno viva algún día en un país en el que se sienta orgulloso de vivir es ayudando activamente a construirlo.  Si usted cree que su vida y el país es un poquito mejor si existe un medio como La Silla, que haga el esfuerzo por investigar qué es realmente lo que sucede, independientemente de que lo que descubra le guste a Santos, a Uribe, a Vargas, a las Farc o incluso a los mismos usuarios, vale la pena apoyarnos.Si le gusta leer textos todos los días que le cuenten la historia completa, que estén redactados con cuidado, que tengan información verificada, y que parta del supuesto de que la gente que nos lee es inteligente, vale la pena apoyarnos.El año que viene va a ser un año de transición complejo. story:
The history of this book 
 

Hi, my name is Sabine Wojcieszak. Since 1992 I am working with people on topics like communication, teamwork, soft skills and leadership. A few years ago I stumbled into the tech business by "accident" and discovered that the occurring problems in tech teams are nearly the same as in other businesses but the solutions have to differ because of the history and development of tech and the individuals working in it.

New methodologies and their effects on the individuals

With doing some research on the tech industry I found out that this business struggles with issues like depression, burn out, other mental illnesses and psychosomatic disorders above the average of all industries. This surprised me very much, because most people working in "tech" have made their hobby to their profession - which is some kind of living your dream.

But with diving deeper into the field of software development I found out that the jobs are permanently and rapidly changing - not only according to the tools and programming languages. 

 

All the new hyped agile methods like Scrum, Devops, pair programming and others are changing the process of software development - and new demands on the soft skills of each single individual popped up. The changing frameworks needed a new typ of employee as well as a new kind of leader. The "lonesome fighter" should now be a teamplayer; the introvert developer should start to communicate openly; the top developer should be a leader and coach; the "number crunching" manager should become a servant leader. The goal was and still is to deliver software "better and faster". Numerous companies adopted or tried to adopt those approaches by only concentrating on the processes and tools and not on the fundaments of these systems like culture and soft skills. The gap between what teams and people are able to achieve and what is really needed sometimes looks more like the Gran Canyon. The result was that a lot of attempts of going agile, Scrum or Devops failed. In other teams agile approaches are not running in a proper way so that they are not able to work at their optimum because the second, but game changing  goal of making working happier and healthier has been neglected.

Communication matters!

Communication is the key to teamwork - in a good way as well as in a negative way!

But communication is more than just talking. It is about listening; it is about perception , respect and tolerance. And a good communication can build trust - really important for successful teamwork! Feedback is a necessary tool for continuous improvement - but it is only possible with a good communication culture and accepted values ! Leadership and change also demand a well working communication. And at least there is also the topic of meetings - which could be time guzzlers or productive come togethers - where communication is essential. At many points a good communication can save time and money with bringing simultaneously more fun, happiness, motivation and success to the team and the company by causing more engagement instead of only compliance. More engagement and motivation will again save more time and bring more and better ideas to the team. The loop of continuous improvement may start!

What´s new about the book?

As teams in the tech industry have other main and important tasks than becoming "communication experts", I prefer a lightweight way to improve their skills.

You can spend thousands of Euros and months of precious working time in becoming an expert in one special communication tool if you really like it or need it from the professional point of view. But in most cases some smart and slight changes will have unbelievable effects on the team.

I believe it is more important for being successful in an agile environment to have a holistic view on communication so that you can create and develop your own ideas and approaches which will fit to the individuals, to the situation and - to you. Whenever individuals should work together there is no one-size-fits-all-solution. But with a little help everyone is able to evolve the individual communication skills.

This book will not concentrate on one single communication approach. It will rather focus on real daily work situations I have experienced during my work as a consultant as well as on the results of the survey - an other way of contribution for this project. These real life experiences will be mixed up in the sample company of my book - called "Lorem Ipsum Ltd.", which is a mid-size software development company with around fifteen employees. I have chosen this company size because they struggle with those issues in a totally different way than all those big players or "unicorns". And they have to find other solutions to keep their business alive.

Examples will include face-to-face communication as well as communication in distributed teams. In this book I will show possible effects of emojis and the exorbitant use of shortcuts and acronyms. It will also deal with communication via Collaboration Software like Issue Trackers, Blogs, Messengers or Slack channels. The book will give an insight on absolutely "no-gos" in communication as well as on the difficulties of communication between different stakeholder groups. The reader will see how important it is to listen  and perceive very well to decode the implicit messages. With this book I will emphasise that a good communication is always a question of personal attitude and that it is always depending on both parts - sender as well as receiver!

There will be examples of feedback as a blame game and what to do to turn it into a game changer. I will highlight the topic of meetings where a lot of companies burn not only money but also motivation and the opportunity for more efficiency.

To all described dysfunctional situations the book will try to explain what has happened. It will show (a) possible solution(s), the readers can try to adopt or to customise for their individual purposes. 

In addition to this book you can download some open sources team exercises, posters and templates for your team - free for readers as well as none-readers!

As I am not a native speaker the book will be proofread by an American lady. For getting helpful feedback each chapter of the book will be sent to a bunch of  "people working tech" all over the world, which will include different cultural backgrounds and point of views.

The NerdShirt Challenge is another way of contribution. People from the tech industry can send in a picture of them wearing their favourite NerdShirt. I will publish a selection of those NerdShirts in the book. All pictures will be published on my instagram account.

Why do I run this NerdShirt Challenge and the survey?

It is a book for the tech community with the contribution of the tech community and their experiences! This may help readers to identify themselves with special situations and transfer possible solutions to their own teams. 

The question of money

Giving money has always to do with trust and with believing in something and / or somebody.

My goal is to collect € 8.500 for this project. This money will be spent to give me enough time to run the survey, evaluate it and build in the incoming examples. 

I want to publish this book latest in March 2018. It will be self-published by Books on Demand as a print version and as an ebook. The book will be a full-colored book with about 250+ pages. The price for the print version will be between € 35 and € 40. 

To promote this book beforehand I have to speak up at different conferences which is always linked to "days with no income" and travel expenses.

Due to the fact that I am not a native english speaker I need to pay for a proofreader to find the mistakes, look up for my grammar and polish some of my formulations.

After the "release" of the book I will have to send out or raffle free examples for further promotion, so that the whole campaign will be a success.

As there will be numerous downloads "for free". The money is also a contribution to this open source area of the project.

Ways of contribution

There are different ways of contribution.

1. You can spend some money on the project and help me to realise it. There are different levels you can choose. You want to give money, but don´t have a credit card or don´t want to present details? No problem, just send me an email and we will find another way for you as indiegogo,com doesn't´t support paypal anymore.  sabine@think-be-act-agile.link

2. Send me a picture of yourself with your favourite #NerdShirt. For more information please follow the link:

http://www.think-be-act-agile.link/nerd-shirt-c...

3. Take part at the survey and give me some insights of your personal experience on daily team communication. For this way of contribution please follow the link below:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1bULOQ0Sdp7qqse0MXLzoDYn6trLoWLfKRQL3kwxO2_8/edit

4. Share this link to my crowdfunding project on your social medias, tell it to your friends, colleagues, managers...to the whole world!

To be honest I will also appreciate if you contribute in more than one way!

What you get out of it!

First of all, all contributors will be listed up on my website

http://www.think-be-act-agile.link/credits/

, on this indiegogo crowdfunding site and in the book.

Contributors to the #NerdShirt Challenge will be named on the instagram account

https://www.instagram.com/sabine_wojcieszak/.

Those who will be published in the book, will also find their names in the book. It will be the same with the contributors to the survey.

Depending on the level of monetary contribution there are different perks: It starts with a free ebook after the release, books, shirts with self-designed quotes related to communication and team, books with signature, bundles of books and ebooks and - for companies - a whole page in the book for their advertisement.

You will save money if you contribute now and get the book later!

No credit card, but want to back?

Don´t worry, just send me an email via sabine@think-be-act-agile.link and we will find a solution!

In the End

Please help to make this book come true! If you decide to contribute you will help me to deliver content faster! And with delivering faster, tech teams will sooner be able to evolve their communication culture for more happiness, health and SUCCESS!

Thank you!

Sabine

story:
Short Summary

Queer & Trans Artists of Color, Volume 2 is a collection of Nia King's interviews with 16 different LGBTQ POC artists edited by Elena Rose. Artists interviewed include Juba Kalamka, micha cárdenas, Grace Rosario Perkins, Elena Rose, Indira Allegra, Amir Rabiyah, Mimi Thi Nguyen, Lexi Adsit, Tina Takemoto, Ajuan Mance, Martin Sorrondeguy, Trish Salah, Cherry Galette, Mattie Brice, Vivek Shraya, and Kiley May.

After over a year of working on the book, we finally released it in October 2016!

The book is self-published. In addition to writing, editing, promoting, and distributing the book, we also book our own tours: finding QTPOC artists in different cities to read with us, buying plane tickets, booking hotels, shipping books to the venues, making sure everyone has what they need to put on a great show and that everyone gets paid in a timely manner. We just finished doing this on the West Coast with a Seattle/Portland/LA tour. Please help us raise the money we need to bring our work to queer and trans communities of color on the East Coast!

About us:

  • Nia King is a queer Black, Lebanese, and Hungarian artist and activist living in Oakland, CA. She is the host of We Want the Airwaves podcast and the author of Queer & Trans Artists of Color: Stories of Some of Our Lives.
  • Elena Rose, a Filipina-Ashkenazi trans lesbian mestiza, rode stories out of rural Oregon and hasn’t stopped telling since. As an ordained minister, writer, and organizer, she has been published in magazines including Aorta and Make/shift, co-founded the Speak! Radical Women of Color Media Collective, co-curated the acclaimed National Queer Arts Festival show Girl Talk: A Trans and Cis Women’s Dialogue, works as a nationally-recognized interfaith educator on justice issues, and serves on the boards of the Solar Cross Temple and the Church for the Fellowship of All Peoples.

We have just spent a year obsessing over every sentence, every word, and every piece of punctuation in this book. Help us celebrate finally having it out in the world!

We believe that QTPOC telling their own stories in their own words and making those stories available to other QTPOC is what helps to sustain us in difficult times. Please help us make sure this book reaches the people that need it. <3 <3 <3

Where the money goes:

  • $2000 - paying local QTPOC artists in different cities to perform with us
  • $1200 - tickets to and from the East Coast for two
  • $650 - literally the cheapest hotels we could find in NYC, Philly, and Baltimore (We both have chronic pain so sleeping on floors and couches is not an option.)
  • $600 - indiegogo fees, making perks and shipping perks to donors
  • $500 - breakfast, lunch, and dinner for 8 days on the road
  • $400 - books to sell at readings
  • $350 - transportation from city to city
  • $300 - transportation within each city

The Impact

Every dollar counts in helping us get from Oakland to Boston, NYC, Philly, Baltimore, and back. This isn't just about selling books. It's about creating opportunities for queer and trans artists of color opportunities to perform for receptive audiences and get paid. So often we get asked to read/work for free. Help us create a norm of PAYING ARTISTS in our activist communities.

We have done several indiegogo campaigns before and we always deliver. Your perks will be delivered to you as soon as we are able to ship them.

Risks & Challenges

We recently toured the West Coast and it was the first tour I (Nia King) had ever produced. It was a lot more money and a lot more work than I anticipated, but overall it was a success. The line-up of QTPOC artists in each city was amazing and even on rainy days, so many people came out to see us! All of the artists got paid, everyone on tour got fed well, and had a safe place to stay every night. This is why, even though touring is exhausting, I can't wait to do it again.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's totally OK if you can't give right now or even this month. Here are some non-monetary ways you can support the project:

  • Share this campaign on social media. Tell your friends about this worthwhile cause!
  • If you already have Queer & Trans Artists of Color, Volume 2, PLEASE take a selfie with it and post it on social media with a link to this campaign. Tag us in the post if possible. Nia King is @artactivistnia on Twitter. Elena Rose is @burnlittlelight.
  • If you already have the book, please leave a nice review of the book on Amazon or GoodReads.
  • If you live in Philly and work at a venue that might be willing to host us (or better yet, pay us), please hit me up at niaking (at) zoho (dot) com. We already have venues confirmed for Boston, NYC and Baltimore.
  • BTW, have you heard We Want the Airwaves, the podcast these books are based on? Check it out on iTunes or LibSyn.

Thank you! <3 <3 <3

It's about creating opportunities for queer and trans artists of color opportunities to perform for receptive audiences and get paid. So often we get asked to read/work for free. Help us create a norm of PAYING ARTISTS in our activist communities.
We have done several indiegogo campaigns before and we always deliver. Your perks will be delivered to you as soon as we are able to ship them.

Risks & Challenges
We recently toured the West Coast and it was the first tour I (Nia King) had ever produced. It was a lot more money and a lot more work than I anticipated, but overall it was a success. The line-up of QTPOC artists in each city was amazing and even on rainy days, so many people came out to see us! All of the artists got paid, everyone on tour got fed well, and had a safe place to stay every night. This is why, even though touring is exhausting, I can't wait to do it again.

Other Ways You Can Help
It's totally OK if you can't give right now or even this month. Here are some non-monetary ways you can support the project:

Share this campaign on social media. Tell your friends about this worthwhile cause!

If you already have Queer & Trans Artists of Color, Volume 2, PLEASE take a selfie with it and post it on social media with a link to this campaign. Tag us in the post if possible. Nia King is @artactivistnia on Twitter. Elena Rose is @burnlittlelight.
If you already have the book, please leave a nice review of the book on Amazon or GoodReads.
If you live in Philly and work at a venue that might be willing to host us (or better yet, pay us), please hit me up at niaking (at) zoho (dot) com. We already have venues confirmed for Boston, NYC and Baltimore.
BTW, have you heard We Want the Airwaves, the podcast these books are based on? Check it out on iTunes or LibSyn.

Thank you! <3 <3 <3

story:
My name is Erin, and I'm a writer. Sugar and Scales will be my second book. It's a collaborative project, working with various female artists to illustrate my short story/ poetry style pieces about all things feminism. We want to educate people and help women in difficult situations. From child marriage, domestic abuse, non-white feminism, body issues and more, this is not art that holds back.

Funding from Indiegogo would do two major things- help with the costs of printing and of course, paying the artists for their work. This is an important time to speak out and help others, and I want to pay people for their hard work.

A percentage of book sales is going to go to a women's charity. I practice what I preach, and helping women is what this book is all about.

Any donations to help fund this publication are so hugely appreciated, and even if the final target is not met, the funds will still be put towards costs of publishing. If you can't donate, that's fine! Just sharing this campaing to social media is a huge help, and just as hugely appreciated.

Thanks for taking the time to read this, and thank you for supporting art.

story:
Hi! I'm Gracy Yap, an Intuitive Master Numerologist, author and teacher with a passion for touching lives. I am reaching out to my friends and supporters for crowdfunding my latest non-fiction book project.The idea for a baby name book was sparked by coffee with friends at a private maternity hospital last year, followed by a baby name numerology reading and an obsession with baby names. So I wrote and released my first baby name ebook "Destined For Greatness: The Most Popular Baby Boy Names Decoded" in February this year on the Amazon Kindle Store. It soon became a bestseller on the Top 100 Paid list for Numerology and Baby Names. I have since started work on a baby name guide for girls. This time I decided to put the romance back into books and produce a paperback (which can be an expensive exercise). This is where you come in. You can be a backer to bring my next book to life.

What We Are Hoping To Raise:

- Our Funding Goal is USD10,000.

- I have already completed my book manuscript and I have print ready printing materials (Artwork).

- I don't foresee any challenges in production as I've already set up my CreateSpace account and passed the Book Review process.

- Once the basic goal of a minimum USD3000 is reached to cover basic printing and design costs for 500 copies, we are good to go! I'm really excited!

story:
Chers riders , amis , famille ou extraterrestre

Je m’appelle Quentin , je pratique le wakeboard depuis 8 ans et cela fais 2 ans que je développe un projet . Mon parcours est simple , je me suis orienté dans différentes filières pour acquérir des compétences . Rien ne me laissait penser que de cuisinier j’allais passer a militaire puis responsable de magasin à coach et de moniteur accro branche à opérateur wakepark .J’ai toujours aimé être au service des autres et j’aimerais continuer au travers de ma discipline . D’abord c’était un rêve de gamin , ensuite un projet professionnel qui favorise le contact avec le public par le biais de cette activité et qui me laisse un champ d’action large pour proposer différents services . Aujourd'hui j’imagine une structure qui me permet d’accueillir des personnes , les orienter et leur offrir la possibilité de pratiquer un sport ludique et chaleureux . J’aime le contact humain et rien ne me ferait plus plaisir que de les recevoir à grande échelle sur une surface de 24000 m2

Mon projet est de reprendre l’afa wakepark de wittenheim et de le dynamiser dans un but collectif , démocratiser le wakeboard et les sports aquatiques en alsace .

Je fais cette campagne de financement dans le but de constituer des fonds qui me permettront d’assurer l’ouverture pour le printemps prochain .

J’ai besoin d’un coup de pouce de 3500 € pour :

- Des révisions sont à effectuer sur le matériel , pour assurer le bon fonctionnement de la future saison .

- Des aménagements sont à prévoir pour accueillir un public en plein air dans des conditions optimales .( bien-être du client )

- Création d’une partie chill ( détente ) avec musique , boissons , canapés , tables , abris et scène .

- Entretien et création de modules pour faire des figures ( kicker , flat barre …)

Des contreparties vous seront offertes à la hauteur de vos dons ( goodies ; T-shirt ; session ; abonnement …) à la soirée d’inauguration ou envoyées si vous habitez à l’autre bout de la planète .

Si l’objectif de la cagnotte n’est pas atteint a 100% les dons seront mis de coté pour, un jour, réaliser mon rêve : tenir mon propre wakepark

Si ce projet qui me tient à coeur vous parle je vous invite à passer le mot et diffuser le lien de la page avec les outils de partage de indiegogo .

Merci d'avance à tous !!!

story:
Kyle Bosman is a member of the Easy Allies and frequently streams Tetris every Friday. His aim is to beat a score submitted by Steve Wozniak to Nintendo power, despite never having come remotely close. During one stream, he stated that he wishes he had poetry to express his feelings for Tetris. It is the aim of this project to fulfill that wish. 

My intent is to create a poetry book along with other members of the Easy Allies community, have it professionally printed, send it to Steve Wozniak to personally sign and dedicate, and mail it to the Allies.

Its a pleasure working with all of you, and I hope that we will create something truly marvelous.

To see an early  draft of the Book PDF, please go to https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B3KBqUy4yfukN...

As for money, 500 is the minimum I could ask for on Indiegogo, and the sum takes into account the fees of the indiegogo platform itself. if we do not make the goal, I will still use the funds to produce whatever is possible. Cash Breakdown below

story:
If you are reading this then it’s likely you’ve been searching for answers for your neck pain. Answers that, up to this point, you’ve been unable to find or have not worked for you. I’m sure your journey has been a long and painful one and I truly feel for you - I’ve been there myself (yes, physiotherapists experience pain too).

 

If you can no longer do the things you love, your relationships have suffered or you're just not enjoying life as much because of your neck pain, then this book has been written for you.

 

Navigating health information can be tricky. Especially when you’re in pain. There is so much misinformation out there that it can feel like a total mine-field trying to decipher what to believe.

 

That is why I have created a simple 5-step approach to creating a pain-free and excellent neck. It is designed to cut through all of the complicated jargon & unscientific claims that you have been reading online and to give you a clear step-by-step plan to follow, based on both the latest science and tried-and-tested wisdom.

 

How I became The NECKspert 

 

Firstly, I should point out that I'm a physiotherapist and have dedicated my career to neck pain. But let's rewind a few years and I'll explain how I got here.

 

My first ever memory of neck pain was when I was about 5 years old. One night, I slept in front of a fan and the next morning I got out of bed, took my shirt off and my neck locked up. I couldn't move it for 3 days, it was incredibly painful, I missed the school athletics carnival (there were only 81 kids in my whole school, just 10 in my year, so I liked my chances at winning) and decided then and there that neck pain sucks.

 

As a teenager I was completely obsessed with surfing (and still am to this day), and given the demands of paddling for hours on the neck, I was no stranger to neck pain during my high-school years.

 

But my experience with truly crippling, life-impacting neck pain didn’t arrive until I was at university.

 

It seemed as though university was the perfect storm for my neck - hours and hours of sitting in lectures and studying with bad posture; lifting heavy weights in the gym to impress my new female classmates; incredibly high levels of stress and poor sleeping habits. By my second year at university I had developed chronic neck-pain, postural headaches, migraines and neck-related dizziness, which for a physiotherapy student seemed like a cruel irony.

 

I began seeking answers and treatment from my university lecturers, who were some of the brightest minds in neck research, but despite seeing over 10 different health professionals (physio’s, chiro’s, doctors, neurologists), not one of them was able to fix my neck.

 

After several months of failing to improve and thousands of dollars later (which for a self-funded university student felt like millions), I began to feel depressed. I started having anxiety attacks. My mental health was starting to reflect my physical health.

 

Rock-bottom came one day when one of my neck-related headaches progressed into a migraine with flashing lights, dizziness, crippling pain and I ended up in the office of a neurologist having CT scans on my neck and brain to see if I had a tumour. 

 

After an hour of sitting in his waiting room, nervously awaiting results, he came out to collect his next patient. As he was walking away I called out, “Any results yet doc?”. He looked back at me, searched his brain for who I was (despite seeing me just one hour earlier), and then replied nonchalantly, “Oh, results were all fine, you can leave”. 

 

I couldn’t believe that this was how a “specialist” treated his patients. 

 

“Is there anything you can do for me?” I asked. “I could give you a script for pain and migraine tablets if you want, but I don’t think you need them...”. He turned and walked away.

 

I have come to find that more often than not, our lowest points in life can light a fire inside us that provides a catalyst for change. They inspire massive action and set us on a new path. This was one of those days for me. At that moment I became determined to fix myself and also to focus my physio career on helping others who had struggled with neck-related pain and dysfunction.

 

Over the following months I began to implement the steps that you will come to learn about in the NECKcellent method. These steps were a trial-and-error blend of things I had learnt at university, strategies and concepts I had read about outside of the university walls, ideas and techniques I learnt through yoga and a dash of intuition.

 

It didn’t take long before the strategies I was implementing began to work. Within 2 weeks I felt better. Within 3 months my neck pain was gone. I still haven’t had a migraine in over 10 years.

 

With a new lease on life I forged ahead with my physiotherapy degree and upon graduating was awarded The University Medal (High Distinction average), The Dean’s Scholar Award (first place in the cohort) and went on to do an Honours Thesis where I wrote an academic paper on neck pain which was published in a medical journal. I tell you this not to boast or brag, but to reinforce my passion, hard work and drive in my field.

 

Over the past 10 years I have been honing and refining my treatment methods for fixing neck pain and creating healthy and strong necks. I have stayed true to my dedicated pursuit of helping as many people as possible live a life without neck pain. My physiotherapy clinics help thousands of people with neck pain every year, my corporate health company has taught thousands of people how to have a healthy neck at work, and I continue to work with schools to implement postural strength programs for their students.

 

Writing NECK PAIN SUCKS was the next logical step in achieving my mission as the NECKspert: To help 100,000 people achieve NECKcellence: a strong, pain-free and healthy neck forever.

 

The Book

I have structured the book very deliberately to ensure that you get better, and stay better:

 

Section 1 will give you a basic overview of the neck in terms of anatomy, all of its amazing functions and how all of the systems in the body are connected (especially to the neck).

 

We will also explore the concept of pain science and why there is much more to the complex experience of pain than meets the eye. I will also give you a framework for how to best approach the 5-steps to NECKcellence that will be explored in section 2, through the science of behaviour change and habit formation.

 

Section 2 will unveil the 5 practical aspects of achieving a pain-free, strong and healthy neck forever.

 

Section 3 explores life beyond pain, maintaining NECKcellence and ensuring your new healthy neck remains that way forever. In section 3, you will also learn the one true secret of how to heal your neck forever.

 

The reality is that everything in the body is connected. All systems. This means that everything within the body influences the health of our neck; alignment of the hips or feet, health of the gut, eye function, even our heart and lungs. The same is true in reverse; the health of the neck can and does influence every other system in our body! I’ll explain this in more detail in the book, but for now just take my word for it - the body is amazing!

 

With that in mind, it is worth noting that whilst this book is focused on the neck, the interconnectedness of everything in the body also means that many of the concepts and principles in this book can also be applied to other areas of pain in the body (e.g. lower back pain, knee pain, hip pain, shoulder pain and chronic diseases such as cardiovascular disease, gut and digestion disorders, and even mental health conditions such as depression and anxiety).

 

Let’s get started - I’m very excited about helping you achieve NECKcellence.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have decided to self-publish my book, so this fund-raising campaign is to cover the publications expenses.

The perks you can receive by contributing to the campaign can be found under the PERKS section of this page.

 

Risks & Challenges

The book has been written and is currently with the editor, so in terms of completion or delivery risks, there are none. There were some challenges in the creation of the book that I had to overcome, including how to communicate a vast amount of neck-related scientific research & literature in a simple, easy to understand and practical way. I believe I have achieved this, so that absolutely anybody can read this book, understand it and create a pain-free neck, regaining control of their mind, body and life.

story:
Why did cycling disappear from the streets of Johannesburg? How can the city get cycling right in the 21st century—and help to secure a sustainable future?

These are the questions we ask, and answer, in Cycling Cities: The Johannesburg Experience. Back our book project with the last bit of funding we need and help us bring this important story to a larger audience. 

Cycling Cities: The Johannesburg Experience challenges the inevitability of today’s Johannesburg, a city  synonymous with highways and rush hours, cars, minibus taxis, and 4x4s. The book shows that Johannesburg wasn’t always like this: it once was a cycling city. 

Author Njogu Morgan brings to life that once-thriving cycling city. His ground-breaking research and historical photos detail the sustainable profile of Johannesburg’s past. Well into the 20th century, everyone from mineworkers to the city’s elites found cycling a viable way of getting around. Cycling Cities: The Johannesburg Experience documents the forward-looking bike lane built in the 1930s, the tens of thousands of bicycle licences sold well into the 1950s, and the role that people of colour played in the city’s cycling history before Apartheid put a stop to it. Morgan shows how taking cycling seriously can help it to reinstate it as a mainstay of daily life.  

So far, we have raised most of the funds we need, covering the costs of the author's research, as well as editing and image rights to a total of 40,000 Euro. Our printing costs have been covered by a single generous donation. Now we need to raise the funds still needed to pay for the book’s design, typesetting, and distribution. 

By donating to this project, you can help to bring awareness to a broader audience of cyclists and urbanists, as well as everyone interested in how to make their car-dependent communities more sustainable and rewarding places to live.

The Book
The book is a full-colour, beautifully bound A5 hardcover of approximately 80 pages. It will resemble the mockup image found here. More information on other books in the series is available at cyclingcities.info.

Risks and Challenges: 
Raising the funds to publish a physical book

Because we have raised funds for actual printing of the book, and because the manuscript is complete and image rights have already been purchased, we are confident that we can bring this book to print, if needs be, with varying amounts of money. For that reason, this is not an all-or-nothing fundraising campaign, but one in which we keep all the funds raised, at whatever total amount. We will use these funds to pay for the book's design, typesetting, etc, as described below. If we fall far short of our target, some aspects of the book's production may have to be revised. If these changes push the book's publication date far beyond what we have promised you, our backers, we will communicate this with you timeously and provide alternatives where we can.

Producing a book in an untested environment

To date, the Cycling Cities authors have produced 5 books. This  is the first volume to be produced in a city outside Europe, however. That means printing and distributing the book in a new way. We’ve sourced an experienced South African printing company that produces high-quality books. To ensure a hassle-free post-production process, we plan to pack and send the books personally and distribute them separately from Amsterdam (Europe, the USA, and other countries) and Johannesburg (South Africa). 

When and where will the book be published and distributed?

The manuscript is in final editing stages and printing funding and image rights have already been secured. Once this Indiegogo campaign ends and funding has been secured, another 8-10 weeks is required for design and typesetting. Printing should take a further 2 weeks. We’ll then personally package and ship the books to our backers. If you’re in Europe or South Africa you should receive your book in the course of June 2019. If you're anywhere else in the world, you may receive your book in June or July 2019, depending on shipping times.
story_txt: Why did cycling disappear from the streets of Johannesburg? How can the city get cycling right in the 21st century—and help to secure a sustainable future?These are the questions we ask, and answer, in Cycling Cities: The Johannesburg Experience. Back our book project with the last bit of funding we need and help us bring this important story to a larger audience. Cycling Cities: The Johannesburg Experience challenges the inevitability of today’s Johannesburg, a city  synonymous with highways and rush hours, cars, minibus taxis, and 4x4s. The book shows that Johannesburg wasn’t always like this: it once was a cycling city. Author Njogu Morgan brings to life that once-thriving cycling city. His ground-breaking research and historical photos detail the sustainable profile of Johannesburg’s past. Well into the 20th century, everyone from mineworkers to the city’s elites found cycling a viable way of getting around. Cycling Cities: The Johannesburg Experience documents the forward-looking bike lane built in the 1930s, the tens of thousands of bicycle licences sold well into the 1950s, and the role that people of colour played in the city’s cycling history before Apartheid put a stop to it. Morgan shows how taking cycling seriously can help it to reinstate it as a mainstay of daily life.  So far, we have raised most of the funds we need, covering the costs of the author's research, as well as editing and image rights to a total of 40,000 Euro. Our printing costs have been covered by a single generous donation. Now we need to raise the funds still needed to pay for the book’s design, typesetting, and distribution. By donating to this project, you can help to bring awareness to a broader audience of cyclists and urbanists, as well as everyone interested in how to make their car-dependent communities more sustainable and rewarding places to live.The BookThe book is a full-colour, beautifully bound A5 hardcover of approximately 80 pages. It will resemble the mockup image found here. More information on other books in the series is available at cyclingcities.info.Risks and Challenges: Raising the funds to publish a physical bookBecause we have raised funds for actual printing of the book, and because the manuscript is complete and image rights have already been purchased, we are confident that we can bring this book to print, if needs be, with varying amounts of money. story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
