story:
A Historic Challenge for Society

Can we use regular people's comments to tell good information from bad, and filter trolls out of online discussions? 

       

 

Fiskkit.com lets readers comment on individual sentences in an article just like they would write notes on a newspaper article. They can also tag specific sentences with common flaws or compliments.

You can try it out right now at Fiskkit.com if you validate your real name through Facebook or LinkedIn.

This kind of commenting (known as "fisking" in the blogging world) focuses the discussion on the merits, and captures that person's judgment/opinion in a structure that is easier for humans (and computers) to interpret. Fiskkit analyzes what regular people say about news articles in order to discover new insights - like which critiques of the article are valid - or give news readers new capabilities.

Each time you "fisk" an article, you can share your marked up version to Facebook, Twitter or anywhere you can send a link (like to your family if they send you bad articles!). You can invite them to give their opinion as well, and see everyone's comments on the same points side-by-side using the Discuss view.

When people put the same tag on the same sentence in unusually high numbers the system can determine - statistically and objectively - if that critique is valid. Fiskkit then shows all of the statistically valid tags on our Article Insight page - creating a crowdsourced factcheck of that article.  

Fiskkit is the first system that has a realistic chance to quality-check online content - at internet scale and in real-time!

 

 

We started working on Fiskkit in 2014 - long before #fakenews was cool. (See the original IndieGoGo campaign video!) Despite being an unfunded social venture, Fiskkit and its team grew through winning various social good hackathons and pitch competitions in San Francisco, culminating in an onstage presentation in front of 3,000 people at Jason Calacanis' LAUNCH Festival, where we were honored to win the LAUNCH Festival Social Impact Award out of over 50 companies. 

Since we began our public beta test, we've learned that people don't just want to criticize articles - they actually want to engage with the issues and with each other. But they hate the comments sections and social media we currently have!

              

We'd like to change that by building Fiskkit into a discussion system designed to produce a productive conversation, that can plug into any part of the internet.

Fiskkit has always been designed to focus the conversation and favor facts, logic and civility. Now we want to build the killer app of online discussion: the Troll Filter.

How You Can Make Online Discussions Great (for Once)

Our biggest goal is to bring people into the Fiskkit community as we begin this journey towards a more rational - more respectful - public discussion.

But Fiskkit is a bootstrapped social venture. That means we're broke and we've always been broke. Fiskkit is being built by 14 engineers, designers and other folks working nights and weekends because nobody else is stepping up to do it.

Since our wonderful team is unpaid, your generous financial support will go a *really long way*  towards things like hosting, development tools and software licenses to build the system. But if you'd like to generously thank this hard-working team, we've included Perk options to Buy the Team a Drink! and Buy the Team Lunch! over to the right. (Food goes in, </code> comes out!)  If you add one of these Special Perks, the team will be so happy!

(Note: you can support multiple perks or multiple times, but IndieGoGo requires you to pay for each separately.)

Additional funds will enable us to forge partnerships that could quickly grow the scale and impact of the Fiskkit ecosystem. How? By adding Organizational Accounts with subject-matter expertise, like the American Federation of Teachers, or issue-driven political campaigns in 2018. Additionally, major conferences like The Online News Association, The International FactChecking Network and MisInfoCon will allow us to build partnerships with publishers and academics to embed Fiskkit pages in their work, and potentially to adopt Fiskkit as a fully integrated commenting solution. And that is how we get this ethos of socially responsible online discussion to grow through mainstream media.

Fiskkit will be very efficient is using your resources to build an explore socially positive innovation in public discourse:

 

This campaign should give us a runway of 6 months to build the discussion system and the Troll Filter. But the more support we get, the more we can build - and faster.

 

The Way Forward

This is the rough order of features we plan to add to the system - though this will change as we hear what you all want in the Fiskkit Feature Request Survey (exclusive to IndieGoGo backers).  

Immediate

  • Accounts for Organizations (e.g. advocacy groups, political campaigns and companies)
  • Recursive Fisking
  • Troll Filter

Stretch Goals + Medium Term

  • Onsite notifications
  • Credit Card Identity & Login
  • Instant notification when you select a validated tag!
  • Enhanced User Profile page w/ statistics
  • Author Profile pages w/ statistics (e.g. 95th percentile for making Unsupported claims)
  • Publication Profile pages w/ statistics (e.g. 82nd percentile for False claims)
  • Article Categories
  • Article Search
  • WordPress plugin for native Fiskkit commenting
  • Chrome plugin 
  • Universal Troll Filter plugin (use the Troll Filter on any comments section!)
  • White label, private Fiskkit (w/ custom tags) for any community discussion
  • Education version for teaching critical thinking in schools
  • Specialized Fiskkit for peer-review of scientific journals, or public-review!
  • Future: Service to reprice online ads by the accuracy of the info on each site (like Sleeping Giants [@slpng_giants] for the whole online ad industry). The goal is to price accuracy into the online economy, thus making it *literally valuable*.

 

Other Ways To Help

Contributing to the campaign is only one way to help. You can also:

  • Join Fiskkit for free!
    • Fisk your first article, and ask a friend or two to join you on it.
    • Got an axe to grind with a particular publication? Start a blog dedicated to fisking that publication and embed Fiskkit pages directly inside it. Recruit people to join you! FisktheNYTimes.com and FiskBreitbart.com are waiting for you.
    • Is there an issue on which you have particular expertise, or want to mobilize a community? Start a blog dedicated to fisking articles in your area of focus. ClimateFisks.com, GunControlFisks.com, MiddleEastFisks.com could be the homes for productive conversations about things that are pretty hard to talk about.
  • Share this campaign to those folks you think would be interested on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit or email. 
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top to send this campaign to the 3-4 people you most like to talk news with. 
  • Pitch the organizations you care about to sign up for a Fiskkit account
    • The first month is free so there is no risk
    • Volunteer to write fisks for them to test if they can activate their supporters!
    • Email us at contact@fiskkit.com to get them set up.
  • Last-but-best... JOIN THE TEAM!! 
    • If you are passionate about this problem and want to work on it with a team, reach out to contact@fiskkit.com
    • We are still adding:
      • Engineers (Current stack: Angular 1.6, PHP, MySQL, Java, AWS)
      • Web Designers
      • Data scientists
      • Business people (business development/partnerships, growth hacker/hustlers)
      • Advisors, with subject matter expertise and contacts in: journalism/publishing, cybersecurity (counter-manipulation), psychology, trolling, crowdsourcing, SaaS, user-generated content, content marketing.

If you are interested in other ways fight fake news and elevate public discourse, here are some other great organizations to support:

  • Hypothes.is: Open source annotation tool (Climate Feedback is a great implementation)
  • International Fact-Checking Network: a division of Poynter, their Fact-Checkers Code of Principles is used to qualify fact-checks into Facebook and Google. They will always be the gold standard.
  • The Committee to Protect Journalists
  • The Electronic Frontier Foundation
  • Your local paper: they need your support ($$) to do good work in your backyard. Please support them!

This is only the beginning of our relationship

Over the coming days, weeks and months, you'll get to know the Fiskkit Team, our values and our progress towards creating a positive space for discussions. Getting to know you all is the thing we're most excited about! That's why we're building the mechanics for a fantastic discussion.

Thank you for caring about our public discourse and thank you for joining us in tackling bad information and bad behavior online - two problems everyone thought were unsolvable.

story:
Women-led startups are on the rise, yet funding for them has decreased. And that’s why we’re here, on Indiegogo, looking for help from this supportive community. 

We’ve been refining this concept for nearly two years, and keeping costs low by doing the work ourselves. Now, with plans, images, and copy firmly in place, we’re ready to move forward and go from concept-on-paper to actual work-on-paper. That means securing capital to layout, print, ship, display, and promote our product--the costs of which are all quite high. You can view mock-ups of several of our cards (they are prototypes) in the thumbnails under the video, along with some additional sample photographs from the card line. 

What Sets Us Apart?

  • For starters, our images (photographs) were taken by us, or family members.  Eventually, we’d love to include images taken by other women, particularly those who may be returning to work after a career break, or looking for a new career in much the same way the Card Sisters did. 
  • We also write all of our own copy--it’s born from personal experience, and includes lots of heart (and occasional humor!).
  • We’re a card company created by women, for women. The women who buy and read our cards are an extension of our sisterhood.
  • We want to support and work with other women-owned businesses (where at least 51% of the company is owned by women) whenever possible. 

Who Are the Card Sisters?

Melissa T. Shultz -- I'm a writer, and the acquisitions editor for Jim Donovan Literary. I've written about health and parenting for The New York Times, The Washington Post, Newsweek, Readers' Digest, AARP’s The Girlfriend and many other publications. My memoir/self-help book From Mom to Me Again: How I Survived My First Empty-Nest Year and Reinvented the Rest of My Life was published by Sourcebooks and named one of “3 Inspiring Reads” by Parade.com.  Prior to my work as a writer and editor I was the Director of Creative Services for a trade association in Washington, DC.  I'm the proud mom of two grown sons.

Lisa Miller -- I worked for a Fortune 100 Company for 24 years. My most recent role was as Vice President for their Global Financial Shared Services. Since retirement from corporate life in 2016, I founded Living Simply by Lisa, a professional organizing business focused on bringing productivity and efficiency to clients’ homes and offices, as well as with their financial information and data. Using my background in accounting and finance, I also enjoy working with individuals and small businesses in setting up and maintaining their books. I'm the proud mom of two grown daughters.

 Our Fundraising Goals

Step 1:  To Get Into Stores Regionally: $15,000

Here's what it will enable us to do: Print initial short runs (digital printing) for stores local to the Southwest, ship the cards, make sample kits to pitch to stores, provide spin racks to stores so we literally stand out, create some basic, low-cost ads, create and produce two initial products/gifts that tie into the line, and hire some initial freelance help.

Step 2: To Get Into Stores Nationally: $30,000

Here's what it will enable us to do: Hire several freelancers to assist with layout and social media, print in much larger quantities, add additional products/gifts to our line, attend trade shows, and attract and hire a card rep.

How You Can Help

Monetary donations will assist us in going from concept to reality. Any and all amounts are greatly appreciated--and for certain donation levels, be sure to see (and if you'd like to, select) our special perks! That said, we understand you may not be able to contribute financially. Sharing this campaign information with others, and spreading the word on social media is priceless--you would be helping us tremendously! 

 

Thank you for taking the time to read about our project. You can visit our website at Card Sisters. Someday soon, we hope to be able to send you a note from our very own greeting card line: one that your generosity made possible. 

XO

Lisa and Melissa

Step 1:  To Get Into Stores Regionally: $15,000
Here's what it will enable us to do: Print initial short runs (digital printing) for stores local to the Southwest, ship the cards, make sample kits to pitch to stores, provide spin racks to stores so we literally stand out, create some basic, low-cost ads, create and produce two initial products/gifts that tie into the line, and hire some initial freelance help.
Step 2: To Get Into Stores Nationally: $30,000
Here's what it will enable us to do: Hire several freelancers to assist with layout and social media, print in much larger quantities, add additional products/gifts to our line, attend trade shows, and attract and hire a card rep.
How You Can Help
Monetary donations will assist us in going from concept to reality. Any and all amounts are greatly appreciated--and for certain donation levels, be sure to see (and if you'd like to, select) our special perks! That said, we understand you may not be able to contribute financially. Sharing this campaign information with others, and spreading the word on social media is priceless--you would be helping us tremendously! 


 
Thank you for taking the time to read about our project. You can visit our website at Card Sisters. Someday soon, we hope to be able to send you a note from our very own greeting card line: one that your generosity made possible. 
XO
Lisa and Melissa

story:
Darkness Within

Welcome!  I'm Marz, AKA The Baroness.  I am a writer, artist, costume designer and character concept creator.  I have been writing short stories since I was a child.  3 years ago I began designing and creating my own characters and costumes.  The costumes can have elaborate headdresses, leather work, body jewellery.  I use a lot of foraged bones and other natural products (I make cool stuff out of dead stuff).

Last year my creations were noticed by a number of photographers, and used in multitudes of really awesome shoots.  All these shoots were other people's vision of my creations, and this year I wanted to highlight my vision.

All my characters are strong women; some are crazy, psychotic, merciless, others are compassionate, honourable.  All of them are a little (or a lot) damaged, but they rise above it.  This idea that we can make peace with the darkness within us and still be strong and capable is incredibly important to me.  One of the reasons I love to work with photographers, models, make up artists is that I want to really showcase that while bad things happen, it doesn't have to break us forever.

So this year I am writing a dark fantasy anthology.  There will be 10 strong women characters, their stories and images to reflect both the story and my art.

The money that I raise during this campaign will be to pay for the photographers, models and make up artists.  I am fortunate enough to know some very talented people and am excited to introduce you to them.

Even if I don't reach my goal, every penny will go to the books images.  Part of this will also be self funded.  It may take longer than I originally estimate if I don't reach my goal, but it will still get completed.  

I have some awesome perks for contributors, including the first story and images - which is complete and waiting for you.  I will be updating regularly, and giving you glimpses behind the scenes, introducing you to some of the fantastic people I will be working with.

If you are unable to contribute financially please share my campaign far and wide and encourage others to contribute.

story:
Hi, I'm Dorsey, Gustavo's Mom

My name is Dorsey Barger and I own and operate HausBar Farm in East Austin. Before I became an urban farmer in 2009, I was in the restaurant business.  I opened my own restaurant, The Eastside Cafe, in Austin, Texas in 1988 when I was 24 years old. (24 years later, I sold it to my business partner so that I could be a full time farmer.) I had hung out in restaurants throughout my childhood because I grew up with a mom who thought that vegetables came frozen in bags with sauce already on them.  She just dropped the entire bag into boiling water. I’m absolutely positive this is why I became a restaurateur and then an urban farmer, who grows tons of vegetables. 

HausBar Farm isn't only about our garden and the amazing things we raise for Austin's restaurants, it's also about the wonderful farm animals who bring us so much joy. Gustavo, the most famous of them all, came into our lives 7 years ago when I thought it might be fun to raise a few geese and some ducks.  He arrived in a box from the hatchery.  I had to drive to the post office to pick him up. He was just 2 days old.  When I got him back to the farm, he jumped out of the box and took over the whole farm with his enormous personality, his huge heart, and his gift for making people feel loved. Geese have a well-deserved reputation for being aggressive towards people. But Gustavo loves to kiss people and even lead them on tours of the farm, sticking out his big, proud chest as he walks. He's a veritable goose goodwill ambassador.

Gustavo brings so much joy to so many, that we wanted to share his story in a book. I wrote about his adventures in his voice. His grandmother, my mother, Barbara Adams, (the very same boiler of bags of veggies) spent three years painting beautiful portraits of Gustavo and his family and friends to illustrate the book. Gustavo supervised the whole project, making sure we both got his story exactly right. The children's book, 'On Gustavo's Farm' is now ready to go to print.  You can help us share his story with the world by supporting our Indiegogo campaign. 

 

Great Goose Goodies

You can get great perks when you donate to our campaign—a book, a t-shirt, 'Gustavo on the Go,' or a maybe even a ticket to a book signing for kids at HausBar Farm, or cocktail party book release for adults. Donate at our top level and get an exclusive, private dinner for ten people with the author, provided by two of Austin's top chefs, on Gustavo's actual farm. And, you'll be helping give life to Gustavo’s dream of being a goose-author.  Every donation will get us closer to publishing 'On Gustavo's Farm.' 

 

Meet Our Wonderful Partners

We are thrilled to have Callisto Culinary, Paula's Texas Spirits, and Tiny Tails To You as co-hosts and sponsors for our Private Dinner at HausBar Farm, Cocktail Party Book Release, and Kids Farm Day extravaganza and book signing.

Callisto Culinary Owners, Michael Castillo and Emily K. Davis (previously Chef de Cuisine and Pastry Chef of Uchi, Austin) will be providing incredible food for all three perk events at HausBar Farm.

Paula's Texas Spirits will be serving the cocktail they created especially for Gustavo's book release cocktail party, called the 'Duck, Duck, Gustavo.'

Tiny Tails To You will be bringing its adorable mobile petting zoo to our Cocktail Book Release and our Kids Farm Day book signing events.

 

Please Tell Your Friends About Gustavo's Book!

Please share our campaign with others!  Let people know what a special project we're working on. Email the link for our Indiegogo pitch to your friends and family; use Indiegogo share tools; share us with your Facebook friends; shout about us on Instagram; and if you're young, Snapchat us up.  The more people who know about Gustavo the more people can contribute to the publication of his amazing book.

 

Thank You So Much, From Gustavo and All of Us at HausBar Farm

story:
April is National Poetry Month:

Do Something Dangerous: Read

Poetic Justice Books and Arts is (mostly right now) Kris Haggblom. I have been involved in the literary / book arts for my entire life – from obsessively reading classic literature as a child to majoring in creative writing at The University of Tampa; editing literary magazines to forming local poetry groups; combining poetry and photography and creating handmade books.

I worked for Barnes & Noble for eighteen years (in the Jensen Beach store for the past eight). Before that, I was a retail store manager for eight years. A couple of things I constantly heard from customers at B&N was how meagre the poetry section was and “Where is the local authors section?” We tried to build a larger poetry department, but found the problems of obtaining books from small and micro publishers – where the majority of poetry is published – a difficult to impossible hurdle in the corporate structure. Many of the poets I would look for were simply unavailable through our supply chain. This left the customers with a selection of "big name" and corporate choices. The same issues popped up again and again for local authors – especially those just starting out on their literary adventure. Independent magazines were virtually invisible.

Literature, and poetry in particular, is an art appreciated through exploration. Recommendations by booksellers, artists, and well-read friends help direct those explorations. Each work, hopefully, leads to new discoveries.

Port Saint Lucie has a couple of used bookstores, but where does that stock come from? It’s the castaways from the big chains – so still no variety. Our closest independent bookstore on the Treasure Coast is the Vero Beach Book Center about 35 miles away, and they are a general interest store – albeit a wonderful one. PSL is the eighth largest city in Florida, with a population greater than Fort Lauderdale and quickly catching Tallahassee, and yet we don’t have an independent bookstore, a community place to celebrate our creative souls.

The idea of Poetic Justice Books and Arts is to create that place of discovery. To provide a place to support and share creativity. We will host regular readings, signings, and events with a focus on local poets, authors, and artists. Our stock will be a finely curated mix of poetry, literary fiction and non-fiction, bringing in the titles that are not featured in national chain stores or are buried under the weight of a national bestseller list that has little-to-no relationship with Florida’s Treasure Coast. And we will have a gallery featuring local artists.

We will offer a great rewards program: every dollar you spend gets a point; 100 points gets you a $5 credit. 10% discount for students / military / seniors. 15% educator discount.

Throughout the early planning stages, I have received an immense amount of support and encouragement. People are obviously interested in what we are doing. We plan to bring the community space that we (and you) desire. We aim to represent you, Port Saint Lucie, to the best of our ability.

 

What We’ve Done So Far

Poetic Justice Books and Arts, LLC is registered with federal, state, county and city agencies. A POS, inventory and computer system has been invested in and a website is in the process of being created. The domain name PoeticJusticeBooks.com is secured. Accounts have been established with a variety of vendors. Locations have been scouted. Local artists have expressed interest in consigning work for a gallery wall.

 

What’s Needed Now

The two big hurdles facing us right now are rent and inventory (though we have made a small dent in the inventory). So, the goal of this campaign is to secure funding for a physical presence in Port Saint Lucie. Rental space along the busy US1 corridor is running about $15 – $20 per square foot for a 1000 square foot storefront, so we’re looking at $15,000 - $20,000. For initial inventory, we are hoping to fill approximately 2500 linear feet of display shelves, so that should be in the neighborhood of $15,000. That gives us a goal of $35,000 to get a secure location, utilities, and stock.

 

Risks and Challenges

The first thing everyone asks when we tell them we’re opening a bookstore is “What about Amazon?” Well, your typical Amazon customer is not your typical bookstore customer. Personal recommendations, customer service, and a sense of discovery cannot be replaced by a computer algorithm. Consumers are embracing a local-ism mindset – supporting local business is supporting local community. (For an interesting look at what Amazon does to local communities see this article: http://www.civiceconomics.com/empty-storefronts...).

The American Booksellers Association reports that, nationally, 61 new independent bookstore locations opened in 2015, 87 in 2016, and 75 in 2017. Retail sales at all combined US bookstores were down by 8.4 percent in January 2018 compared to January 2017, according to preliminary figures recently released by the Bureau of the Census. Those estimates reflect sales at all types of participating bookstores, including trade, college, religious, chain stores (including superstores), and others. However, taken alone, the independent bookstore channel ended 2017 with a 2.6 percent increase over 2016. As of March 6, 2018, the year-to-date sales for independent bookstores, as reported to the weekly Indie Bestseller Lists, were up more than 4 percent over 2017. So it’s the independents that are thriving.

While we have carefully researched the costs involved in this venture, we cannot foresee any surprise costs. We are aware of the risks involved, but are confident that our community will pull through either by donating or sharing our story. Every little bit counts!

story:
"- The crowdfunding is officially open - because what?

- Reading estranged is fun-da-men-tal!"

 

What is estranged? 

estranged, the intersectional zine on countercultures, by Kaspars Bekeris, the dedicated journalist and photographer, and Matthias “Strell Ytzia’’ Boyer, environmental activist and drag artist.

For each issue, we empathically gather personal experiences, as a source of inspiration for all of us, who have ever felt estranged. Intended to be a platform providing visibility to the figure of the “other’’, estranged highlights their existence and their resistance. 

By dint of an intersectional approach cultivating awareness on contemporary issues, we aim to improve and sustain human harmony. estranged is a contribution for a radical liberation.
With our campaign focusing on estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family, we invite you to make a new step together in the history of anti-discrimination movements, especially LGBTQIA+ and anti-racism movements, Women and Non-human Animal Liberation.

"The convergence of struggles is real."

 

Introduction to our first issue: We had a kiki with Icelandic drag artists

 

What about our first issue?

estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family is like having a kiki with Icelandic drag performers. From their life experiences at the intersection of various prejudices based on sex, gender, sexuality, age, ethnicity, class, handicap or beliefs, estranged analyses how the art of drag is a mean of escape and a form of resistance. 

Gathering conversations with many astonishing drag artists like the internationally-famous musician and Icelandic icon, Páll Óskar, or the current reigning drag queen of Iceland, Gógó Starr, cabaret performer Miss Mokki, drag queens: Jackie Moon, Jenny Purr, Deff Starr, Atli Freyr Demantur, Wonda Starr, musician Skaði Þórðardóttir, drag kings Yan Nuss, BoyToy Tony, and many others, this zine addresses their uncommon life experiences.

"Hence, drag is not (only) about ego, but about being equal."

 

 

The Impact of the campaign and estranged #1

By documenting and gathering the personal experiences of the members of Icelandic drag family, we highlight their condition in society and their resistance to the discriminations in social practices and in legislation (for example - the stigmatisation of non-binary people by the use of term "gender identity disorder" in 2012 Icelandic law). Therefore, we create a community of experience and we offer a visibility of issues that we should face together, rather than isolated.

This is why estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family is a unique project. It is not only a gathering of interviews but also articles addressing directly how we can improve society. To make this ambition possible, we are willing to collaborate with local associations, especially Trans Ísland, to raise awareness, and have a solid contribution to human equality - with a special consideration for non-human animal rights.

And of course, estranged is an artistic experience. In our first issue, we celebrate the fantastic visual dimension of the art of drag, and every photography aims to see what's happening beneath the surface of drag makeup.

 

 

"15k € - really queen?"

Production of estranged #1: 

  • 0 € - salaries for editors, writers & contributors (you read it right, this campaign is at its minimum goal just to launch our products - all the contributors will be paid from extra copies sold after the campaign);
  • 3.000 € for the design;
  • 3.500 € for the printing of 1000 copies (96 pages magazine);
  • 4.000 € + for the shipping.

Creating free online content:

  • 200 € - video editing software, word processors;
  • 200 € - rent of light and audio equipment;
  • 270 € - homepage hosting for one year;
  • 300 € - social media outreach.

Rewards: 

  • 260 € - print materials (postcards, Art Photography Print);
  • 200 € - photoshoot material;
  • 480 € - closing event of the campaign;
  • 900 € - the making of 100 tote bags (Organic cotton and Hand-made).

Additional costs: 

  • 1200 € - ( 5% + 3%) - crowdfunding services
  • 490 € - "insurance" in case of unexpected extra costs

If we surpass our goal, the money will finance our short documentary:

  • professional video and audio production
  • professional post-production (audio mixing, color grading)

estranged is an independent slow-media, an artistic and ethical zine. It does involve that our work and its quality stand out from our mainstream counterparts, on the price, just slightly, but primarily on the form and content.
All of the content that we produced for more than a year until now has been made from our limited resources. Now, your help is crucial to make the first documentation on Icelandic drag happen, and to support the local community!

Each donation makes a difference!

 

So, what do we have for you?

Of, course, the zine.

If we reach our goal, estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family will be ready in September! During the summer, we'll finish collecting the last interviews of the members of community - those who are on the stage, but also the ones behind the curtains.

Our first issue (in English) is designed for a paper format (225 × 297mm). You can enjoy full estranged #1 reading experience with our printed version. But a digital version is also available.

 

 

For every one of you, dear contributors, you will receive a personal postcard from portrait photography project "F*CK GENDER" by Kaspars Bekeris, signed by himself and Strell Ytzia, and a shoutout on social media (Facebook and/or Instagram) on our estranged accounts.

With our "F*CK GENDER" tote bag (organic and handmade), you will be able to bring everywhere the rebellious spirit of estranged! With this reward we wanted to stress out that the art of drag manipulates the attributes called "feminine" or "masculine" in a given culture. Drag is a way of expression and/or entertainment, it considers genders as a social and cultural material. Therefore, it is probably better - to stop defining our identities according to genders. So… F*CK GENDER.

We also have some exceptional rewards including a Signed Art Photography Print of your choice from a very special selection of Kaspars Bekeris for estranged #1 (see the perk "Matron Of Art"). We will contact you right after your amazing contribution, to choose which Photography you would prefer. You can already check some of his portrait photography for estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family.

Kaspars and Strell Ytzia are also offering you a privileged moment for a personalized drag makeover and a photoshoot! (see the perk "Drag Goddess" - Reykjavik, Paris, Riga only.) Right after your incredible contribution, we will discuss when and where, and what are your desires for this drag transformation (makeup, wig, outfit...). Kaspars will be here to capture this moment!

 


About the "Strell Ytzia Blossom. A Utopian Drag Show":

Thursday, 07th of June 2018 - 21:00-23h30
At Gaukurinn (Tryggvagata 22, Reykjavik)

« STRELL YTZIA BLOSSOM: A Utopian Drag Show » is the culmination of the fundraising campaign. On the 7th of June, 2018 you are heartily invited to this story of wonder and liberation. Before moving away from Iceland, she wanted to transport you to her secret garden, a fairy place where she sings live, lip-syncs, dances and does poetry to express and flourish herself. And as you could expect, your intersectional diva will perform for good causes.

As an emergency against oppressive ideologies, it is time for her to bloom before your astonished eyes. Your bird of paradise will beautifully challenge sexist and gendered nonsense, racialist absurdities and capitalist foolishness. A spectacle of how peaceful fantasies shatter those pipe dreams. With the wonderful Queen Jackie Moon and Hans, Strell Ytzia will create a utopia.

"From glitters to the Cosmos."

 

 

Why an "intersectional approach"? 

"Because we all have a body and an identity, but we do not fairly experience them if we are “woman’’/“man’’ identified people, intersex, trans, in transition, cis, or non-binary.

We all have desires, but we do not fairly experience them if we are Lesbian, Gay, Straight, Pansexual; If our desires are sexual or romantic.

We all have a need for human relationships, but we do not fairly experience it when we are racialized, pathologized, or essentialized.

And furthermore, we are all earthlings. But we do not fairly experience our life when we are human, or non-human."

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We are willing to work on the project, even if we don't achieve the goal, but that could mean that the first issue of estranged and the perks could be ready later than September. Because of the fact that it would not allow us to work full-time on estranged #1 Photo album of Icelandic drag family. It could involve an additional work on advertising and searching for sponsorship. But our commitment and values will remain the same.

 

 

Our story

Our first issue began more than a year ago with the photo series: "The Secret Life of a Drag queen" (by photographer Kaspars Bekeris). The photo project has an exhibition at Gaukurinn, the principal venue of the drag life here in Reykjavik, and KKC, Riga, Latvia during the film festival "2 ANNAS. Outsiders". What emerged in front of the camera was the incredible diversity of life stories in this young yet talented local community of Icelandic drag.

 

Words from Kaspars (Co-founding editor):

« For more than 15 years, I have been guilty of “polluting the ether” professionally by covering the news as a TV reporter, writer, and photographer for different media. I have always been interested in ideas and life experiences of other people which can highlight both imperfections of the world and the ways to change it. Unfortunately, I was never fully satisfied with the limitations of modern media.

The last year and a half has been a period of transformation for me – I had the opportunity to reconnect with an artistic side within and dedicate myself to one of my biggest passions – photography, by making documentary portrait photography project of drag artists in Iceland “F*ck Gender”. After meeting Matthias aka. Strell Ytzia, we decided to reach out to all conscious rebels and make the first issue of estranged magazine on Icelandic drag family (hopefully, our own family now). Estranged is our attempt to create a media that offers a place for mindful conversations on art and politics to inspire everyone to develop new ideas and take action. »

 

Words from Matthias (Co-founding editor): 

« You can call me Strell, Strell Ytzia, your bird of Paradise.

I began to be engaged and focused on the common Good where I was born and grew up, in Reunion Island, France. There, I initiated the founding of the local movement of the Young Greens (Les Jeunes Ecologistes), before spending two years in Paris for my studies in social sciences and philosophy at Sciences Po Paris and La Sorbonne Paris IV. 

Now, I live in Reykjavik where I met Kaspars and began to be a drag artist - a new chapter of my life. Nevertheless, I remain faithful to my values. Stating through the art of drag, so against the binarism of gender, my non-white non-heterosexual and vegan identity, and creating Estranged are my new contributions to the intersectional movement for justice. »

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

Please, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Our Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/estrangedmag/
Our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/estrangedmag/
Our campaign video on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=--TJ9SJTh_8

Share our video and the campaign, and follow us.
Thank you so much for your support!


We Luv Ya!

Kaspars Bekeris & Matthias Boyer
story_txt:
"- The crowdfunding is officially open - because what?
- Reading estranged is fun-da-men-tal!"

 
What is estranged? 
estranged, the intersectional zine on countercultures, by Kaspars Bekeris, the dedicated journalist and photographer, and Matthias “Strell Ytzia’’ Boyer, environmental activist and drag artist.
For each issue, we empathically gather personal experiences, as a source of inspiration for all of us, who have ever felt estranged. Intended to be a platform providing visibility to the figure of the “other’’, estranged highlights their existence and their resistance. 
By dint of an intersectional approach cultivating awareness on contemporary issues, we aim to improve and sustain human harmony. estranged is a contribution for a radical liberation.With our campaign focusing on estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family, we invite you to make a new step together in the history of anti-discrimination movements, especially LGBTQIA+ and anti-racism movements, Women and Non-human Animal Liberation.
"The convergence of struggles is real."
 


Introduction to our first issue: We had a kiki with Icelandic drag artists
 

What about our first issue?
estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family is like having a kiki with Icelandic drag performers. From their life experiences at the intersection of various prejudices based on sex, gender, sexuality, age, ethnicity, class, handicap or beliefs, estranged analyses how the art of drag is a mean of escape and a form of resistance. 
Gathering conversations with many astonishing drag artists like the internationally-famous musician and Icelandic icon, Páll Óskar, or the current reigning drag queen of Iceland, Gógó Starr, cabaret performer Miss Mokki, drag queens: Jackie Moon, Jenny Purr, Deff Starr, Atli Freyr Demantur, Wonda Starr, musician Skaði Þórðardóttir, drag kings Yan Nuss, BoyToy Tony, and many others, this zine addresses their uncommon life experiences.
"Hence, drag is not (only) about ego, but about being equal."
 

 
The Impact of the campaign and estranged #1
By documenting and gathering the personal experiences of the members of Icelandic drag family, we highlight their condition in society and their resistance to the discriminations in social practices and in legislation (for example - the stigmatisation of non-binary people by the use of term "gender identity disorder" in 2012 Icelandic law). Therefore, we create a community of experience and we offer a visibility of issues that we should face together, rather than isolated.
This is why estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family is a unique project. It is not only a gathering of interviews but also articles addressing directly how we can improve society. To make this ambition possible, we are willing to collaborate with local associations, especially Trans Ísland, to raise awareness, and have a solid contribution to human equality - with a special consideration for non-human animal rights.
And of course, estranged is an artistic experience. In our first issue, we celebrate the fantastic visual dimension of the art of drag, and every photography aims to see what's happening beneath the surface of drag makeup.
 


 
"15k € - really queen?"
Production of estranged #1: 

0 € - salaries for editors, writers & contributors (you read it right, this campaign is at its minimum goal just to launch our products - all the contributors will be paid from extra copies sold after the campaign);
3.000 € for the design;
3.500 € for the printing of 1000 copies (96 pages magazine);
4.000 € + for the shipping.

Creating free online content:

200 € - video editing software, word processors;
200 € - rent of light and audio equipment;
270 € - homepage hosting for one year;
300 € - social media outreach.

Rewards: 

260 € - print materials (postcards, Art Photography Print);
200 € - photoshoot material;
480 € - closing event of the campaign;
900 € - the making of 100 tote bags (Organic cotton and Hand-made).

Additional costs: 

1200 € - ( 5% + 3%) - crowdfunding services
490 € - "insurance" in case of unexpected extra costs

If we surpass our goal, the money will finance our short documentary:

professional video and audio production
professional post-production (audio mixing, color grading)

estranged is an independent slow-media, an artistic and ethical zine. It does involve that our work and its quality stand out from our mainstream counterparts, on the price, just slightly, but primarily on the form and content.All of the content that we produced for more than a year until now has been made from our limited resources. Now, your help is crucial to make the first documentation on Icelandic drag happen, and to support the local community!
Each donation makes a difference!

 
So, what do we have for you?
Of, course, the zine.
If we reach our goal, estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family will be ready in September! During the summer, we'll finish collecting the last interviews of the members of community - those who are on the stage, but also the ones behind the curtains.
Our first issue (in English) is designed for a paper format (225 × 297mm). You can enjoy full estranged #1 reading experience with our printed version. But a digital version is also available.
 

 
For every one of you, dear contributors, you will receive a personal postcard from portrait photography project "F*CK GENDER" by Kaspars Bekeris, signed by himself and Strell Ytzia, and a shoutout on social media (Facebook and/or Instagram) on our estranged accounts.
With our "F*CK GENDER" tote bag (organic and handmade), you will be able to bring everywhere the rebellious spirit of estranged! With this reward we wanted to stress out that the art of drag manipulates the attributes called "feminine" or "masculine" in a given culture. Drag is a way of expression and/or entertainment, it considers genders as a social and cultural material. Therefore, it is probably better - to stop defining our identities according to genders. So… F*CK GENDER.
We also have some exceptional rewards including a Signed Art Photography Print of your choice from a very special selection of Kaspars Bekeris for estranged #1 (see the perk "Matron Of Art"). We will contact you right after your amazing contribution, to choose which Photography you would prefer. You can already check some of his portrait photography for estranged #1. Photo album of Icelandic drag family.Kaspars and Strell Ytzia are also offering you a privileged moment for a personalized drag makeover and a photoshoot! (see the perk "Drag Goddess" - Reykjavik, Paris, Riga only.) Right after your incredible contribution, we will discuss when and where, and what are your desires for this drag transformation (makeup, wig, outfit...). Kaspars will be here to capture this moment!
 


About the "Strell Ytzia Blossom. A Utopian Drag Show":
Thursday, 07th of June 2018 - 21:00-23h30At Gaukurinn (Tryggvagata 22, Reykjavik)
« STRELL YTZIA BLOSSOM: A Utopian Drag Show » is the culmination of the fundraising campaign. On the 7th of June, 2018 you are heartily invited to this story of wonder and liberation. Before moving away from Iceland, she wanted to transport you to her secret garden, a fairy place where she sings live, lip-syncs, dances and does poetry to express and flourish herself. And as you could expect, your intersectional diva will perform for good causes.
As an emergency against oppressive ideologies, it is time for her to bloom before your astonished eyes. Your bird of paradise will beautifully challenge sexist and gendered nonsense, racialist absurdities and capitalist foolishness. A spectacle of how peaceful fantasies shatter those pipe dreams. With the wonderful Queen Jackie Moon and Hans, Strell Ytzia will create a utopia.
"From glitters to the Cosmos."
 

 
Why an "intersectional approach"? 
"Because we all have a body and an identity, but we do not fairly experience them if we are “woman’’/“man’’ identified people, intersex, trans, in transition, cis, or non-binary. 
We all have desires, but we do not fairly experience them if we are Lesbian, Gay, Straight, Pansexual; If our desires are sexual or romantic. 
We all have a need for human relationships, but we do not fairly experience it when we are racialized, pathologized, or essentialized. 
And furthermore, we are all earthlings. But we do not fairly experience our life when we are human, or non-human."
 



 

 

Risks & Challenges
We are willing to work on the project, even if we don't achieve the goal, but that could mean that the first issue of estranged and the perks could be ready later than September. Because of the fact that it would not allow us to work full-time on estranged #1 Photo album of Icelandic drag family. It could involve an additional work on advertising and searching for sponsorship. But our commitment and values will remain the same.
 

 
Our story

« For more than 15 years, I have been guilty of “polluting the ether” professionally by covering the news as a TV reporter, writer, and photographer for different media. I have always been interested in ideas and life experiences of other people which can highlight both imperfections of the world and the ways to change it. Unfortunately, I was never fully satisfied with the limitations of modern media.
The last year and a half has been a period of transformation for me – I had the opportunity to reconnect with an artistic side within and dedicate myself to one of my biggest passions – photography, by making documentary portrait photography project of drag artists in Iceland “F*ck Gender”. After meeting Matthias aka. Strell Ytzia, we decided to reach out to all conscious rebels and make the first issue of estranged magazine on Icelandic drag family (hopefully, our own family now). Estranged is our attempt to create a media that offers a place for mindful conversations on art and politics to inspire everyone to develop new ideas and take action. »
 
Words from Matthias (Co-founding editor): 
« You can call me Strell, Strell Ytzia, your bird of Paradise.
I began to be engaged and focused on the common Good where I was born and grew up, in Reunion Island, France. There, I initiated the founding of the local movement of the Young Greens (Les Jeunes Ecologistes), before spending two years in Paris for my studies in social sciences and philosophy at Sciences Po Paris and La Sorbonne Paris IV. 
Now, I live in Reykjavik where I met Kaspars and began to be a drag artist - a new chapter of my life. Nevertheless, I remain faithful to my values. Stating through the art of drag, so against the binarism of gender, my non-white non-heterosexual and vegan identity, and creating Estranged are my new contributions to the intersectional movement for justice. »

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!
Please, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
Who am I, and what is Dellie's Run?

I'm Laura Lee Cascada, a writer and animal advocate based in Portsmouth, Virginia. I have a master’s degree in environmental policy from Johns Hopkins and am the Director of Corporate Outreach for Compassion Over Killing (where I make vegan options like Starbucks’ macadamia oat cookie appear on menus nationwide). I also run The Every Animal Project, a collection of photographs and awe-inspiring stories of animals around the globe. I spend my free time advocating for imperiled wild hermit crabs through my Plight of the Hermies campaign and managing marketing and PR for the annual Hampton Roads VegFest.

For my entire life, I have been moved and shaped by the power of words, and I believe that they truly can change lives and open hearts and minds. Four years ago, I began a journey to use my own words to share the truth about the oppressive animal agriculture system, which abuses and kills billions every year, through the eyes of a loveable, inquisitive, and headstrong character named Delaware.

The novel is already complete. And as a former editor, I've already given it an initial run-through. But I need your help to get it professionally edited and formatted and then to get it out of the depths of my computer's hard drive and into the world.

Book Synopsis

When you’ve lived your entire life mired in muck and filth, dreams might be the only thing you can cling to. And inside her prison, lost in a sea of thousands of other girls, Delaware has one colossal dream that revolves around a simple white ball. Captivating her from the screen of the portable television owned by one of the prison workers, it is her only glimpse of the place she calls Outside. Her dream is baseball.

Dellie’s Run is an empowering story of one girl chasing the elusive home run in the name of freedom—not just for her, but for the thousands she left behind. Along the way, she comes face to face with who she really is and why, according to the laws of physics, she’s basically destined to strike out. As Dellie sets off to defy these odds along with the companionship and scientific ingenuity of a curious young boy named Austin, she might just change the game for her kind—and for all of us on the Outside.

What I Need & What You Get

I have decided to self-publish Dellie's Run because I believe it's the best way to stay true to my creative vision for this book. But to turn this project into a reality, I will need to raise at least $5,000. I will need help with copy editing, internal design, and (the biggie) marketing. I want to raise enough to launch my book into the world at full steam via press releases, book-signing events, interviews, ads, advance reviews, an online presence, and much more.

In return, I'm inviting you to join Dellie on her journey! See the different perks to the right to find out what you'll get in return!

The Impact

Dellie's Run will reach thousands of Americans who will love a good adventure about our nation's greatest pastime, baseball--and through Dellie's story, they will find a spark of compassion inside themselves they never knew they had.

Words can deeply touch our souls and cause us to reflect on our very foundations. This book will prompt many readers to think about the choices they make in their daily lives, and to begin choosing compassion three times each day.

Risks & Challenges

If I don't reach my goal, Dellie's Run will still come to fruition--it's already written and (almost) ready to roll. But without sufficient funds, its impact will be limited. I don't want to just reach vegans and animal advocates -- I need your help to reach those who might never have thought about the animals behind their meals.

Although I've never published a book before, I've been writing my entire life. I have years of training and even professional experience as an editor. I have also dabbled in graphic design since I was a teen. And I've been working in public campaigning for animals (including through media outreach, event organizing, social media, and advertising) for nearly a decade.

Although you might be taking a gamble on me, know that I live and breathe to fight for animals. This book has been the biggest undertaking of my life thus far, and I will throw my entire self into making it a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, please share www.DelliesRun.com with everyone you know. Your help will truly spread the wingspan of this fundraising effort and ensure that this book reaches the public next spring!

story:
Aims

Students, alumni and staff from the University of Sheffield come together every year to bring you brilliant fiction, non-fiction, poetry and drama. Each year the funds raised go straight back into producing next year’s issue, and with your help we can steam ahead of last year’s sale targets and continue to fund and support Sheffield’s biggest creative writing journal.

Route 57 is the University of Sheffield's creative writing journal. 2018 sees the publication of Issue 14, entitled Loco-Motion, in collaboration with York's National Railway Museum (NRM). This special issue takes the culture shock of the railways, their histories, their present and future, as a jumping-off point from which to interrogate speed, transport, mobility, stasis and the politics of travel. It features exceptional, experimental poetry, fiction, performance writing, artwork and non-fiction from students, staff and alumni of the University of Sheffield. The contributions interpret the theme broadly, veering off down the branch lines of automotive, technological and bodily loco-motion, while stressing the way technology alters perceptions of space and time. Made entirely in Sheffield, Loco-Motion is designed by the fabulously talented book artist Abi Goodman (Sheffield Creative Guild) and printed on risograph by Choriso Press, Sheffield. We are sure you'll agree that the issue looks gorgeous, in all its grainy, risographic glory! 

All funds raised go straight back into making next year’s issue. We hope you’ll join us in supporting the arts through this exciting, loco-motive venture. 

Why should you support our cause?

We believe strongly in supporting and facilitating accessible art and our goal is to introduce poets, authors, dramatists and social commentators to a wider audience. Central to Sheffield is its influential creative writing scene and our publication shines a light on some of the sensational literary talent this city has to offer. Get a copy of issue 14 and you are ensuring that new writers are supported in Sheffield. This year, we took that ethos of creative collaboration even further, through partnership with the NRM. We were also fortunate to have the issue designed by the exceptionally talented book artist Abi Goodman (Sheffield Creative Guild) and printed on risograph by Choriso Press, Sheffield. Loco-Motion is really an object that connects a lot of creative people and places, both within Sheffield and Yorkshire. Support the arts locally by buying a copy! 

Spread the word

We can’t wait to have you on board our special issue and share with you the incredibly diverse, exciting and remarkable writing our students have produced. Our fourteenth issue is available online and in print! However, you don’t need to buy a copy to help us out. Support our campaign by spreading the word on social media or by sharing this page. 

https://www.facebook.com/Route57UoS/

https://twitter.com/RouteFiftySeven

https://www.instagram.com/route57_13/?hl=en

Launch

We are excited to announce that we will be launching the special issue of Loco-Motion along with its companion digital issue on 30 May at Blackwells Jessop West. We'd love to see you there! If you are unable to attend the launch date, the book will be available from the foyer of Jessop West and many other venues across Sheffield. Please email if you have any questions.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mike Cramer. I'm an actor, producer, writer and adjunct professor. I live in New York City, but I grew up in Northern California. The gold country, Yosemite, Tahoe, King's Canyon, plus the central coast, are the places I remember from my youth. I've written two books, a play, and I've optioned a screenplay, but this is my most personal work: a collection of short stories inspired by the Sierra foothills and my family. 

I've been writing the Van Winkle County stories for several years. I also adapted two stories I'd written earlier to fit into the series. Only one of them has been published to date. Short Stories ain't easy.

This is a passion project for me. It was inspired by my love for my Grandfather, who died in 2009 at the age of 90. He was straight out of a Norman Rockwell painting. He was a hunter and fisherman, served in the Pacific, and was the best grandpa anybody could ever have wanted. I'd been reading a lot of Faulkner and Hemingway when he passed, and began writing stories about a fictional county named for my mom's family, and its odd denizens. There's maybe 10% truth in the stories, and a whole lot of BS, which is how Grandpa would have liked them.  

Money is needed both to finish the project and to pay overhead (rent, phone bill) in August/September, when the book will be laid out. It will be a short book, just three or four stories. In large part it is meant to introduce these stories to a broad audience, in hopes of attracting some attention to them so that others can be placed in a couple of journals and magazines.  Selling short stories isn't easy (especially since Amazon stopped accepting new submissions to their Kindle Singles program). This is a way to monetize a few of them and, hopefully, build interest for the others. 

If enough is raised, it will go to hiring a copy editor and graphic designer.  For five years, I ran the ePublishing unit of VoxPop, a cafe, bookstore, and publishing house in Brooklyn. I set up print runs, formatted and laid out text, arranged for editing and graphic design, and oversaw publication for dozens of books, so I know what is involved in a project like this. This campaign will help me get three of the stories published. They will be made available in eBook form and in print. 

This is a simple campaign. We are offering perks at the $100, $50, and $25 levels. At the $100 level you get a signed pre-release print copy of the book and are thanked in the acknowledgements page. At $50 you get a pre-release copy of the print book and acknowledgement. At $25 you get a pre-release copy of the eBook and acknowledgement. With any other amount you get my extreme gratitude and are thanked here on the IndieGoGo website.
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Mike Cramer. I'm an actor, producer, writer and adjunct professor. I live in New York City, but I grew up in Northern California. The gold country, Yosemite, Tahoe, King's Canyon, plus the central coast, are the places I remember from my youth. I've written two books, a play, and I've optioned a screenplay, but this is my most personal work: a collection of short stories inspired by the Sierra foothills and my family. 
I've been writing the Van Winkle County stories for several years. I also adapted two stories I'd written earlier to fit into the series. Only one of them has been published to date. Short Stories ain't easy.
This is a passion project for me. It was inspired by my love for my Grandfather, who died in 2009 at the age of 90. He was straight out of a Norman Rockwell painting. He was a hunter and fisherman, served in the Pacific, and was the best grandpa anybody could ever have wanted. I'd been reading a lot of Faulkner and Hemingway when he passed, and began writing stories about a fictional county named for my mom's family, and its odd denizens. There's maybe 10% truth in the stories, and a whole lot of BS, which is how Grandpa would have liked them.  
Money is needed both to finish the project and to pay overhead (rent, phone bill) in August/September, when the book will be laid out. It will be a short book, just three or four stories. In large part it is meant to introduce these stories to a broad audience, in hopes of attracting some attention to them so that others can be placed in a couple of journals and magazines.  Selling short stories isn't easy (especially since Amazon stopped accepting new submissions to their Kindle Singles program). This is a way to monetize a few of them and, hopefully, build interest for the others. 
If enough is raised, it will go to hiring a copy editor and graphic designer.  For five years, I ran the ePublishing unit of VoxPop, a cafe, bookstore, and publishing house in Brooklyn. I set up print runs, formatted and laid out text, arranged for editing and graphic design, and oversaw publication for dozens of books, so I know what is involved in a project like this. This campaign will help me get three of the stories published. They will be made available in eBook form and in print. 
This is a simple campaign. We are offering perks at the $100, $50, and $25 levels. At the $100 level you get a signed pre-release print copy of the book and are thanked in the acknowledgements page. At $50 you get a pre-release copy of the print book and acknowledgement. At $25 you get a pre-release copy of the eBook and acknowledgement. With any other amount you get my extreme gratitude and are thanked here on the IndieGoGo website.

story:
Hello, I'm Cassie Ferrer, founder of Behind those Heels, LLC, along with my business partner Debbie Belnavis-Brimble, Inner Brilliance Coach and Mentor to women, #1 International Best-Selling Author and publisher. We both share a passion for supporting women to step into their inner power and share their truth because we believe that behind those heels is a woman who has been on a journey filled with so many challenges, hardship and heartache and yet she has overcome all odds to live a more extraordinary and fulfilling life and is making an impact on others. Sharing stories like this have will inspire others to give themselves permission to live the life that they are meant to live.

We are looking for support to raise funds to publish our book Behind those Heels, which will be launched in Fall/Winter, 2020. Behind those Heels is be a compilation of stories from women who have overcome various challenges, including physical and/or mental abuse, loss, abandonment, financial challenges, cultural issues, and other major obstacles. This book will share the pivotal moment that led each woman to make the decision to bring positive change in her life and provide strategies of how others in similar situations can take action and claim their success.

 

Giving Back

Your generous contribution not only funds the publishing costs for the Behind those Heels book, you are also contributing to a wider movement. A percentage of the proceeds from the book will be donated to various non-profit organizations providing ongoing resources for women who are creating independence in their lives as they step away from their current situations, providing healing and ongoing guidance and support for those who need it.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that sometimes you really want to show your support, yet you are not able to from a financial perspective. If you would really like to support, please share our project with those that you know would like to support us, your friends, your family, your work colleagues and even on social media. There is always someone in your life that loves a brilliant read and this book promises to be just that and more.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Post this campaign on social media!
  • Send emails to your family and friends to let them know!
  • Share every one of our emails to as many people as you can!
  • Be the change, and share the change!

 

Stay Connected With Us

As well as getting updates here on Indiegogo, please like and follow us on Facebook where we are always sharing updates and inspirational messages and you can learn more about our podcast guests: 

https://www.facebook.com/behindthoseheels

 

About Behind those Heels

The concept of Behind those Heels was created a few years ago when I met a group of accomplished and confident women from my volunteer network. These women shared unexpected stories on how they overcame their challenges and found fulfillment in lives. I was instantly inspired by their uplifting stories. In talking to these remarkable women, I realized that behind those heels, every woman has a story and I made it my personal vision to share these stories to inspire women around the world.

Our Purpose

To create a movement of women sharing their powerful stories using various platforms including books and events, encouraging others to take action and seek support to enhance their lives.
Our Vision

To inspire and empower millions of women worldwide by sharing powerful stories of extraordinary women through multiple platforms.

Our Mission

Inspiring women around the globe to seek fulfillment and living with purpose by sharing powerful stories and messages of remarkable women who have lead extraordinary lives.

We document the journeys of women and share their stories through multiple platforms, including books, podcasts, events and so much more. The goal to bring out these stories is to provide hope and possibilities, to inspire, and empower others to make bold decisions about their own lives then take massive steps to enhance their lives in positive ways.

We are currently working on our very first book which will be a compilation of messages sharing the journeys women have had, leading to their extraordinary success which will be out in Fall/Winter 2020 and we need your support to bring this project to the market. 

We strongly believe that Behind those Heels will create a movement to inspire many women around the globe and you can help to make this happen by supporting our projects, starting with our first book Behind those Heels.
 

THANK YOU in advance for your support. We really appreciate you.

story:
Developers, enthusiasts, and critics regard the 1990s as a wellspring of creativity and technological innovation for the first-person shooter genre of video games. Released to widespread acclaim in June 1996, Quake changed the landscape of shooters and gaming technology, but not without taking a toll on its creators and shaking id Software to its foundation.

While previous books have documented the history of id Software's early years, Rocket Jump goes beyond the making of the original Quake to present exhaustive details on the development of its sequels as well as behind-the-scenes accounts from id Software's designers on the technological innovations and political power plays that defined the studio's culture.

In addition to a deep dive into id's development history, Rocket Jump chronicles the making of other FPS titles such as Half-Life, Team Fortress, Duke Nukem 3D, and Star Wars: Dark Forces. The result is the most comprehensive history of the FPS genre's golden era to date.

Rocket Jump is based on research and first-hand interviews with developers from throughout Quake's history including John Carmack, John Romero, American McGee, Jennell Jaquays, Graeme Devine, and more.

Witness the impact of Quake and id Software on other FPS studios such as Apogee/3D Realms, Valve Software, and independent developers.

What is a "Rocket Jump"? 

In Quake, a rocket jump is performed by aiming your rocket launcher at the ground, then jumping and firing a rocket. The resultant blast sends you soaring to great heights, even to places you cannot reach without executing the manoeuvre, but at the cost of self-inflicted damage. 

The Book

  • Approximately 500 pages with two full colour plate sections (example shown above).
  • High quality design by the fantastic Amazing 15 design team.
  • Illustrated throughout with photography and game stills.
  • Royal format Hardback with head and tail bands.

About David L Craddock

David L. Craddock lives with his wife in Canton, Ohio. He is the author of The Gairden Chronicles and War of the Elementalists fantasy series for young adults, Break Out: How the Apple II Launched the PC Gaming Revolution, the bestselling Stay Awhile and Listen books that recount the history of Blizzard Entertainment, and Rocket Jump: Quake and the Golden Age of First-Person Shooters. Visit him at davidlcraddock.com and on Twitter @davidlcraddock.

 

Extract

CHAPTER 1: WE ARE THE WIND

Fighting for Justice… Later

In the summer of 1996, Quake became the fourth jewel in Texas-based developer id Software's crown. Yet in a way, Quake had also been the second.

Commander Keen, a trilogy of smooth-scrolling platform games developed on PC, put id on the map in 1990. As Keen caught on, a buzz grew around id's next game, The Fight for Justice, teased by selecting Preview from Keen's main menu.

"The Fight for Justice was a top-down RPG," said John Romero. Along with John Carmack, Kevin Cloud, and Adrian Carmack (no relation to John), Romero was a co-founder of id Software and one of the company's most prolific level designers.

Id's design for The Fight for Justice stemmed from a Dungeons & Dragons campaign ran by John Carmack, dungeon master and technical wizard responsible for writing the engines that powered id's games. Carmack had hosted his D&D campaign for the other id developers since they had founded the company in Shreveport, Louisiana, back when they had been cranking out a new game every two months for Softdisk magazine's Gamer's Edge subscription disk.

Every weekend, the id crew would take a break from developing their latest game and gather around a table where Carmack directed their latest adventure. As his campaign unfolded, Carmack paired up his friends' characters with bands of heroes such as the Silver Shadow Band, who rode on the back of a silver dragon and scouted for monsters and other perpetrators of injustice. "You wouldn't be able to see them because they were above the clouds, and they would dive down and solve a situation, and then get out. They were all insanely high-level characters," Romero continued.

Quake, the leader of the Band, was, as Romero put it, "a really amazing badass." In The Fight for Justice, players would assume control of Quake and wield the Hammer of Thunderbolts—think Mjolnir, the mythical hammer carried by Marvel superhero Thor, only ten times more powerful.

Romero and the others had a vision for how Quake's adventures should play out on the screen and got to work on The Fight For Justice in January 1991. Unfortunately, the technology of the era did not measure up to their imaginations. Rather than press on and release a game they weren't happy with, the team mothballed The Fight for Justice and got to work on Dangerous Dave and the Haunted Mansion, a 2D platformer built using Commander Keen's tech.

The guys at id had dropped their RPG-inspired romp in less time than it would have taken to change a t-shirt. No one gave it much thought. Among the team, such changes of heart were known as bit flips, a programming joke referencing a state in computer's memory that could only store one of two values: on, or off.

"We used to just say, 'We are the wind.' We'll change our mind like that on anything," Romero explained. "We did that so many times: We made a decision that would immediately and absolutely change the course of the company."

Preparing to Leap

Four years and a string of best-selling games later, id Software sat perched at the top of the games industry. Commander Keen had been a big hit, but Wolfenstein 3D and Doom had forever altered the course of the studio, and the gaming industry.

Inspired by Castle Wolfenstein, a stealth game on the Apple II where players crept through the corridors of Adolph Hitler's Nazi fortress, Wolfenstein 3D had traded sneaking around for blisteringly fast run-and-gun action from a first-person perspective in 1992, popularizing the first-person shooter. When Doom's shareware episode uploaded to University of Wisconsin's servers in December 1993, online deathmatches brought network traffic to a standstill on college campuses and in offices around the world.

Artifacts, awards, and other memorabilia from the awards display case in the reception area of id Software's Dallas, Texas-based headquarters.

 

Commander Keen, Wolfenstein 3D, Doom. Three big hits, the latter leaving an indelible mark on popular culture. The studio's reputation and deep coffers combined with its status as an independently owned and operated studio afforded id the freedom to pick and choose what game to work on next.

Romero and the other designers harnessed Doom's toolset to build maps for a sequel. Doing so was not an arbitrary decision. They had made a sequel to the Commander Keen trilogy and a prequel to Wolfenstein 3D, Spear of Destiny, by harnessing each game's respective engine and toolset. Because the team was familiar with an inaugural game's technology when the time came to make a sequel, they were able to deliver follow-ups in record time.

Where id had taken nearly one year to develop Doom's engine, the DoomEd level editor, and the game's twenty-seven levels, Doom 2: Hell on Earth blasted onto store shelves nine months after the original game and featured more of what fans had loved: more maps, more weapons, more monsters, more speed, more weapons, more power-ups, and, inevitably, more custom levels built by Doom's community of fans thanks to free editing tools that enterprising users would base on id Tech 1—known as the Doom engine until it was retroactively branded the first generation of id Tech in order to more easily classify subsequent versions of the technology that powered id's shooters.

Meanwhile, Carmack set about researching and writing a brand-new game engine. Although Wolfenstein 3Dand Doom let players move freely through their environments, they were not truly three-dimensional, nor were they strictly 2D. Instead Doom's engine is pseudo-3D, referred to by many as 2.5D. Under the hood, Carmack had pulled off a high degree of artifice to generate the illusion of 3D movement and terrain.

A screenshot from early in Quake's development.

 

Although levels are rendered as three-dimensional spaces, Doom's action takes place on a 2D plane, like graph paper with X and Y coordinates. The engine plugs in height information to apply textures to walls, floors, and ceiling on a two-dimensional plane, then stretches and projects them. The rendition is convincing: Stairs connect higher and lower floors, and elevators run players up and down shafts.

However, id Tech 1's sleight of hand came with limitations. Floors and ceilings cannot be sloped. Players climb staircases to different floors, but they should notice that those floors never overlap. The reason is that objects such as rooms and bridges cannot be placed directly above or below one another. Because all data exists on a two-dimensional plane, any rooms or corridors stacked vertically would occupy the same space on the grid even though they appear to be distinct locations.

Carmack's goal for id's next game was to write a bona fide 3D engine featuring six degrees of freedom: The ability for objects to move in any direction over three axes. Instead of returning to Wolfenstein, Doom, or Keen, the id developers dusted off The Fight for Justice, which they would call, simply, Quake.
