story:
The Perks

The Cause

The Poetry
ANCESTRAL HOME 
Eons from life’s birth
the sea still calls us by name.
And we still answer

This and many other poems have been gathered over the course of an incredibly productive year of writing. I’m looking for your help to get this book of poetry published. 

My name is Andrew Furst. I am the self-published author of Western Lights, a meditation teacher, Buddhist blogger, and a technologist. On evenings and weekends, I write at www.andrewfurst.net.


The Book

What does it mean to be awake? 

What is it like to actually be alive?

The Buddha is the spark of life in each of us. What could be more important than being awake for life?  Nothing brings us back to it more than spending time in nature.

My book titled And We Still Answer, is a collection of poetry exploring the intersection of nature and our humanity. It includes traditional forms like haiku and tanka, free-verse, and others.

I invest time in writing poetry for two reasons 

  1. It pushes me to be fully awake to the emotions and sensations that make me who I am. This helps me be a better human being.
  2. It also invites you, the reader, to find your own awakening. Not by way of any particular wisdom that I have to offer, but by observing the act of someone noticing.

The Campaign

My campaign’s goal is to raise money to design, edit, and publish my book And We Still Answer.  Self-publishing this book is not about making money, it’s about finding new ways to reach out with the Dharma. Proceeds from sales of the book will be used to provide free meditation classes and other Dharma activities.

Here's the breakout on the costs:


Poetry is a joy that has been dormant for thirty years. Fifty years has tempered the brooding of youth and given me some experience to convey.  Some of the 75 plus poems speak through the prism of Buddhism.  Others - decidedly not.  

Please consider this invitation to share the experience of awakening. Making a contribution and letting like-minded people know how they can help will make this a great experience for everyone.  


  

What You Get

Perks range from signed copies of the book, copies of my other book, e-book versions, to prayer beads (mala) that I make by hand. 

How You Can Help

While contributions are the life’s blood of this and any other crowd  funding campaign, if you aren’t able to give money but want to help, please share the campaign with others who might be willing to pitch in.  Email is the best way to get the word around.  Use the buttons at the top of the page to share the campaign.  The more noise the better.

Thank You

story:
Hi, my name is Graeme Innes, I dedicated the best part of 35 years to environmental well being, protecting sacred sights, supporting land rights for Australia's Aboriginal people, and fostering people's health through facilitating Earth initiation rituals, and now I require your help.

I need to raise $4000 to ensure Platypus Dreaming .. a prophecy can get the promotion it deserves at the International Book Fairs in London, Frankfurt, New York Beijing and Guadeloupe (Mexico),  encouraging people around the world to follow in  the foot steps of Australia's indigenous people, promoting peace by integrating this more logical AND intuitive way of being.

Life isn't meant to be lived as an either/or scenario, but by integrating intelligence that's rooted in the fullness of sustainable (in) formation.

Devoting much energy over years sharing the things I've learned, including facilitating overnight earth burial initiations to promote the growth of moral excellence and resilience within individuals and in society. I've undertaken the work believing environmental and community well-being to be the birthright of all species, without thinking about the need for creating a bank balance.

Platypus Dreaming is racy, insightful, provocative, passionate and deep, infusing the mind with a new way of “seeing”, promoting peace and right relationship through the use of a profusion of images too powerful to be easily dismissed.

I wish I could lay claim to its content, but it's been the result of product self-assembly, functioning rather like a 3D Printer whose program was laid down in my mind through experiences encountered during life lived beyond the bounds of 'good little boy' white fella conditioning.

In the quiet of the Central Australian bush there are people able to rely upon one another's senses as though their own; intelligence magnified not only by the human group, but by their animal, plant and ‘country’ co-inhabitants as equal informants.

Remote dwelling Aboriginals exhibit a coherent collective intelligence, which in towns and cities gets drowned out by the exponentially exploding babble of enfeebling trinkets, making the populace more and more reliant on crutches of convenience which everyone apparently ‘needs’.

Ancient understandings lie at the heart of Platypus Dreaming, depicting a peaceful yet radical departure from humanity’s current role in life, having dominion over, rather than living in the Dominion of God.

It exemplifies a way of Being that opens a path to world peace, using keys hidden in plain sight, keys to end environmental degradation and foster new understandings that establish balanced, gender based cultural architecture, in accordance with clear principles of creation.

These were expressed following a casual question to Senior Lore men and women from the Warlpiri culture in Australia’s Tanami Desert.

“What's the point of relationship between you mob and us white-fellas, given that you no-longer regard us as the ‘white ghosts’ of your forefathers returning”, the literal meaning of Kardia, which was the name they used to signify their relationship to the first European colonists.

"I dunn-know. Never thought about that one question. Can't answer him". I left the community none the wiser.

“Jappanangka, Jappanangka”, the voice of an old man insistently called as I wandered along a path 1,000 kilometres distant and two and a half years later. I ignored him, after all, one in eight Warlpiri men were of the Jappanangka ‘skin’. He kept calling until finally I turned.

“Yeah you, Jappanangka. Remember that one big question you asked me.....well just after you left us mob,we got him television. All the old people talked for months and months, maybe one year, ‘bout that one question you asked. That television, he carry two pattern. One big one of mobs of people like yous, and one small one of mobs like us, everyone dying slow way.Then we understand why our parents teached us that we wuz at the end of The Dreaming, coz we only had half a system, that female circle part. You mob, you’ve only got the male side.

None of us got future without everything being in proper balance. It’s same way in all nature. To make him right decision, gotta have full circle of (in) formation, then him show proper which way, not just man side or woman side”.

Empowered through fortuitous connections and years of work seeking the ‘right words’ to forge cerebral switches to illuminate long hidden mind-paths, this book has also been built on the unwitting participation of many people living in the Rainbow Region of northern New South Wales.

While many there already comprehend life’s indivisibility and recognize that its component reflections carry differing attributes, enhanced by location and exposure to readily available educative nutrients, many others do not.

In order to show the contemporary relevance and utility of that ‘way of seeing’, and avoid being regarded as some sort of Aboriginal cultural specialist, this novel was deliberately set in a ‘white fella’ setting.

My early questioning of life lacked adequate appreciation and inquiry for skills in material financial generation and management, attributes I now require to bring this project to fruition, propelling it onto the world stage of International Book Fairs that are held in London, New York, Frankfurt, Beijing and Guadeloupe (Mexico).

Raised to respond to the power of intelligence and information for the betterment of all, clear links to environment and life soon became unavoidably apparent, yet it still appeared as though most people willingly accepted the notion of separation and isolation, cut off from one another by the use of split moralities, leading to acceptance of bullying and violence, afflictions many Aboriginal people have adopted as their cultural integrity has been abused.

As I traveled internationally, conflict was in broad evidence there also, often fostered by ‘authorities’ to their personal and cultural advantage. They show little regard for the misery, destruction and chaos split moralities engender, and it became my mission to look behind the veil, finding points of connection with them to create possible pathways for change.

Through involvement in environmental actions, protecting rainforest and cultural sites of tribal and world significance, I came to see I was composed of all life’s parts. There was no thing that hadn’t somehow infused my body with its juices and substance. Everything that’s (in) formed by light, provides our information and isn’t just unreliable infirm ation like so much media noise.

Platypus Dreaming .. a prophecy is the result of an endeavor to place the reader inside that understanding, to realize the true vastness, the spaciousness and the accessibility of informed intelligence, and give it wings, allowing people to recognize it as theirs, belonging to their families communities and nations, finally able to see that although their hands, arms, legs, feet, torsos and heads all appear to live in different cultures, they do so without an internal battle for parts domination.

“seeing”, promoting peace and right relationship through the use of a profusion
of images too powerful to be easily dismissed.
I wish I could lay claim to its content, but it's been the result of product self-assembly, functioning rather like a 3D Printer whose program was laid down in my mind through experiences encountered during life lived beyond the bounds of 'good little boy' white fella conditioning.
In the quiet of the Central
Australian bush there are people able to rely upon one another's senses as
though their own; intelligence magnified not only by the human group, but by
their animal, plant and ‘country’ co-inhabitants as equal informants.
Remote dwelling Aboriginals exhibit
a coherent collective intelligence, which in towns and cities gets drowned out by
the exponentially exploding babble of enfeebling trinkets, making the populace
more and more reliant on crutches of convenience which everyone apparently ‘needs’.
Ancient understandings lie at the heart of
Platypus Dreaming, depicting a peaceful yet radical departure
from humanity’s current role in life, having dominion over, rather than living in the Dominion of God.
It exemplifies a way of Being that opens a
path to world peace, using keys hidden in plain sight, keys to end environmental
degradation and foster new understandings that establish balanced, gender
based cultural architecture, in accordance with clear principles of creation. 
These were expressed following
a casual question to Senior Lore men and women from the Warlpiri culture in
Australia’s Tanami Desert.
“What's the point of relationship
between you mob and us white-fellas, given that you no-longer regard us as the
‘white ghosts’ of your forefathers returning”, the literal meaning of Kardia,
which was the name they used to signify their relationship to the first
European colonists.
"I dunn-know. Never thought about that one question. Can't answer him". I left the community none the wiser.
“Jappanangka, Jappanangka”, the
voice of an old man insistently called as I wandered along a path 1,000
kilometres distant and two and a half years later. I ignored him, after all,
one in eight Warlpiri men were of the Jappanangka ‘skin’. He kept calling until
finally I turned.
“Yeah you, Jappanangka. Remember
that one big question you asked me.....well just after you left us mob,we got
him television. All the old people talked for months and months, maybe one
year, ‘bout that one question you asked. That television, he carry two pattern.
One big one of mobs of people like yous, and one small one of mobs like us, everyone
dying slow way.Then we understand why our parents teached us that we wuz at the
end of The Dreaming, coz we only had
half a system, that female circle part. You mob, you’ve only
got the male side. 
None of us got future without everything being in proper
balance. It’s same way in all nature. To make him right decision, gotta have full circle of (in) formation, then him show proper which way, not just man side or woman side”.
Empowered
through fortuitous connections and years of work seeking the ‘right words’ to
forge cerebral switches to illuminate long hidden mind-paths, this book has
also been built on the unwitting participation of many people living in the
Rainbow Region of northern New South Wales. 
While many there already comprehend
life’s indivisibility and recognize that its component reflections carry differing
attributes, enhanced by location and exposure to readily available educative
nutrients, many others do not.
In order
to show the contemporary relevance and utility of that ‘way of seeing’, and
avoid being regarded as some sort of Aboriginal cultural specialist, this novel
was deliberately set in a ‘white fella’ setting.
My early questioning
of life lacked adequate appreciation and inquiry for skills in material financial
generation and management, attributes I now require to bring this project to
fruition, propelling it onto the world stage of International Book Fairs that
are held in London, New York, Frankfurt, Beijing and Guadeloupe (Mexico). 
Raised to respond to the power of
intelligence and information for the betterment of all, clear links to
environment and life soon became unavoidably apparent, yet it still appeared as though
most people willingly accepted the notion of separation and isolation, cut off
from one another by the use of split moralities, leading to acceptance of
bullying and violence, afflictions many Aboriginal people have adopted as their
cultural integrity has been abused.
As I
traveled internationally, conflict was in broad evidence there also,
often fostered by ‘authorities’ to their personal and cultural advantage. They
show little regard for the misery, destruction and chaos split moralities
engender, and it became my mission to look behind the veil, finding points of
connection with them to create possible pathways for change.
Through
involvement in environmental actions, protecting rainforest and cultural sites
of tribal and world significance, I came to see I was composed of all life’s
parts. There was no thing that hadn’t somehow infused my body with its juices
and substance. Everything that’s (in) formed by light, provides our information
and isn’t just unreliable infirm ation like so much media noise.
Platypus Dreaming .. a prophecy is the
result of an endeavor to place the reader inside that understanding, to
realize the true vastness, the spaciousness and the accessibility of informed
intelligence, and give it wings, allowing people to recognize it as theirs,
belonging to their families communities and nations, finally able to see that although
their hands, arms, legs, feet, torsos and heads all appear to live in different cultures,
they do so without an internal battle for parts domination.

story:
About this project

The story

It all started when my big brother Henry, discovered a mysterious map. It shows the secret treasure of King Tut. And before I could protest, Henry dragged me into his treasure hunt! In no time at all, we'd set on the way to Egypt. It was an adventure I'd never forget....

The story is an adventurous story geared towards 4th to 7th grades. In hope to provide an adventure while learning about things that has happens in our history. Creating this book help kids become interested in history.

Progress

The book has been fully written, illustrated are almost complete. While formatted for paperback is complete. I have selected the printers for the book. The files for the book are ready to send to the printers if we reach our goal.

The Rewards

$5 – a personal handwritten thank you note.

$15 – a copy of The Lost Treasure of King Tut, and personal handwritten thank you note

$25 – a copy of The Lost treasure of King Tut, (while one copy is donated to a public school in your honor) and a personal handwritten thank you note

$50 – a copy of The lost Treasure of King Tut , (while 2 copies are donated to a public school in your honor) and a personal handwritten Thank you note.

Indiegogo funds

The funds primarily go towards the cost of printing the books. Additional costs for the project include: purchasing ISBNs, proofing and copyrighting.

Risks and challenges

The main risk would be if there is a delay in the shipment of the books due to overseas transit. I have checked with the print vendor and the printing and shipping process typically takes 10-12 weeks. So we should be able to hit the August due date.

Public Schools

If you are work with a public school or a library of a public school we want to make sure that you get a copy of  Th Lost Treasure of King Tut., feel free to fill out are request form. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1sgZaMePAr8PIntWVBmvJ0DqEm_1dfXnIAnaB_nkQmWM/viewform

FAQ

Have a question? If the info above doesn't help, you can ask the project creator directly.

story:
We need a Champion

Like so many people of color I was struck deep in my soul by the incredibly outsized worlds of fantasy, sci-fi, heroes and villains.  I honestly cannot remember when I did not like stories about space, or hobbits, or caped crusaders and big blue boy scouts. 

I lived for comics, I loved the TV serials, I jumped for the heroes on the big screen.  After the movies Star Wars and Superman my perspective on the world was set, I really did believe a man could fly.  But still, when it came to reading the written word, I was even more intrigued by the universes MY mind created from the magic of the author's words.  

But the question was always, where was I?  Where are the people who look like me?  Are we not heroes? Do we not exist in the future?  Can I read and enjoy something that mirrors the world I see in my mind's eye with my experiences and desires outside of the usual stereotypes?  With this question I knew then, there was some magic in me, magic I truly wanted to share.

Over the decades we have seen heroes of color appear.  Starship captains,  aliens, web-slingers, war-machines, a man of steel, and perhaps my favorite, a hero genius Prince come King of a mighty nation called Wakanda. I wasn't sure I could add to what was already so wonderful, and happily growing.  But then, I had to remind myself of what I tell others, we each have a story to tell.  If we have the gift to breathe life into what we see in our mind's eye, then we should endeavor to do so. However, few are those that can create something worthy on their own.  I am not one of those, I need your support.  

In the full darkness of the Great Gulf between Galaxies a presence stirs, something that has not been seen for an age.  Its disruptive entrance into our reality does not go unnoticed.  In the Majestic Galaxy sentients observe this event, powers are alerted, and great fleets are on the move. 

Two forces in this far off galaxy fight for control, waging war on a horrifying scale.  The appearance of this presence, The Kha’ahmpion, can tilt the scales of this conflict.  On one side the Zradgen Empire and its warrior prince, Krakoth.  On the other, the Supremors of the Narellan Federation and their Great Majestic Alliance.  They will seek this power, wherever it may go.

On Earth, a young Joshua Champion self-proclaimed nerd and avowed fantasy sci-fi geek is just now coming into the world of high school pop life, by way of a love for football.  Thanks to his friends he is now realizing his physical talents as a star wide receiver for the Westvale Vikings.  Life as a teen is indeed good, until peer pressure, exuberance and risk lead him to a fateful decision, one that will change his life. 

From the stars in a far off galaxy all the way to a vibrant thriving American city, forces that stride the cosmos with power beyond reckoning are converging on Atlanta, all to shatter the stability and safety of Joshua’s life, changing him into something he could scarcely imagine, something he never thought to see beyond the pages of his much loved comic books and novels.  He must take up this mantle and defend all that we know, if we are to survive.  Joshua, must become more than just a hero.  He must become CHAMPION.

Champion is the hero that has spoken to me through the years.  A young man of color  from Atlanta, Georgia who finds himself a victim of circumstance, embroiled in an adventure to rival any other.  With the amazing art of Eric Wilkerson the universe of Champion takes form in powerful clarity and beautiful color.  This is superhero!  This is science fantasy!  This is myth and magic.  This is CHAMPION!

Your help would bring Champion to hundreds of thousands of people who are looking for inspiration from the joy and power of myth.  This campaign will fund the creation of a series of novels, a graphic novel, and hopefully a few minutes of cartoon joy!  This would be my new universe of heroes and villains, stories that EVERYONE can truly enjoy.

YOUR SUPPORT CREATES A NEW UNIVERSE

We are seeking to raise $30,000 in order to publish the book and start the marketing campaign: print, audio, and video.  But that is just the beginning.

  • Champion is a decalogy+, so there is much more story to come.
  • There are eight more manuscripts, different stories of amazing quality that these funds will bring to life.
  • For your support not only are you responsible for creating a new UNIVERSE of work, but you will get CHAMPION the novel, and some of the most incredible artwork you have ever seen, created by the amazing Eric Wilkerson.

PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITHIN YOUR NETWORK, FRIENDS & FAMILY!

story:
Thanks to everyone who contributed! Our second campaign can be found at:

Http://igg.me/at/candidate2court


We believe that the Municipal Elections Act should be applied equally to all candidates in Hamilton and the Act be administered equally in the province of Ontario.

There were complaints filed by Viv Saunders on eight individual candidates who ran in the 2014 Hamilton Election. Although the Hamilton Election Compliance Committee acknowledged that five of the candidates contravened the Municipal Elections Act they decided in all cases DOING NOTHING was appropriate.

DOING NOTHING means that the information available to the public is still incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.

DOING NOTHING means that payment of honorariums to volunteers, purchases of laptops, cell phone plans, televisions, home theatre systems, wine baskets, gift cards, Santa Carousels, chocolate truffles, etc. etc.,  is acceptable to us as the electorate.

DOING NOTHING means that the same individuals will continue to abuse the same rules without any fear of any repercussion or oversight and we silently condone the behaviour.

Doing Nothing is not acceptable: an Appeal was filed with the Ontario Court of Justice naming five candidates.

Eric Gillespie has been retained as legal counsel in order to file the appropriate paperwork with the Ontario Court of Justice. 100% of funds raised will be used to cover the anticipated court costs for the following candidates:

  • 1. Tom Jackson
  • 2. Sam Merulla
  • 3. Maria Pearson
  • 4. Lloyd Ferguson
  • 5. Terry Whitehead
The Ontario Court of Justice has the ability to order actual independent audits of each of the candidates filings. There is no other mechanism available to pursue an independent, non-biased review. The candidates file auditor opinions with their financial statements; opinions that they pay for.

Why We Care

We are a group of volunteers who really do not get paid. We believe that elections are an important part of the democratic process and should not be taken lightly. Our position is supported by the Municipal Elections Act; provincial legislation that contains the specific rules governing elections. Adherence to the rules in this situation should not be optional for anyone.

Bill 52, Protection of Public Participation Act, 2015 is  being implemented to amend the Courts of Justice Act, the Libel and Slander Act and the Statutory Powers Procedure Act in order to protect expression on matters of public interest. 

Please contribute to our efforts!

story:
Summary

Indie Quill is an online book marketplace specifically for small presses and self-publishers. Smartly tailored to the special needs of this group (as well as for readers who love discovering new worlds to inhabit), Indie Quill is poised to be the next step in the self-publishing world. Our aim is to increase the quality, diversity, and discoverability of independent books by creating a centralized home online to buy, sell, and discover works.

Self publishers in particular have historically faced major hurdles to sustainable self-employment through writing because of lack of distribution, an unfair playing field online, and exploitation by unscrupulous providers.  We look to increase sales for authors by giving authors and readers better products, tools, and quality standards.  But we need your help getting off the ground! 

The Backstory

"Everyone has a story to tell, and it's my job to help you tell it better."

That is the motto Founder and CEO Thalia Sutton uses while working as an editor, and it's a rare idea in the publishing world. Disenfranchised with the elitism found in the publishing industry and the writing schools that feed it, when Thalia graduated from Columbia University in 2012, she decided to put herself to work where she felt her skills were needed most: being a freelance editor for self publishers.

Over the years, she found a great diversity of authors and stories, but a lack of resources for them.  Yet people's goals, and troubles, were often the same. She was shocked to hear, time and again, these main troubles from the authors she served:



No one should ever feel like quitting something they love because the system is inefficient. Thalia waited for a website to address the needs of her clients, but over time, the issues actually got worse.  More companies hopped on the bandwagon to exploit uneducated author hopefuls, rather than giving them the resources they actually needed. 

So Thalia came to the conclusion that, while the publishing industry works well for some, there are many good books and valuable stories that don't get seen, which is a shame.  There were thousands of books that should have been thriving in the self-published market based on what people wanted to read.  But they weren't.  And why?  Because the people who cared didn't have the means, and the people with the means didn't care. 

Because no one felt the art of the common man had value.

So she decided: I'll make a marketplace specifically for you.


Plot Twist

(How We're Different)

1. Outlook

We're book people, innovating a home for each other--we want to help you achieve your goals of making a living off of your art and, as a reader, a better book to read.  We believe in good customer service and also that you're the one that knows your book, and your reading habits, best.  It's like being in your local bookstore, but with "local writers" from all across the country.

2. Tools & Platform

Indie Quill wants to be the best place out there for selling indie books, so we take the best of what's out there, put it together in one place, and innovate on top of it. Author shops help sellers' works be collected easily in one place, so if you like an author or company, you can browse their book series quickly and efficiently.  Shops also have locations attached, so buyers can support local while online.

Our search engine uses over 15 criteria, not just a few keywords, to bring up books, so books get seen more often.  Smart and fun filters help readers pick books by mood and taste and reading level, while a graphics-based layout (rather than text-based) lets you browse by covers, which is both entertaining and slows search-fatigue. A pop-out feature also assists in this, giving you the product at a glance.  Meanwhile, you can thumb through a few pages and learn more about the book and author on each product's detailed listing page.  While you're there, hand-crafted recommendations give you truly relevant subsequent reading material, keeping you from getting cliff notes and second editions as recs.

In later stages of development, we want to integrate Goodreads and innovate sharing and discussion of books as well so that each book gets all the love and support it deserves. For authors, we look to provide high-quality reader circles of other authors for feedback support.

3. Empowerment & Diversity

Indie Quill also believes that reading is a means to empowerment, and as such, every group should be represented. Special interest groups and "rare" forms of literature that we want to make sure have a home (and a search criteria) include:



4. Ethics

Your bookstore shouldn't be your publisher. Indie Quill will never publish books; we only offer you place to sell them.  This is because we care about doing one thing and doing it well.

There are many sites today that offer a place to sell self-published books, but in every case they also publish them, which crosses a long-standing ethical boundary that any scrupulous publishing professional knows is there for a good reason.  Simply put, if you both sell and publish books, you are not focused on either one, and everyone loses out because of a glut of bad books.  It becomes a business model based on how many units you can process, not how many return customers you have.  On the other hand, if you do one or the other with proper standards, you can make plenty of money.  Anyone who does both is not looking out for their authors' best interest.

The Crisis Point

(What We Need)

Baseline Goal:

  • $20,000 for initial website construction with its basic foundation of features.  Our website is being designed, tested, and implemented by the wonderful team at Fusionfarm, a division of The Gazette Company.  You can check out their portfolio at their website. 

$20,000 gets us:

  1. The base website with all its necessary features, and a few special ones
  2. Testing, for a smooth website experience without bugs!

Stretch Goals:

  • $25,000 - Cover unforeseen costs in web development, and pay an accountant to help us navigate sales tax in all fifty states and beyond.
  • $30,000 - Help us get to our first trade shows and have the equipment necessary to sign people up on-site!
  • $40,000 - Hire our first extra staff to quality-check books and perform speedy customer service, as well as cover operating costs for the first year!


Rising Action

(Impact)

We're positioned to be the next step in the self-publishing revolution, the capstone of the drive for quality and community that's been building in the indie author industry for past decade.  But more than that, we want to change how the game is played: We want to level the playing field, and make treating authors well the name of the game...as well as treating readers like the intelligent consumers they are.

But more importantly, Indie Quill's greatest potential lies in diversity. Most good books go unpublished, or under marketed, because companies don't think they can make their money back on the project--not because there is anything wrong with the book.  This leaves minorities, women, foreign works, avant-garde works, and forms of literature with small markets (such as poetry) underrepresented or not represented at all.

Take, for example, the sci fi genre.  As popular as it is, there are only one or two authors of color in the genre that even die-hard fans can name, and just as few characters of color who lead the stories themselves.  If Indie Quill can get just two authors of color on our site selling books, we've double what's available to a kid in the Bronx who goes to his local bookstore (if he even has one). 

Too, along with bringing national, and international, reach to authors, we bring a wonderful variety of books and author resources to people who live in small towns that may not have independent bookstores.  A nifty perk of Indie Quill is that author "shops" can have locations attached, so event organizers can easily search for authors in their area to bring to libraries, schools, festivals, and other events.

Aside from diversity of authors and stories, Indie Quill is also positioned, with your help, to assist many authors achieve their dream of making a living off of their writing, in a way that hasn't been widely accessible before to self-publishers.  We hope this will help many small businesses, career writers, women writers, and minority writers achieve financial stability.

Our aim is that all of the above finally get the robust national reach and recognition they deserve for pushing boundaries with works larger publishing houses have passed by.


Rewards

(Rewards!)

  • We have a lot of really cool rewards for you, including editorial services and snazzy merchandise goodies, though you can donate any amount of money without a reward attached. However, our dear friends at Out of Print Clothing--a Brooklyn, NY-based startup that uses out-of-print classic book covers on clothing and accessories--generously offered many of their best-selling products to the Indie Quill cause.  Like IQ, Out of Print believes in furthering the cause of reading to those who would otherwise not have access, and donates a book to Books for Africa for every item they sell. We are very grateful to have their help, and you should check them out after you're done visiting us today.

  • New rewards will be added as others sell out.
  • There is a shipping fee for physical rewards, but it's generally $5 or less if you're in North America.  Please check for the specific amount when picking a reward.
  • We will make every effort to ship rewards such that they arrive for the holidays. If you would prefer expedited shipping, please message us and we can discuss expedited shipping options and their associated cost.
  • In an effort to stay green, your materials may be shipped in recycled/reused packaging materials--but never fear, they shall still arrive safely!
  • If you have any questions about rewards, don't hesitate to send us a message.


REWARDS FROM OUT OF PRINT CLOTHING CO.:

  • Nancy Drew Tote (above); Gatsby tote, Comp tote/pencil pouch, and Curious George pencil pouch (Below)


BOOKMARKS:

Our $10 reward features your choice of a "Book Girls are My Beautiful" bookmark, a limited-edition design made to promote diversity in reading for girls and created specially for this campaign! (Many of the higher rewards include a complimentary bookmark of your choice as well.)



  • And if that doesn't float your boat, try this funny guy here:



BOOKS!

Over the course of the campaign, there will be various books and book sets available as rewards. Check here for descriptions.  Currently, we have the YA adventure series, David Finkleman, Magic Detective available by Seattle, WA-based team, PK Burian and ME Drewry.

Description of the first book, David Finkleman and Dangerous Magic:
Welcome to Olympia, WA--home of magical secrets, dangerous monsters, mystical creatures and the few people able to fight them!

David is in the wrong place at the wrong time.  Or at least that's what he feels like when the FBI recruits him to go undercover at his high school.  It's bad enough that he has to investigate the football players that routinely bully him, but when he discovers they're circulating a deadly drug with a huge side effect, he feels in over his head, because it turns the kids into hideous, blood-sucking chupacabras! 

Sure, he has wizard powers, but he's never really used them before.  Plus, he can't tell a single person about his undercover work or his powers, not even his best friend, Sam. And worst of all, his parents expect him to keep his schoolwork up or he'll be grounded!

As David delves deeper and deeper into the case to source the contraband and its magical maker, he comes close to a new group of friends and coworkers as strange and wonderful as the things he investigates.  And he'll need all the help he can get, because, after all, detective work in the magical world always comes down to one thing: Solving a case before magical murder occurs, especially your own!


About The Founder

Thalia Sutton is the Founder and Senior Editor of Indie Quill.  She comes from a background of teachers and writers and put the two together as a freelance editor for self-publishers, offering tutoring as well as editorial services. She grew up writing and editing stories from a young age, and pursued an interest in literature and film through degrees at the University of Iowa, Columbia University, and the Columbia Publishing Course. 

Her experiences and ideals lead her to a career as a freelance editor, specifically working with self-publishers and startups.  All in all, Thalia has had the honor to work for numerous independent writers as well as Random House, Hachette, Suvudu.com, Columbia University Press, Publisher's Weekly, and Penner Press, among others.

And now, she leads a team to revolutionize the world she loves so much: the world of books, book lovers, and their authors.


Chat Room

(FAQ)

Q: Tell me about this "vetting" process

A: At Indie Quill, we will quality-check books before they go live on the site (as pioneered by that comics-selling website that has an X in its name), to produce, in a sense, "curated content" such that you get a decent book no matter what you buy. 

But, rest assured that quality-checking is the name of the game, not censorship.  The books are evaluated based on industry standards: it's been professionally edited for readability and typos, the layout is consistent and works on various platforms, the cover is professional-looking.  Whether or not your story delivers well on its premises is up to the readers to decide! 

Q: What types of books will be sold on the website?

A: Indie Quill will be a platform in which you can sell all types of books: Physical books, ebooks, and audiobooks.  Sellers will be responsible for mailing copies (digital copies can be downloaded from the site), which allows us to take a smaller commission than other sites that warehouse the books for you.  At first, only digital book files (E and Audio) will be available, but as we reach stage two, physical books will be available to buy and sell too.  Your donations will help us get there faster!

Similarly, all genres of books are welcome!  Seriously, all of them: Got a book on cooking eggs? We'll take it.  Got a YA protagonist with egg-related magic powers?  We'll take that too.  Maybe a romance about a chicken farmer?  That's good too. 

Extra points for books that censors might like to ban some day.

Q: What languages will books be in?

The Indie Quill site will be in English at first, but you are welcome to sell books that are in any language--in fact, we encourage it!

Q: I work for a small press. I'm interested in getting our list on this site.

Great! We're looking for early adopters as well as beta testers to give us feedback as we develop the site.  Our goal, in fact, is to get every small press in the US on the site.  If you'd like any part of that, just send an email to founder@indiequill.com.

Q: I have a manuscript to edit that's a lot longer than the perks offer.

That's okay! Message us and we can work something out at the rate described in the perks.  IndieGogo limits the number of rewards visible at one time, so we tried to pick the sizes most likely to fit the greatest number of people.


Fandom

(Other Ways You Can Help)

Be loud and be proud--all of you are potential protagonists to this cause.  Even if you can't contribute financially, share a link or spread the word about this campaign to everyone you know that loves reading or has a self-published/small press book to share!  We can't accomplish change alone, and chances are, you know someone who could benefit from a better place to sell their self-published books.

If you'd like to be an initial user of the site, either as a reader or author, be sure to select one of the "perks" on the side of the screen that will put you on the mailing list. ($15 level or above)
story_txt:
SummaryIndie Quill is an online book marketplace specifically for small presses and self-publishers. Smartly tailored to the special needs of this group (as well as for readers who love discovering new worlds to inhabit), Indie Quill is poised to be the next step in the self-publishing world. Our aim is to increase the quality, diversity, and discoverability of independent books by creating a centralized home online to buy, sell, and discover works. Self publishers in particular have historically faced major hurdles to sustainable self-employment through writing because of lack of distribution, an unfair playing field online, and exploitation by unscrupulous providers.  We look to increase sales for authors by giving authors and readers better products, tools, and quality standards.  But we need your help getting off the ground!  
The Backstory

"Everyone has a story to tell, and it's my job to help you tell it better." That is the motto Founder and CEO Thalia Sutton uses while working as an editor, and it's a rare idea in the publishing world. Disenfranchised with the elitism found in the publishing industry and the writing schools that feed it, when Thalia graduated from Columbia University in 2012, she decided to put herself to work where she felt her skills were needed most: being a freelance editor for self publishers.Over the years, she found a great diversity of authors and stories, but a lack of resources for them.  Yet people's goals, and troubles, were often the same. She was shocked to hear, time and again, these main troubles from the authors she served: 




No one should ever feel like quitting something they love because the system is inefficient. Thalia waited for a website to address the needs of her clients, but over time, the issues actually got worse.  More companies hopped on the bandwagon to exploit uneducated author hopefuls, rather than giving them the resources they actually needed.  So Thalia came to the conclusion that, while the publishing industry works well for some, there are many good books and valuable stories that don't get seen, which is a shame.  There were thousands of books that should have been thriving in the self-published market based on what people wanted to read.  But they weren't.  And why?  Because the people who cared didn't have the means, and the people with the means didn't care.  Because no one felt the art of the common man had value.So she decided: I'll make a marketplace specifically for you.

Plot Twist
(How We're Different)
1. Outlook

We're book people, innovating a home for each other--we want to help you achieve your goals of making a living off of your art and, as a reader, a better book to read.  We believe in good customer service and also that you're the one that knows your book, and your reading habits, best.  It's like being in your local bookstore, but with "local writers" from all across the country.

2. Tools & Platform

Indie Quill wants to be the best place out there for selling indie books, so we take the best of what's out there, put it together in one place, and innovate on top of it. Author shops help sellers' works be collected easily in one place, so if you like an author or company, you can browse their book series quickly and efficiently.  Shops also have locations attached, so buyers can support local while online.
Our search engine uses over 15 criteria, not just a few keywords, to bring up books, so books get seen more often.  Smart and fun filters help readers pick books by mood and taste and reading level, while a graphics-based layout (rather than text-based) lets you browse by covers, which is both entertaining and slows search-fatigue. A pop-out feature also assists in this, giving you the product at a glance.  Meanwhile, you can thumb through a few pages and learn more about the book and author on each product's detailed listing page.  While you're there, hand-crafted recommendations give you truly relevant subsequent reading material, keeping you from getting cliff notes and second editions as recs.
In later stages of development, we want to integrate Goodreads and innovate sharing and discussion of books as well so that each book gets all the love and support it deserves. For authors, we look to provide high-quality reader circles of other authors for feedback support.
3. Empowerment & Diversity

Indie Quill also believes that reading is a means to empowerment, and as such, every group should be represented. Special interest groups and "rare" forms of literature that we want to make sure have a home (and a search criteria) include:




4. EthicsYour bookstore shouldn't be your publisher. Indie Quill will never publish books; we only offer you place to sell them.  This is because we care about doing one thing and doing it well. There are many sites today that offer a place to sell self-published books, but in every case they also publish them, which crosses a long-standing ethical boundary that any scrupulous publishing professional knows is there for a good reason.  Simply put, if you both sell and publish books, you are not focused on either one, and everyone loses out because of a glut of bad books.  It becomes a business model based on how many units you can process, not how many return customers you have.  On the other hand, if you do one or the other with proper standards, you can make plenty of money.  Anyone who does both is not looking out for their authors' best interest. 
  The Crisis Point

(What We Need)
 Baseline Goal:
$20,000 for initial website construction with its basic foundation of features.  Our website is being designed, tested, and implemented by the wonderful team at Fusionfarm, a division of The Gazette Company.  You can check out their portfolio at their website. 

$20,000 gets us:



The base website with all its necessary features, and a few special ones

Testing, for a smooth website experience without bugs!

Stretch Goals:


$25,000 - Cover unforeseen costs in web development, and pay an accountant to help us navigate sales tax in all fifty states and beyond.

$30,000 - Help us get to our first trade shows and have the equipment necessary to sign people up on-site!
$40,000 - Hire our first extra staff to quality-check books and perform speedy customer service, as well as cover operating costs for the first year!


  
Rising Action
(Impact)
 We're positioned to be the next step in the self-publishing revolution, the capstone of the drive for quality and community that's been building in the indie author industry for past decade.  But more than that, we want to change how the game is played: We want to level the playing field, and make treating authors well the name of the game...as well as treating readers like the intelligent consumers they are.
But more importantly, Indie Quill's greatest potential lies in diversity. Most good books go unpublished, or under marketed, because companies don't think they can make their money back on the project--not because there is anything wrong with the book.  This leaves minorities, women, foreign works, avant-garde works, and forms of literature with small markets (such as poetry) underrepresented or not represented at all.
Take, for example, the sci fi genre.  As popular as it is, there are only one or two authors of color in the genre that even die-hard fans can name, and just as few characters of color who lead the stories themselves.  If Indie Quill can get just two authors of color on our site selling books, we've double what's available to a kid in the Bronx who goes to his local bookstore (if he even has one).  
Too, along with bringing national, and international, reach to authors, we bring a wonderful variety of books and author resources to people who live in small towns that may not have independent bookstores.  A nifty perk of Indie Quill is that author "shops" can have locations attached, so event organizers can easily search for authors in their area to bring to libraries, schools, festivals, and other events.
Aside from diversity of authors and stories, Indie Quill is also positioned, with your help, to assist many authors achieve their dream of making a living off of their writing, in a way that hasn't been widely accessible before to self-publishers.  We hope this will help many small businesses, career writers, women writers, and minority writers achieve financial stability.
Our aim is that all of the above finally get the robust national reach and recognition they deserve for pushing boundaries with works larger publishing houses have passed by.


Rewards
(Rewards!)


We have a lot of really cool rewards for you, including editorial services and snazzy merchandise goodies, though you can donate any amount of money without a reward attached. However, our dear friends at Out of Print Clothing--a Brooklyn, NY-based startup that uses out-of-print classic book covers on clothing and accessories--generously offered many of their best-selling products to the Indie Quill cause.  Like IQ, Out of Print believes in furthering the cause of reading to those who would otherwise not have access, and donates a book to Books for Africa for every item they sell. We are very grateful to have their help, and you should check them out after you're done visiting us today.


New rewards will be added as others sell out.
There is a shipping fee for physical rewards, but it's generally $5 
or less if you're in North America.  Please check for the specific 
amount when picking a reward.

We will make every effort to ship rewards such that they arrive for the holidays. If
 you would prefer expedited shipping, please message us and we can 
discuss expedited shipping options and their associated cost.
In an effort to stay green, your materials may be shipped in 
recycled/reused packaging materials--but never fear, they shall still 
arrive safely!
If you have any questions about rewards, don't hesitate to send us a message. 


REWARDS FROM OUT OF PRINT CLOTHING CO.:

story:
Milaires is an independent neighbourhood bookshop.

When we opened our doors ten years ago we did so with the aim of creating more than just a bookshop, we wanted to create a place that would never cease to amaze.

We started off as a boutique bookshop specializing in books on art, architecture, photography, cooking, design and landscaping but before long we started to sell children's books with the idea of inspiring their imagination.

Some time ago we set a new challenge, we began developing reading workshops and children's crafts where we take the wonderful world of children's literature and use it to enhance and animate their creativity in a family atmosphere.

Today we want to go further and promote the great opportunity offered by the place where we are. We want to transform our terrace into a people's cultural place, where everyone can meet up and enjoy themselves. 

Come and be a part of our project and participate in the growth of this universe we are creating for the children. With everyone's help we want to refurbish and improve the space we have, with awnings, furniture, play areas, teaching materials, a bathroom, heating, roofing and flooring.

All of this will only be possible with the communities help and contributions, so please help us to bring this project to fruition.

We count on you! Thank you! 


Milaires es una librería de barrio, independiente.

Hace 10 años abrimos la librería con una idea clara, que nunca dejara de sorprender.

Partimos como una librería especializada en libros de arte, arquitectura, fotografía, cocina, diseño y paisajismo; y al poco andar incluimos a los niños y sus sueños. Hace un tiempo nos propusimos un nuevo desafío. Estamos desarrollando talleres de lectura y manualidades infantiles. Aprovechamos el maravilloso mundo de la literatura infantil para que los niños potencien su creatividad en un ambiente familiar.Hoy queremos ir más allá y potenciar el gran espacio que nos brinda el lugar donde estamos. Queremos transformar nuestra terraza en la terraza de todos, en un lugar de encuentro y cultura donde todos podamos disfrutar.


Con la ayuda de todos vamos a habilitar un baño,  remodelar y mejorar el espacio, con toldos, muebles, espacios de juego, material didáctico, calefacción, techumbre y pisos.

 

Esto sólo se hará posible gracias a ti y a tu contribución. 

Se parte de nuestro proyecto y participa del crecimiento de este universo infantil. 

Con tu aporte pasas a ser miembro de esta gran familia y recibirás tu tarjeta de membresía con la que accederás a descuentos y muchos otros beneficios, pero lo mas importante: contibuyes a educar y entregar cultura a nuestros niños.

Contamos con todos ustedes!!!

story:
I recently scanned through the top 100 paid and free books on amazon, only to notice how severely popular the erotica genre is with everyday readers. I could not find one wholesome, family oriented, Christian book in this list, and strongly believe this is a very sad reality.

     Have you ever wanted to see a change, only to wait for someone else to come and effect the change you want to see? What if you got an opportunity to be the change you want to see?

     You see, I am a story teller. One of my novels on amazon “Chloe” has won gold in competitions, and presently have over 12 5-star reviews. I am thinking that if I did it once, I must be able to do it again. So I have another book “Beyond Time – Journey Through Hell” with my publisher that is coming out this year.

      I have been writing plays and movie scripts for over a decade now. I started writing plays in 2002, and have never looked back. Surprisingly, I have over 100 full length plays on my website (www.christianplaywright.org)

      The Lord told me to write a novelette from each play, and publish it. I felt this strongly, and also knew it would be impossible, but it is just like Him to suggest such a thing (God of the impossible).

      This is where you come in (I hope). Without a community like this, I know in my heart that what I desire would not even be possible.

   I want to share one recent review with you. "Artistic genius on display in this brilliant one of a kind presentation of the Gospel. It's a play. It's a book. It's a realistic melodrama depicting the sobering truth of life after death. The colorful characters are our family members, friends, and every living, breathing human being. Ministry leader, if you want to jump start evangelism in your church, you need this book. Using it could ignite your church to revival, and be hazardous to the kingdom of darkness. The harvest is ready, and Waiting Room is a modern day evangelistic match. Start the Fire!!!"

     This is a review for my play/screenplay ‘The Waiting Room.’ I thought this was a fictional place, and someone told me recently that it was real. The Waiting Room will be the first novelette I publish.

The Cost

     I need to solicit the help of a few ghostwriters. For each project, I am looking at $300 at least.

     I have resources for editing, proofreading, book cover creation and formatting, so my next major step will be to pass the manuscript on to my Publisher. I work as a Ghostwriter and Editor for Chalfant Eckert Publishing, so I get a discounted price for each book I publish. I am looking at another $250 per book to publish.

      As you can see, this is a very costly venture but one I am determined to do. You can help make my journey lighter by contributing to this vision. If you can’t help financially, please help to spread the word by sharing this with…well…everyone.

 

God bless you,

Cleveland O. McLeish

The Waiting Room will be the first novelette I publish.The Cost     I need to solicit the help of a few ghostwriters. For each project, I am looking at $300 at least.     I have resources for editing, proofreading, book cover creation and formatting, so my next major step will be to pass the manuscript on to my Publisher. I work as a Ghostwriter and Editor for Chalfant Eckert Publishing, so I get a discounted price for each book I publish. I am looking at another $250 per book to publish.      As you can see, this is a very costly venture but one I am determined to do. You can help make my journey lighter by contributing to this vision. If you can’t help financially, please help to spread the word by sharing this with…well…everyone. God bless you,Cleveland O. McLeish

story:
The Basics.

 

My first two novels, Draconis' Bane and Deadly Intentions, did so well that I decided to continue creating stories in their world.

 

 

 

Rebel Queen is a standalone story though, a beginning to a whole new set of adventures surrounding the child of Tristan and Mina, the hero and heroine of the prequels.

 

 

 

Cassandra has a problem, and it's only the first of many. Being raised as the youngest child in a family of great heroes would be a challenge for anyone. 

Her great-grandfather is the mighty King of Dragons, Draconis. Her father fought off hordes of monstrous creatures at the Battle of Heatherington Keep and sacrificed everything putting an end to a viscous cult of anti-dragon zealots. Even her mother rose to greatness as one of the rulers of Dragon Keep and a beacon for peace across Amesdia bringing Dragons, Humans, Elves and Dwarves together in an alliance that stood many trials over the last century.

Until a few days ago, Cassandra was content with her role as a child of greatness. She was studious, spent most of her waking hours with her mother and other heads of state and at her fathers insistence, learned how to duel. As her siblings had before her, Cassandra knew she would likely be matched with a partner for political reasons and had long since accepted her role in the world.

That was, of course, before her mother died, and before her...transformation. Overnight, her soft pale skin sprouted gorgeous golden dragon scales. 

Presented with a future she no longer recognizes, as the first of her kind, she must overcome a whole new set of challenges if she hopes to survive the unknown threat that comes from across the Careless Sea.

 

The Sakwa dragonkin are a dying race, fueled by a tribal system that failed them centuries ago but yet unable to adapt to a new way of life. In a desperate bid to keep the people focused on outside conflict, Jenya of the Toho has declared war on Cassandra's country. An ocean may separate the two cultures, but the Sakwa see the Seven Kingdoms as their opportunity for a new start; a new start they will willingly kill and die for.

Can Cassandra, her father and their closest allies prevent the coming conflict or will they be washed away in the ambitions of a would-be Queen.

 

 

This campaign is more...

 

  • I don't need money for editor, I have one.
  • I don't need money for a cover. I have one of those too (and supported a local artist)
  • I don't need money for copious amounts of caffeine or beer...there is never a shortage of those fine liquids in our house.
 
What the hell is this campaign for then?
Well, I get to kill two birds with one stone. Fans who have already read my books get their hands on the latest one before anyone else (releases on Amazon/Kindle on Dec 1, 2015) and I get the chance to meet new readers.
 

What do I get?

 

The perks speak for themselves. I've gathered a list of cool bonus items along with my previous work, all signed for your collecting pleasures. Of course copies of the paperback and ebook are available, I'll also be producing some promotional items to be sent along with select perk packages.

Christmas is coming up quickly, so if you have a fantasy lover in your life then this is your chance for a unique gift and you also get that warm and fuzzy feeling knowing you've supported the arts.

 

 

    Risks & Challenges

     

    The book's done and ready to go. The demand I see from this campaign will only effect how severe a case of hand cramping I get from happily signing copies.

     

    If you're into fantasy, dragons, sword fights, and generally nerdy goodness, please support this campaign and share it with your friends, neighbors and that quiet kid whose always got their head in a book.

story:
Did you know?

The 23 species of macaques around the world have a very diverse history with man. Sometimes at the center of controversy, the history of macaques is not documented in one place to show the wide interaction in human lives over the years. A few examples show the true diversity:

  • Nuisance animals in some cities in their indigenous countries.
  • Life saving medical research.
  • Pets loved as much as any human family member.

Celebrating the macaque by documenting their place in society - from nuisance to space travel and more - will give a better understanding and appreciation of macaques throughout history.

What is needed

Funds will go toward any expenses incurred, including:

  • Gathering information and use of copyrighted photos.
  • Virtual assistant if needed.
  • Publishing costs for a hard copy book and later ebook.

What you get

Contributors of 25.00 or more will be given:

  • 25.00 - mention in Thank You list, back of book.
  • 50.00 - listed in honor of or in memory of your choice, plus above mention.
  • 100.00 - all the above plus a copy of the book when published.

If the goal is not reached, the project will be delayed significantly - but  finished, regardless. The amount of time and money involved has been estimated for completing within a certain time while still working  full time job.

Timeline For Completion

The launch of this project/campaign is on the 20th birthday of a female macaque, Haley, I have lived with daily, for two decades. The completion is set for the first week of May 2016 to coincide with the 20th birthday of the second macaque I have live with daily for almost two decades, Joshua.

The celebration of macaques through detailing their history and involvement with mankind will not disparage any involvement with macaques. A factual account might cause emotions ranging from anger to love or thankfulness -  all an important part of the history.

story:
Short Summary

"Nothing activates the brain so much as music" - Dr. Oliver Sacks, internationally acclaimed neurologist and author. This quote is at the heart of the book I'm writing, literally and figuratively.

My name is Andrew Schulman. I'm a professional musician, a classical guitarist, based in New York City since 1975: http://www.abacaproductions.com

This fundraising campaign is for a book I've been writing for the past year called: 

      Waking The Spirit: A Musician's Journey Healing Body, Mind, and Soul

My publisher is Picador, an imprint of Macmillan Publishers. It's due for release in 2016.  

http://us.macmillan.com/wakingthespirit/andrewschulman

All donations are tax-deductible. Steve Yeager, a Sundance Film Festival award winning film director and longtime friend has a Not-for-Profit (501c3) Arts and Education Fund called Bay State Ventures, Inc., and has kindly agreed to be the fiscal sponsor for this campaign.

Here are a few things directly related to the story:

 - The 3-minute video at the top of this page, called The Gift of Healing, won a NY Emmy in 2012 in the Human Interest category for WNBC-TV, and First Prize in the National Press Photographer Association's Best in PhotoJournalism series. 

 - There has been a lot of media coverage already on my story; I am especially proud to have been part of the superb BBC Radio 4 series called Soul Music. That program can be heard here: Bach's St Matthew Passion

  - This is a link to an article I wrote for the November issue of Allegro Magazine, the Musicians Union monthly. (The writing is geared to my fellow musicians but you can get a good overview of the book):

http://www.local802afm.org/2014/11/how-to-improve-your-playing

 - A 30-minute documentary film called "Andrew & Wendy", directed and produced by Academy Award nominated Josh Aronson, had its World Premiere at the Rhode Island International Film Festival last August and its New York Premiere at DOC NYC this past November. It has just been accepted for broadcast on Thirteen/WNET,  the PBS-TV outlet in New York, for the Fall of 2015. (We are offering autographed copies of the DVD as one of the Perks.)

http://aronsonfilms.com/aw-info.html 

                                                                              *
The book's title reflects the fact that my wife Wendy saved my life in the middle of a six-day coma in July 2009 by playing my favorite music for me via my iPod - Bach's St. Matthew Passion. The music did what modern medicine at its best couldn't - it pulled me back from the precipice by giving me the will to live. (Dr. Marvin McMillen, the Surgical ICU Director, and my surgeon, Dr. Martin Karpeh, Jr., talk about this in the Aronson film and in greater detail in the book.) 

After my recovery I returned as a volunteer in January 2010 to the same Surgical Intensive Care Unit (SICU) where I had been a patient, playing my guitar three days a week to help other critically ill people. Within a year I became the first Resident Visiting Artist of the world-renowned Louis Armstrong Center for Music and Medicine based at Beth Israel Medical Center (now called Mount Sinai Beth Israel). I have just started my 6th year as a resident musician in the SICU.

Now, here is why I'm doing a crowdfunding campaign:

A year ago I received the first installment of a book advance from my publisher. As it turned out, I needed an extension of the manuscript deadline from September 2014 to May 2015. The money from that first installment, to pay our living expenses, has been spent and the next installment won't come until late May or June.

I needed the extension because my publisher had the keen insight that the book needed to be more than just a personal memoir - that the science of music and medicine had to underscore the book's anecdotal stories about what I have experienced and learned over these years as a patient and then as a musician - stories ranging from joyous to heartbreaking. I needed to include leading experts from the fields of music therapy, medicine, neuroscience, and other related areas.

(See the Addendum at the bottom of this page for a list of the experts who will appear in the book.) 

It took a LOT of time and effort to follow up on this as one thing led to another, all very interesting and valuable but also very very time consuming! 

Furthermore, I had brought in my own editor, paid for from my advance. However, her commitment to the book was based on the original deadline and she was unable to continue beyond that because of other book committments.

Fortunately, Wendy had extensive editing experience before she became a singer-guitarist and was an English major at Princeton to boot. Having recently completed producing a documentary film http://www.agiftoffire.com with the aforementioned director Steve Yeager, she was able to step in as my book editor and keep the project going. Wendy also began to coordinate all the science research. (Yes, we are husband and wife and work well together. Another miracle.) 

We have just had a lucky break; last week author/editor Lindsey Tate took over as the new editor of the book. Lindsey recently co-authored this wonderful book -  Shouting in the Dark: My Journey Back to the Light and she felt a connection between John Bramblitt's story and mine. We are very fortunate to have her on board.

A big part of what has subsidized the writing of this book this past year has been a three-night a week solo guitar gig I had for the last two years on New York's Upper West Side. That ended in November when they lost their lease. Because of that and the total committment required by both of us during this final stretch, this crowdfunding campaign will enable us to pay our living expenses until the manuscript is completed and submitted on May 1st. The second installment of the book advance will arrive some time in late May or June. 

(I continue to play as a volunteer twice a week in the SICU, cutting back a day because of the book, and will return to three times a week when the manuscript is completed.)

Everyone involved with this book is very excited about its potential to reach a large audience and contribute significantly to the rapidly growing field of Music and Medicine, which is growing by leaps and bounds throughout the world every year, by providing concrete evidence of something that most of us know intuitively and from personal experience - that music can reach into the soul and bring hope and healing during the most trying times of our lives, even in the setting of an intensive care unit. 

We thank you in advance and GREATLY appreciate your contribution, and also for sharing this Indiegogo campaign with anyone you think may be interested - through word of mouth, email, or social media.

Warm regards,

Andrew and Wendy

Addendum:

I am honored to include these experts in Music and Medicine in the book. I believe the reader will be fascinated by the brilliant insights from these extraordinarily gifted and accomplished people. 

  • Dr. Marvin McMillen - Director of the Surgical Intensive Care Unit at the time of my crisis, and now the Director of Perioperative Care - Department of Surgery, Berkshire Medical Center, Pittsfield, Massachusetts. 
  • Dr. Martin Karpeh, Jr. - my surgeon, now the Surgeon-in-Chief at the Hackensack University Medical Center. He is a traditionally trained doctor who recognizes the great value of therapeutic music.
  • Dr. Kamran Fallahpour - Clinical Psychologist and Neuroscientist, Founder and Director of the Brain Resource Center in New York City.
  • Dr. Joanne Loewy - Director of the Louis Armstrong Center for Music and Medicine and Co-Editor in Chief of Music and Medicine, the leading international, peer reviewed, music therapy journal.
  • Dr. Ralph Spingte - President of theInternational Society for Music in Medicine and Co-Editor in Chief of Music and Medicine.
  • Dr. Connie Tomaino - Co-Founder with Dr. Oliver Sacks and Executive Director of the Institute for Music and Neurologic Function.
  • Dr. Bryan Hunter - Music Therapist and Official Historian of the American Music Therapy Association.
  • Dr. Stephan Quentzel - Medical Director of the Louis Armstrong Center for Music and Medicine.
  • Dr. Steven Ellman - Psychoanalyst and leading author/expert on dreams (my coma dreams were a key to understanding why I came back to the SICU).
  • Dr. Gabriel Sara - Medical Director of The Mount Sinai Roosevelt Chemotherapy Infusion Site, and Co-Editor of "Music and Medicine: Integrative Models in the Treatment of Pain".
  • Dr. Jason Bratcher - Gastroenterologist, Mount Sinai Beth Israel. (I'll be a pancreas patient the rest of my life - Jason is my lifeline, and was a musician before becoming a doctor.)
  • Benjamin Verdery - Chairman - Guitar Department - Yale School of Music.
  • Marcia Feldman, Guitarist - Palliative Care Coordinator, Carleton-Willard Village  
  • Fan-Chia Tao - Director of Research & Development at D'Addario & Company.
  • Judy Simpson - Director of Government Relations, American Music Therapy Association.
