story:
I'm writing a book! A graphic novel to be precise. It’s about my last 4 years of trying to conceive a kid as a single woman. It’s been a journey rife in ups and downs, victories and tragedies, crazy-making moments, lonely wastelands, intense joys, and soul-challenging experiences. 

Throughout it, I have found that there are very few books that delve into the wide range of ways that elusive pregnancies and fetal loss happen and affect the people touched by them. The books that do exist, aren't necessarily easily accessible, often don't cover a wide range of experiences, and are usually strictly targeted towards the women (and their partners) struggling to start or grow a family, creating a kind of secret society to which the rest of the world is not privy and therefore has difficulty understanding and supporting in a safe, considerate way.

I want to help break the silence and taboos surrounding the (non)discussion of a journey that can be extremely difficult. I want to create a resource that people can use to feel less lonely in their struggle, and perhaps laugh through their tears.  The book is an honest, compassionate, funny and devastating look into my journey. I want to write it for the other women who have gone, are going, or will go through similar journeys. I want to write it for their families and friends, acquaintances and neighbors, health-care providers and support networks so that they can get a glimpse into what their loved one might be going through, and what these women might or might not need from the people around them. 

Because every story is different, and every woman's needs are different, I can only write it from what I have lived. I can only hope that there are enough common threads between my and others' stories that it will actually be helpful.  

Your contribution to the creation of this book will mean that these women will no longer feel quite so alone as they walk through their lives trying to create life.

What We Need & What You Get

This book is no small feat! The goal is to have a 200(ish)-page book finished by the end of March 2019 and then launched by September 2019. As of right now (April 2018), the first draft of the script and storyboards is about half way done. I’m anticipating having the first draft finished by June. My illustrator, Christache Ross, has already started on some character development:

This is where the need for your support comes in. In order to get the script and stick figure drawings translated into beautiful panels, I am working with the talented illustrator, Christache Ross, to get the book properly drawn, inked, and colored. I am also working with Page 2 Strategies to get the book edited, ready for publication, and, finally, out into the world (including hopefully your bookshelves and/or e-readers :) ).

This all costs some money - to the tune of $30,000.

Here's a taste of the kind of thing your donation will allow us to do:

I provide the script and VERY rough storyboards:

And Christache transforms them into the final product:

Magic!

(But a LOT of work)

That's three pages. We have another 200 or so pages to go! Help us make it happen!

(If you want to read the captions better, a higher res image of the three pager is on the photos page of this site - check 'em out!)

There are some great perks to tempt your tummies including making an appearance in the book (omg you'll be famous!), copies of the book, original storyboard pages, T-shirts or tank tops with some of the book’s fun characters (like Biological Clock, Acceptance Sloth {did you say sloth!}, and Bitterness Thundercloud) and other fun quirky prizes.

Risks & Challenges

This is a scary book to write. I fully realize that I'm leaving myself vulnerable to a bunch of things. I'm scared of being judged for some of my decisions. I'm scared of the sadnesses that will come up as I write this book. I'm scared of the intensity of feelings that will wash over me as I go over the joys and losses that I've experienced. I'm scared that it will all be too much and I'll have to stop.

But then I think of the potential impact such a book might have on other people. I think of the glimmers of hope, the fading of loneliness, and the relief from devastating secrets that might be an outcome of this graphic novel.

I've never really been known for giving up on big projects. One might say I'm a stubborn mule when it comes to birthing an extravagant project. And really... after everything I've already gone through trying to have a baby, this can't possibly come close to that level of challenge. So here's to a life richly lived and graciously shared! May it help you or someone you know in the same way that it has helped me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to give financially, here are some other wonderful and super helpful ways to help out:

  • Spread the word about the project and fundraiser directly to your friends, family, acquaintances, colleagues, and any fertility or pregnancy-related connections you may have.
  • Share the campaign and your vote of confidence over all the social media platforms: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, your blogs, your vlogs, and your dialogues. 
  • Write and publish an article in a magazine, newspaper, or on-line outlet about the book. Give a podcast, radio, or tv interview about the project. 

In whatever way you choose to and are able to contribute to the creation and dissemination of this book, I thank you in advance!

Follow Us Here:

www.cataloguebabynovel.com
www.facebook.com/cataloguebabynovel
www.twitter.com/cataloguebaby
Instagram: @catalogue_baby

Want to join the mailing list for updates on book launch and the very occasional (like once every few months update on the book's progress)? Email me here: myriam@cataloguebabynovel.com

The Team

Myriam Steinberg
Writer

Myriam Steinberg lives a life soaked in culture. She has spent years making art and organizing festivals. She is now entering the world of graphic novels. The craziness of her last several years of trying to conceive a child have inspired her to share her story with the world in the hopes that it will help others.

Christache Ross
Illustrator

Christache Ross is an illustrator and actor living and working in Vancouver. When he's not drawing and painting pictures he can often be found teaching kids drama classes and performing improv theatre. He's thrilled to be part of this wonderful project and excited to help Myriam get her incredible story realized as a graphic novel! You can follow his artwork on instagram @christachedraws where he'll be regularly posting Catalogue Baby updates.

Trena White
Co-Principal of Page Two / Project Head

Deeply committed to supporting Page Two’s clients and creative partners, co-founder and principal Trena White has a lifelong passion for helping bring people’s ideas to a wide audience. She was formerly publisher of Douglas & McIntyre and Greystone Books, running a publishing program of sixty new books each year.  Before that she worked as an editor at McClelland & Stewart, where she developed her commitment to excellence in publishing. Her authors have won or been nominated for most major national non-fiction book awards, and a number have been bestsellers. 

Peter Cocking 
Creative Director

Peter Cocking is Page Two’s Creative Director and an adjunct professor of typography at Emily Carr University. Considered one of Canada’s finest publication designers, he has received over fifty awards for his work, and has lectured on design and typography throughout Canada and in the U.S. Previously, he worked as Art Director at D&M Publishers, leading the company to more design awards than any other Canadian publisher.

Amanda Lewis
Editorial Director

Amanda Lewis has wide-ranging editorial and publishing experience, built over 8 years at Knopf Random Canada, a division of Penguin Random House Canada, where she edited such stellar non-fiction as Up Ghost River by Edmund Metatawabin (with Alexandra Shimo), finalist for the Governor General’s Literary Award for Non-Fiction. Amanda has edited memoirs and books on business, technology, the environment, and “big issues.”  She studied publishing and editing at Simon Fraser University and Ryerson University, and holds an MA in English from the University of British Columbia.

Rony Ganon 
Project Manager

Rony provides a wide range of project management support to Page Two clients. She recently completed the Publishing Diploma program at Langara College, where she gained practical experience in writing, editing, design, and the print and web publishing process. Rony also holds an Advanced Project Management Certificate from Langara College Continuing Studies, and a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and Philosophy from the University of British Columbia. In Rony’s native language, Hebrew, the term “to publish” literally translates to “to bring out into the light.” This is how Rony views the publishing process and where her lifelong passion for the industry stems from. Rony’s colleagues love her eye for detail, her penchant for organization, and her positive disposition.

A Taste of What I've Been Through

(Emotional trigger warning for those in the ttc world). 
I've been documenting everything that has happened in the last 4 years via video and photos. This little video is a compilation of real-life moments that give a glimpse of the rollercoaster ride that my life has been. Still hoping for a happy ending. Hopefully Sunday's transfer will be the beginning of that happy ending!

Some Backstory

I started this journey towards being a mother in 2014. That's when, after a break-up, I decided that I would have to become a "Single Mother by Choice." After countless tests to make sure having kids was still a biological option, it was off to the races.

Since 2014, with the help of donor sperm, I've gone through 7 IUI (clinical "turkey basting"), including one hilarious DIY try at home, 3 IVF, and am now on to my second donor egg cycle.

I've had failed procedures, miscarriages, and had to make some devastating decisions. 

I've become mother to 4 angel babies: Dahlia, Azariah, Leila, and Snoogy Wookums (he wasn't with me long enough to have a name appear).

I'm not sure where the well of hope comes from, but it sure is deep. Even when I think it's run entirely dry, I end up hearing water dripping somewhere and I go on. Throughout it, I've been extraordinarily lucky to be surrounded by an amazing community of friends and family. They have stuck with me through everything and have made going through all of this survivable. 

Although at times very difficult emotionally, writing this book is proving to be a healing process for me. As a result, I'm going into my next embryo transfer with excitement and real hope.

Follow Us Here:
www.cataloguebabynovel.comwww.facebook.com/cataloguebabynovelwww.twitter.com/cataloguebabyInstagram: @catalogue_baby
Want to join the mailing list for updates on book launch and the very occasional (like once every few months update on the book's progress)? Email me here: myriam@cataloguebabynovel.com
The Team

Myriam SteinbergWriter
Myriam Steinberg lives a life soaked in culture. She has spent years making art and organizing festivals. She is now entering the world of graphic novels. The craziness of her last several years of trying to conceive a child have inspired her to share her story with the world in the hopes that it will help others.

Christache RossIllustrator
Christache Ross is an illustrator and actor living and working in Vancouver. When he's not drawing and painting pictures he can often be found teaching kids drama classes and performing improv theatre. He's thrilled to be part of this wonderful project and excited to help Myriam get her incredible story realized as a graphic novel! You can follow his artwork on instagram @christachedraws where he'll be regularly posting Catalogue Baby updates.

Trena WhiteCo-Principal of Page Two / Project Head
Deeply committed to supporting Page Two’s clients and creative partners, co-founder and principal Trena White has a lifelong passion for helping bring people’s ideas to a wide audience. She was formerly publisher of Douglas & McIntyre and Greystone Books, running a publishing program of sixty new books each year.  Before that she worked as an editor at McClelland & Stewart, where she developed her commitment to excellence in publishing. Her authors have won or been nominated for most major national non-fiction book awards, and a number have been bestsellers. 

Peter Cocking Creative Director
Peter Cocking is Page Two’s Creative Director and an adjunct professor of typography at Emily Carr University. Considered one of Canada’s finest publication designers, he has received over fifty awards for his work, and has lectured on design and typography throughout Canada and in the U.S. Previously, he worked as Art Director at D&M Publishers, leading the company to more design awards than any other Canadian publisher.

Amanda LewisEditorial Director
Amanda Lewis has wide-ranging editorial and publishing experience, built over 8 years at Knopf Random Canada, a division of Penguin Random House Canada, where she edited such stellar non-fiction as Up Ghost River by Edmund Metatawabin (with Alexandra Shimo), finalist for the Governor General’s Literary Award for Non-Fiction. Amanda has edited memoirs and books on business, technology, the environment, and “big issues.”  She studied publishing and editing at Simon Fraser University and Ryerson University, and holds an MA in English from the University of British Columbia.

Rony Ganon Project Manager
Rony provides a wide range of project management support to Page Two clients. She recently completed the Publishing Diploma program at Langara College, where she gained practical experience in writing, editing, design, and the print and web publishing process. Rony also holds an Advanced Project Management Certificate from Langara College Continuing Studies, and a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and Philosophy from the University of British Columbia. In Rony’s native language, Hebrew, the term “to publish” literally translates to “to bring out into the light.” This is how Rony views the publishing process and where her lifelong passion for the industry stems from. Rony’s colleagues love her eye for detail, her penchant for organization, and her positive disposition.
A Taste of What I've Been Through 
(Emotional trigger warning for those in the ttc world). I've been documenting everything that has happened in the last 4 years via video and photos. This little video is a compilation of real-life moments that give a glimpse of the rollercoaster ride that my life has been. Still hoping for a happy ending. Hopefully Sunday's transfer will be the beginning of that happy ending!
Some BackstoryI started this journey towards being a mother in 2014. That's when, after a break-up, I decided that I would have to become a "Single Mother by Choice." After countless tests to make sure having kids was still a biological option, it was off to the races.Since 2014, with the help of donor sperm, I've gone through 7 IUI (clinical "turkey basting"), including one hilarious DIY try at home, 3 IVF, and am now on to my second donor egg cycle.I've had failed procedures, miscarriages, and had to make some devastating decisions. I've become mother to 4 angel babies: Dahlia, Azariah, Leila, and Snoogy Wookums (he wasn't with me long enough to have a name appear).I'm not sure where the well of hope comes from, but it sure is deep. Even when I think it's run entirely dry, I end up hearing water dripping somewhere and I go on. Throughout it, I've been extraordinarily lucky to be surrounded by an amazing community of friends and family. They have stuck with me through everything and have made going through all of this survivable. Although at times very difficult emotionally, writing this book is proving to be a healing process for me. As a result, I'm going into my next embryo transfer with excitement and real hope.

story:
"It's like if John Waters made Teen Beat." -Buddy Hangs, filmmaker and comedian 

FRIDAY Magazine is a smorgasbord of amazing art, titillating articles, fascinating interviews, and comics! Some of our recurring features include 'Hunk of the Month', quizzes, horoscopes, offbeat travel guides, and so much more! It's 100% female-run and 1000% far out.

Making a magazine takes a lot of time and a lot of money. FRIDAY Magazine is a one-woman operation at the moment and in order to bring FRIDAY Magazine issues 2, 3 and 4 to life and finish out the 2018 year with a bang, I need your help! Printing and distributing a magazine isn't cheap, that's why so many publications are exclusively online these days! But I think we all can agree that holding a magazine you've been dying to read in your hands is incomparable. 

Having a budget to produce the issues 2, 3, and 4 would mean that I'd be able to pay the talented writers, photographers, illustrators, and designers for their amazing work, which would in turn make FRIDAY Magazine even bigger and better! We'd like to keep the magazine as ad-free as possible so we can fill it to the brim with great content! That being said, we haven't brought on any advertisers yet and we'd only want to work with advertisers who share our core values. We need your help to bring FRIDAY Magazine issues 2, 3 and 4 to life! 

The money I raise here on Indiegogo will go towards:

  • Print full-color copies of issue 2, 3 and 4
  • Distribution and mailing
  • Paying contributing writers
  • Paying contributing artists
  • Paying contributing photographers
  • Research & development

We've got lots of fun rewards that you can pick from! I worked hard to make rewards that I would want to receive, so I hope you will like them too! There are options for whatever level you are able to back us at! Anything you can offer to back this project is greatly appreciated! 

Historically, the majority of "fun" and "weird" magazines in the world have been run by men. Who made these rules? FRIDAY Magazine is the female-run MAD Magazine of tomorrow! The lady-powered Juxtapoz of today! Many female-run magazines today are doing amazing things to empower women and share underrepresented perspectives, but there's still a need for a female-run magazine that isn't afraid to get weird and let its freak flag fly! 

Even though you'll hear rumors of print being dead on the streets today, it's actually a wonderful time to start a print magazine! The DIY zine-makers of yesterday have stepped up their game and are producing exciting and groundbreaking publications.

Even with all this progress, I have found that there's still a need for a female-run magazine that taps into the lowbrow, raw art and weirdo scene with an unbridled curiosity in the oddities of modern and past life. As I preparing to put issue 1 together, I was doing a lot of research about what goes into making a magazine and was saddened to discover that the majority of the magazines I enjoyed growing up and currently are run by men and often times have misogynistic undertones that put women down. I decided that I would change things. I couldn't find a magazine that had everything that I wanted in it, so I decided to go out and make it myself. 

Issue 1 of FRIDAY Magazine was a huge success! It was a pure passion project made out of love for the indie and DIY scene and a frustration over not seeing enough of the things I liked to see in today's magazine culture. While issue 1 of FRIDAY was great, issue 2, 3 and 4 (which will finish out year 1 of the magazine) are going to be bigger and better! Issue 2 is all ready to be printed and chock full of fabulous weirdness! It's like I took everything I learned from making issue 1 and gave it a Mario magic mushroom. We have so many incredible people in these upcoming issues - I'm so excited to share them with you, but I need your help to make them a reality! 

"It's seriously the most fun I've ever had with a magazine, and I subscribe to Playboy." -Donna Seeker, life coach and LGBTQ activist

FRIDAY Magazine is a one-woman operation owned and operated by artist, filmmaker and all around show pony Friday Hangs. Follow Friday on Instagram @funwithfriday.

 

Risks & Challenges

After printing issue 1 of FRIDAY Magazine I realized that the printing process can be tricky if you're not prepared for surprises. Sometimes things don't turn out as expected when they are translated from digital to tangible format. As with any printing endeavor, things can potentially go wrong during the printing and mailing process. Printing deadlines could get pushed back if there are mix-ups with layouts and proofs. Mail could get delayed. I will do everything I can to have rewards delivered when I say they will be delivered, but the mail can sometimes do strange things, so this could be a challenge.

My hope is that this project will help fund issues 2, 3, and 4 of FRIDAY Magazine, which will finish out the 2018 year! Issue 1 was a learning process on the design, curation, printing and mailing front and now we're ready to take what we learned and make issues 2, 3 and 4 bigger and better!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to back this project, we understand! You can show your support by spreading the word on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter. Use the Indiegogo share tab for easy sharing!

story:
"This is the book I wish I'd written."

- Hemingway * 

Pablo Picasso was in his sixties, sitting at a cafe, scribbling on a napkin. He sipped his coffee and sketched with his pencil for a few minutes. Then, he got up to leave. 

"Excuse me, Mr. Picasso," a woman at the next table recognized him. 

"May I have that little napkin you were drawing on?" She asked. 

"Certainly," Picasso replied. "It will just cost you twenty thousand dollars."

"Twenty thousand!?" the woman responded, shocked. 

"But that little drawing just took you a few minutes," she exclaimed, exasperated. 

"No, madame," Picasso said. "It took me sixty years." 

And with that he shoved the napkin in his pocket and walked out.

Am I saying I'm Picasso?

Of course not. (My art makes more sense.)

The point of the story is to illustrate the tireless, thankless years of work that craftsmen of every stripe put in before a single person sees the finished product. We do this because we want it to be good. Perfect even.

***

This is a fundraiser and pre-order for my book, "How to Get Gone." It is a collection of stories from the two and a half years I spent living and working abroad and traveling the world. But it isn't your typical travel book. It's not about how cool I am or how much I've seen that you haven't.

It is a life story about what travel is -- really is -- and why we do it.  It's about friendships and lunatics and the confusion of coming home after a long time gone.

I'm not selling Girl Scout cookies. :)

Like Picasso with his paintings, I have spent tens of thousands of hours writing. In that sense, this book is the product of a craftsman.

The first travel article I ever published was called "How to Come Home" and was part of the inspiration for this book. A few days after it was published, I got an anonymous email: 

"In those four minutes that I read and re-read your article," it said, "life made sense."

My hope is that this book can do that in a small way for anyone who picks it up.

I love you all,

Ben

--

* Didn't actually say that.

story:
THE TRUMPEE CUSHION

It is a little known fact, that in great Brittian, to trump, is to fart. I gained this knowledge a few month ago talking to a good friend in London, and I got to thinking what a wonderful coincidence, that we happen to have this presidential candidate who’s name means to fart.

Now I’m really not a fan of politicians to begin with, but the Donald will bring disgrace to this country like we could never imagine. Obviously I’m not alone in not liking this guy. How do we express our disapproval in an appropriate way?

I say a protest, a protest called The Fart Heard Round the World. Which brings me to  introduce the Trumpee Cushion

Here’s the plan:  If the Donald is chosen by his party as the Nominee, I am planning a massive stunt, involving a large amount of people, 5000, 10,000, 50,000, more? 

Each armed with Trumpee Cushion and a metal folding chair.

The Crowd will be choregraphed to inflate their Trumpee Cushion, place on metal folding chair, and be seated all in unison.

Here’s how it would work: A date and location will be chosen based on the date of GOP nomination. This event will need to have all the production values, coordination, staff and security of any large public event. An appropriate venue will be chosen for it to be staged. Expenses will include rental of space, chair rental, and set up and break down of the entire event. A film crew with multiple go-pro and professional sound recording will capture the entire event. There will be security and a staff of to help make the coordination and the actual event run smoothly.

What follows is a viral video that the whole world reacts to.

Everyone who donates $5 and up (with the exceptions of countries outside of the USA, except Canada) to this Crowd stunt will receive a Trumpee Cushion and a personal invitation to the event.

Again, this event will need to have all the production values, coordination, staff and security of any large public event.

That’s why I need your contributions, to make this happen in the biggest way possible, be part of history, and make nightmare of Donald Trump as president of these United States history as well.

Thank you and please share this crowdfunding campaign and contribute.

story:
This summer comes out the digital children's book "Magnus Adventures "  a young Viking boy who dreams of  an exciting adventure.

Magnus the viking boy decides to take a trip after listening stories that his  grandfather told him.

During this journey Magnus meets Polo, a polar bear. Magnus and Polo went together on a adventures.

The book will be released in the form of an app and will be available in Google Play, our website (www.icepano.com), Amazon and iTunes.
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.magnus.icepano

The book is an interactive audio - textbook for children aged three to eight years. You can follow the text of the book while reading takes place. The stories are beautifully illustrated and interactive drawings. You can press on the image and get the corresponding sound played, for example, pressing on sheep you you will hear sound of a sheep, cows booing etc.

The idea for this great adventure come from me, Pétur Ásgeirsson, but my friend Wayne Michaels helped me with the text. The idea of a twofold origin. Otherwise, the idea sprang little Viking boy who wanted on a journey, when I was two weeks in the hospital with a newborn son who was very sick. However, I am dyslexic and avoided books as a child. Therefore I wanted to do a book that was at once both audio - textbook. Where everyone can enjoy the story.

We have an artist who makes illustrations for us, and he finished with 11 pictures of 25-30 for the story.

The story will be published in Icelandic, Spanish, English and the Scandinavian language.

We seek your financial support to help us to finish the project. You can view a preview of the book here: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.magnus.icepano

------------------------------------------

En el verano llega el libro digital para niños  "Las aventuras de Magnus", que se centra en un pequeño vikingo que sueña con aventuras emocionantes y encuentros inesperados. La historia está destinada a niños y niñas de 3 a 8 años. El libro se puede escuchar simultáneamente con el texto. 

La historia va a salir en forma de secuencias de comandos (app) y tambien estará disponible para tu ordenador. El libro está bellamente ilustrado con dibujos, creados pensando en los mas pequeños. En cada página se puede hacer clic en las imágenes, por ejemplo, si hace clic en la oveja empieza a hablar y si se hace clic en la puerta,se escuchaun golpe.

Descarga una versión de demostración, en Google Play en espanol

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.icepano.magnuspoloesp

Video en islandes

https://youtu.be/ytX_r816QQs 

 Escribí la historia y mi amigo Wayne Michaels me ayudó a ponereltexto.

 La idea de la historia ,la tuve cuando mihijo recién nacido, críticamente enfermo y estuvo en el hospital durante las primeras semanas de su vida. 

Lo veo como un fuerte vikingo queriendo salir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños, como ir en un viaje y aventuras.

 Me diagnosticaron dislexia cuando tenía 11 años y habría sido de bastante ayuda un "libro virtual" donde podría haber presionado un botón para escuchar y al mismo tiempo seguir el texto.

 El libro será publicado, y será accesible en Google Play, iTunes, Amazon y en nuestra www.icepano.com.

 Buscamos ayuda para financiar este proyecto. Es posible comprar el libro por adelantado en 

Vamos a publicar el libro en islandés, Inglés, Español y el idioma Escandinavo



Multi languages

We think that it's important that that kids around the world enjoy  our children book.

  • English
  • Spanish
  • Icelandic
  • Norwegian
  • Danish

Es posible comprar el libro por adelantado en Vamos a publicar el libro en islandés, Inglés, Español y el idioma Escandinavo





Multi languages

  We think that it's important that that kids around the world enjoy  our children book.  English
Spanish

Icelandic
Norwegian

Danish

story:
******  Now available at http://www.smartphonemediaproduction.com.*******

 

My Name is Robb Wallace and I am an award winning media creator, with over ten years experience in video, photography and social media. Examples of my creative work can be seen here at http://www.robbwallacemedia.com/ . 

I help other businesses generate digital content for their products and services. Smartphone Media Production breaks down my knowledge and shows you how to do what I do.    

 

Help me bring the first Smartphone Media Production book to life! The book explores the many aspects of media production and distribution, exclusively from a smartphone perspective. Smartphone Media Production provides essential information for businesses, entrepreneurs, activists, organisers, authors, artists, musicians, YouTubers, Facebookers, Twitter lovers and anyone else that is looking to make an impact online but doesn't have the knowledge or expensive equipment to produce media. Smartphone Media Production takes what you already have (ie your phone) and shows you how to use it. Within the contents of the book you will discover how to master live video, video production, photography, audio recording, social media and more.

 

 

 

 

Until now, no book has been available on the topic, trust me I have searched high and low! No other book on the market covers in depth how to plan, capture, edit, distribute and track your SMP creations. With the publication of my book, this is about to change. Smartphone Media Production is written by me Robb Wallace, I am an award winning film maker, I have a degree in Broadcast Production where I graduated top of my class. I have worked on major TV and Hollywood production, I also my own media business. In this book I present a no nonsense look at how the mobile phone is changing the game. With my direction, information and know how you will soon be planning and creating engaging content, broadcasting it far and wide and all from your mobile phone.

 


Leave the competition behind, learn the ideas and concepts behind media production from a pro and see your smartphone as the pocket powerhouse it is. Check the gallery tab for examples of Smartphone produced media!!

With your help, I plan to publish enough copies to meet the large demand I anticipate.

The book includes information on :

  • Audio production 

  • Smartphone Photography capture and editing 

  • Smartphone Video capture and editing

  • Facebook Live Streaming

  • Best Apps for creating in both IOS and Android

  • Cheat Guides

  • Worked Examples

  • Next level Solutions

  • Social Media tips and tricks

 

Book Contents

Section 1

Introduction to media production, its history and technology as well as a look at what is now possible.

 

  • Introduction

  • A very brief history

  • Hardware

  • The possibilities

 

Section 2

An in depth look at the smartphone's creative tools. This section includes a breakdown of core concepts for production, including how to plan, capture, edit, distribute and track your creations. The main areas covered are audio, photography, video and live streaming. Each section has multiple worked examples, theory for that medium, a list of best apps, as well as equipment lists to take your productions to the next level.

 

  • Creating your brand

  • Structure

  • The treatment

  • Audio

  • Photography

  • Video

  • Live Streaming

 

Section 3

Looks at the phone's key features for communication and distribution, delving into the key Social media apps of Facebook, Twitter and YouTube.

  • Communications

  • key Phone features

  • Social

  • Facebook

  • Twitter

  • YouTube

  • Google

  • Conclusion

 

What I Need & What You Get

Print on demand is extremely expensive in short batches. The plan is to generate enough interest here on Indiegogo to print a larger batch to make the project cost viable.

Your contributions will go towards: 

  • Overall graphic design

  • Layout and type setting

  • Website

  • ISBN, copyright, & barcode

  • Copy and proof editors

  • Office supplies, software, secure data storage

  • Professional fees

  • Print and delivery of books and cheat guides

  • Distribution of book

  • Crowdfunding fees + credit card fees

 

For contributing to my campaign, you get perks:

  • Laminated Cheat guides for audio, photography, video and live streaming.

  • Signed copy of the book

  • Signed copy of the book plus laminated cheat guides.

  • Full page advert for your product or service - must be relevant.

  • Half page advert for your product or service - must be relevant.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

I do not have an advertising budget. I am relying on social media and word of mouth to make the campaign and project known. Please tell your friends to visit and share my  Indiegogo https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/smartphone-m...   www.smartphonemediaproduction.com website or join us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/smartphonemediaproduct... . 

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Use the power of your smartphone to create media for your business, project or group. Audio, Photography, Video, Live streaming – Smartphone Media production will show you how to plan, capture, edit, distribute and track you visions all from your phone.

 

Best apps, Cheat guides, Worked examples and more.

story:
Summary

Rex and Ted are the scurge of the ninth grade at Albuquerque High School in suburban New Mexico. Dirt poor, and after being mercilessly bullied by the football team, they've been ostracized by society. They could care less!

As evidenced in The Adventures of Rex and Ted and The Strange Taco Tuesday: The Social Media Edition, (Vol. 1 of the book series) they're too busy ripping it up with their dune buggies on Snapchat, and taking selfies.

The boys encounter bullies, fail miserably with their snapchat crushes, and encounter something very strange late at night in the New Mexico desert.

The Adventures of Rex and Ted and The Strange Taco Tuesday was the first entry into the new genre of Young Adult/Social Media. It is currently a hot new bestseller in Amazon's Kindle Kids Interactive department.

http://amzn.to/2ajBraU

What made this ebook so unique was that as you followed the characters through their daily mishaps, their selfie stick/Snapchat pictures showed up in the pages of the novel. This marked the first time that a Snapchat story appeared in an ebook.

The Adventures of Rex and Ted and The Things Ted Built: The Social Media Edition (Vol. 2)

What is it?

It is an illustrated collection of the improvised gadgets Ted built from spare parts over the years. For years Ted has been rummaging through Albuquerque Salvage & Recycling. He's re-built several of the dune buggies that he and Rex blast through the desert in. He has his own collection of iPhone controlled paint ball drones.

As the story progresses, you will find that Rex comes up with the ideas, and Ted builds them from scrap parts. He's sort of a mad scientist that way. 

Ted has tampered with, and had several close calls with homemade fireworks. He's also refurbished several hover boards with lawn mower parts.

http://bit.ly/2a3AHtA (Instagram Link)

http://bit.ly/2dVEmOv (twitter link to free copy of first novel)

http://bit.ly/2e6e629 (Facebook link)

One of the important themes of The Adventures of Rex and Ted is to appreciate and make the best of what you have. They can't afford the brand new iPhone 7's so Rex and Ted barter for broken second-generation iPhones and Ted fixes them.

The wacky gadgets that he and Rex come up with are a way to keep up with what the other kids at school have.

All of their gadgets and devices will be seen through the lenses of their Snapchat filters.

This book of the series will feature loads more illustrations than the one before it. With over 50 detailed illustrations, production can get very expensive.

The Adventures of Rex and Ted and The Things Ted Built: The Social Media Edition represents my continued effort to keep teens and young adults reading by incorporating their favorite social media filters into books. I'm excited about the opportunities that crowd funding grants me!

This book is due on Amazon's servers 12/01/2016.

The Backstory

Months before completing the One Year Screenwriting program at The New York Film Academy, I got an idea for my thesis project. It revolved around two ninth graders, one was African American, and the other was Hispanic.

All I knew at the time about the characters were that they were best friends, and they were somehow going to become superheroes. This was 2007, a few years before social media took over our every day lives.

I wrote a screenplay featuring Rex and Ted and sent it to the industry contacts I had made while in film school. The few meetings I was able to setup did not go as planned. No one wanted to read a screenplay about two pop culture obsessed teenagers who came across a crashed UFO and became superheroes. I had been living with the characters for three years, but with no takers for my script, I was forced to move on.

For the next five years The Adventures of Rex and Ted would sit on a shelf above my work shirts.

Oddly enough, the big shot talent agencies that rejected my manuscript were looking to hire me to help develop two new projects.

Things were going great until both projects got locked up in turn around 48 hours apart. After witnessing my personal anguish, a literary agent at the Gersh talent agency suggested that I hone my skills at novel writing.

I created Rex and Ted Enterprises to distribute my books, and quickly found Amazon's Kindle Direct Publishing.

The first book of the The Adventures of Rex and Ted ebook series was published live in Amazon's Kindle Store on August 1st!

http://amzn.to/2byhfXi

Why IndieGoGo?

Several reasons. One, above all, is IndieGoGo's focus on innovative projects developed for young people. Much like social media, IndieGoGo and crowdfunding have become ingrained into our every day lives. Young creatives, much like myself now have a platform for their projects to not only become funded, but discovered.

Also, I feel that IndieGoGo is a great way to kick off a campaign to reach teens and  young adults who scour their cell phones for new content almost hourly.

BARE BONES GOAL: $1500

Illustrations! Illustrations! Illustrations!

In an effort to show my audience how Rex and Ted live, I have to show the things they build and create to get by everyday. Naturally that means they've broken a few things. The illustration listing is below. The dollar amounts equal the price of the pictures. High quality illustrations are not cheap.

This will cover the least amount of illustrations so that I can create the book.

The custom hover boards that Ted accidentally melted =$500 in illustrations

The custom hover boards that he and Rex use = $500 in illustrations 

Ted's paintball drones that work = $500 in illustrations 

 

FIRST STRETCH GOAL: $5000

This amount will allow me to show, in detail, every gadget that Ted has built.

The dune buggies that they've made over the years = $900 in illustrations 

Ted's repairs that he's made to their trailer over the years = $1000 in illustrations

The dune buggies that the boys made fall apart = $100 in illustrations 

His drones that never stood a chance = $500 in illustrations 

Ted's improvised virtual reality headsets = $1000 in illustrations

 

SECOND STRETCH GOAL: $7500

This amount will allow me to create the Christmas special The Adventures of Rex and Ted and The Things They Get Each Other For Christmas: The Social Media Edition. This novel will chronicle the boys' efforts to get each other Christmas gifts on a shoestring budget.

THIRD STRETCH GOAL: $10,000

With $10,000 reached I will be able to create and edit together an ebook trailer featuring Rex and Ted to market on Instagram and Facebook!

Every contribution helps!

 Added Perks:

For the past ten years I've dedicated my life to learning and exploring the craft of creative writing. Whether it be falling asleep to Bill Moyers and Joseph Campbell's The Power of Myth, or memorizing Vogler's The Writer's Journey. During the course of this campaign, for my backers, I will answer all writing questions as a means of supporting you guys as well. 

Risks and Challenges

One of the main issues authors face is finishing a project on time. Cycling novels in and out of Kindle's select programs means that my projects are due every 90 days. Dealing with the writing of a novel is difficult enough, dealing with the production of novel with over 65 pictures in 8 weeks is even worse.

I have the experience working and producing content under tight time frames, and I also have a very close working relationship with my illustrator.

I am strongly confident that I can deliver the project on time, and deliver the rewards to my contributors on time as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! It's a new genre for crying out loud.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

 

  • I am Khaya Maseko. I have been a Writer, mostly in the field of Poetry. I have been an executive member of Nowadays Poetry Organization for 15 years.  My work has always been driven by the ethic: Get people to read more. It is in this vein that I wrote a book about home while travelling South Africa in 2011.
  • The campaign of Mashu oMusha is important because it is rare. South Africa is criminally short of Black Science Fiction works.  Our townships are not venues for heroes and dreams, Rather than dwell on the lacking, I decided to fill at least a part of this void with my novella. it is 120 page A5 book that I believe will make changes bigger than it's diminutive size.

I cannot express the magnitude of the importance of your contributions. As a creative thinker, I have many well-planned ways to pull off this project, but not the funds. Our government institutions have not paid attention, and so I seek the help of the global community to help fund this very important project. it is but a book, but with your help, it will be a global myth and legend.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Publishing is slightly expensive, especially for an independent publisher. Here is how much I explicitly need.
    • ZAR2000 for softcover promo prints of the book.
    • ZAR6000 Perfect bind as many books as possible. 
    • ZAR4000 for venue hire and admin
    • ZAR5000 for anomalous emergencies

    • If we raise more than this, any extra funds will go to the perfect binding of the book.

  • South Africa needs this. The excitement that I have received and positive reinforcement has been stupendous! It seems high time for a unique story told from the vantage of the Nguni people. This has been in very short supply even though the private demand is high. We seek to make this book a global hit, and with your help, that will surely happen.

The Impact

Books are a core part of any civilization. We can see how the story of the burning of Alexandria library can survive thousands of years. Well building myths to help a new age of youth find themselves is just as important. We need to fuel the minds of the impoverished to think beyond their station. To break confines and build their own frames of reference. When it comes to this end, SciFi is a great tool. It stimulates futurism and the ability to dream new solutions. I aim to publicize this book in this manner. To really emphasize the impace it can and will make if given the light of day.

Risks & Challenges

The risks of funding a literary project are not so high, but they are there. I am not so deluded as to think that i am a literary master, but i have faith in this work.

If we miss the mark with sales or crowdfunding capital, we will have to re-evaluate our marketing strategy. At this point, it is about touring the country raising awareness to the existence of this book. It is also about getting our name out there so that funding of this and future projects becomes more possible.  The only way his can fail is if I sit on my ass and not work hard to get this book out there. That WILL NOT happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word about the book and upcoming events, there are Indiegogo share tools you can use!
  •  Show up and bring lots of friends.
  • Download and share the short stories found on chaoticfront.blogspot.com. Here is a link to them. https://chaoticfront.blogspot.co.za/search/labe...

Thank you so much for patiently reading about my campaign. i hope it becomes "our campaign."

Books are a core part of any civilization. We can see how the story of the burning of Alexandria library can survive thousands of years. Well building myths to help a new age of youth find themselves is just as important. We need to fuel the minds of the impoverished to think beyond their station. To break confines and build their own frames of reference. When it comes to this end, SciFi is a great tool. It stimulates futurism and the ability to dream new solutions. I aim to publicize this book in this manner. To really emphasize the impace it can and will make if given the light of day.

Risks & Challenges
The risks of funding a literary project are not so high, but they are there. I am not so deluded as to think that i am a literary master, but i have faith in this work.
If we miss the mark with sales or crowdfunding capital, we will have to re-evaluate our marketing strategy. At this point, it is about touring the country raising awareness to the existence of this book. It is also about getting our name out there so that funding of this and future projects becomes more possible.  The only way his can fail is if I sit on my ass and not work hard to get this book out there. That WILL NOT happen.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you may not be able to financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please spread the word about the book and upcoming events, there are Indiegogo share tools you can use!
 Show up and bring lots of friends.
Download and share the short stories found on chaoticfront.blogspot.com. Here is a link to them. https://chaoticfront.blogspot.co.za/search/labe...


Thank you so much for patiently reading about my campaign. i hope it becomes "our campaign."

story:
Blast from the Past: Introducing Marjorie Magazine

Another magazine has hit the scene, covering the same Kardashian gossip or pushing the hottest Pantone colors of the season in which to decorate your home or dress up in. Except with us, we're not here for the new.


We're here for the old, we're here for the Marjorie Gals of the 20th century who indulge in pinup styles and still use Polaroids. Where girls can read and connect with writers and bloggers passionate about retro things. A young writer with a Creative Writing degree, I'm all too familiar with the good old motivational, "Write the book you want to read." This year, I started thinking about, well what about a magazine? The beauty of a magazine is to collect all the little things about a certain subject we love into one digest. Southern Living, Sunset, Entertainment Weekly, Men's Health, Vogue, The New Yorker-- successful publications catered to different demographics. Unfortunately, there are barely any publications for readers whose interests lean towards nostalgia. Facebook groups like Vintage Styling for Modern Girls and Instagrammers like Annelies van Overbeek and Lady Damfino show how powerful history can be, how the beauties of the past are kept alive as generations get younger and as time goes by. Let us give these sentimentalists a real place to channel these passions, let's give them our magazine.

 

What We'll Need

Website maintenance

The domain of the site is still at marjoriemag.wordpress.com although we already own the domain marjoriemag.com. As part of the basic package via our host it would cost $40/year until we can upgrade to $100/year for adding in the domain and installing necessary plug-ins and other features to build up our site.

Compensation for our writers

As we keep the backbones of Marjorie's running with the site, the real meat is in the content. We continuously reach out to writers, bloggers, and Instagrammers for their contributions in order to diversify the content on Marjorie. Topics covered so far are Jean Harlow's lasting impression as the first blonde bombshell, the big debate over whether Pepsi is better than Coca Cola, why Besame Cosmetics beauty brand is your must have line of makeup, and an upcoming review of the new Archie tv drama, Riverdale.

To keep this variety of content going, compensation to writers is our genuine show of gratitude for believing in us. We hope to pay writers at a base price of $15 per article based on rates from other publications such as Broke Ass Stuart. As for photographers and those wishing to contribute bigger projects, these rates will be higher and vary.

Establish a budget for collaborations, promotions, and advertisements

Getting the word out to potential readers takes more than hours on end reading through blogs and scrolling through Instagram accounts. Dismissing paid advertisement services offered through social media channels is a missed opportunity. We've ran a few ads out of our pocket at a total of $20: 4 Instagram ads for $5 each. In total, the impressions made in those six days of running ads were over 3,000 users on Instagram. By creating a set budget from our campaign for ads, we hope that in expanding our impressions we will reach the right audience sooner, and faster. The same goes for brand collaborations, boutique and bookstore consignments, and promotions as we would love to hold sweepstakes/giveaways to reward our readers!

and most importantly...

Pretty in Print! The First Issue Coming July 2017

 That's right! We're first and foremost a magazine, and our big goal for this campaign is producing just that. Should we publish a significant amount of articles, we hope to print them all in two issues a year, one for spring/summer and fall/winter. The magazine would be created via the self-publishing provider Blurb and sold on their site for the first year. Each magazine would cost $3.99 to create for 20 pages, and an additional  15 cents included per extra page. For our readers to own, each issue would cost between $7.00- $9.00 depending on the final page count of the issue, to make $3.01 profit that would go into our overall budget. We also plan to mass print at least a bulk of the first issue to be sold on consignment at local businesses like clothing boutiques or bookstores, as well as online retailers.

Meet the Founder: Paris Kim

A writer in San Francisco with a BA in Creative Writing, I've always been a fan of nostalgia and vintage fashion as my personal inspiration. Things of the past remind me of stories I read as a child like Anne of Green Gables and movies like Gone with the Wind. I was watching period dramas by 6th grade and finding that I had a huge crush on Jimmy Stewart. I currently work in social media downtown for an Ecommerce startup, finding that I'm entirely overwhelmed in talk and culture of tech and all things new-- the newest app, the latest trends, and predictions on predictions of where all this technology will take us.

That is why I created Marjorie-- to take a few steps back to appreciate the obsolete as breathtaking, and to connect with others fascinated with nostalgia. Telling stories of the past get us excited for the future-- for what's in store. Past and Future are the perfect foils in which the past is there to remind us always that great things await on the horizon. We may feel that we're born in the wrong decade, naturally, but coming together through one publication, readers might just feel like time's never moved at all. 

In the End

Even if we fall short of our goal, 100% of what is raised goes towards the magazine, as we will continue writing for the sake of our passion. We hope that as a bonus, our readers will genuinely love all we've given to them.

If you're not able to give, you can still help our vision succeed! Subscribe to our site, share articles, follow our Instagram, and tell your friends and fellow enthusiasts that there's now a site for them to indulge in their sentimental musings. Sharing this campaign will also be appreciated!

- Paris Kim

Founder of Marjorie

story:
Short Summary

Hello all! I’m Akim Prettyman and I live in Maryland with my 14 year old son and 1 year old daughter. I received my Master of Arts in Teaching degree in Early Childhood Education in 2014. I am also a graduate of the University of Maryland College Park. I've been teaching and caring for young children for as long as I can remember.

I spent endless hours reading as a child, and now share my love for books with both my children. One of my favorite things to do is to snuggle up with my little one and read a good book. I consistently look for books to read to her with diverse images of children especially those with beautiful dark brown skin like hers. Unfortunately, people of color are still very underrepresented in books for young children. What an awful message it sends to children when they consistently read books that don't reflect images that look like what they see in the mirror!

Every child is beautiful!! 

Every skin tone is beautiful!!

Every child is special!!

Recently, I began writing my first children's book, "Beautiful Me, Beautiful You". I decided that I wanted to write and extend my love of teaching young children from the classroom to printed texts. Now I am seeking to pursue writing on a full time basis and bring all of my manuscripts to life.

“A book is a gift you can open again and again.  ”

- Garrison Keillor 

 Rather than submit my texts to publishers and wait and wait for a response in the hopes that they would share my vision for my books and illustrations, I decided that self-publishing was the best way to proceed. I found the perfect illustrator to bring my words to life, and "Beautiful Me, Beautiful You" is now ready for publishing and distribution. I have also written numerous other books that I am currently seeking to illustrate market and distribute as well through self-publishing.


What We Need & What You Get

“When we give cheerfully and accept gratefully, everyone is blessed.”

-  Maya Angelou

What does your support do? Your contributions help to:

·  Complete the illustrations

·  Cover costs of printing for digital and paper editions

·  Cover legal and registration fees

·  Pay for marketing and distribution costs

All I need to do is reach my backing goal and my books will be ready to read to the special little one in your life in no time! So the more you pledge, the closer I come to meeting the goal.  


The Impact

"Beautiful Me, Beautiful You" is 100% complete and ready to be printed. "My Balloon", and "I Swallowed a Seed" are written and ready to be illustrated by the same wonderfully talented artist.

“Beautiful Me, Beautiful You encourages small children, specifically those age 8 and under, to love what they see when they look in the mirror, from the hair on their heads to the tips of their toes. Additionally, my books teach young children various concepts related to math, science, rhyme, and counting, while promoting and fostering language development, enhancing communication skills and building vocabulary. Likewise, my texts encourage children to use their imaginations, ask questions and think critically, while giving them an entertaining experience that will promote a love of reading and learning.

It is important that my illustrations contain diverse images of beautiful children of all skin tones.

Even in the year 2016, there are still so few books being published that are by or about people of color.

As I attempt to illustrate my next books, the goal remains the same, to illustrate my texts using diverse multicultural images. 

Multicultural books are a wonderful tool to help introduce even the youngest readers to the world around them, while building a child's self-image and self-worth. Consistent exposure to culturally diverse texts helps to teach young children to respect and appreciate their own culture as well as the cultural groups of others. It also teaches children that despite our many differences, all people share common experiences, feelings, beliefs, values and aspirations.

All children are beautiful and deserve to see themselves in the books they read!


Risks & Challenges

As a newcomer to the world of self-publishing, there will no doubt be some bumps along the road. Formatting and printing errors may occur. To ensure the highest quality of the illustrations and proper printing, it may be necessary to run test prints or even re-due illustrations. Other risks might include unlikely delays in shipping. However, I will keep you updated in the small chance that it should happen.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways you can help. Spreading the news about my campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues, especially those with young children in their lives, brings me one step closer to accomplishing my goal. So share it, Facebook it, email it, Tweet it, yell from the roof tops, and ...better the chances of getting these books out into the world and into your hands of our children.

If I don’t reach my goal I will still forge ahead, using the contributed funds to illustrate and publish one book at a time. Although it may take a little longer, my books will reach the library and store shelves.


“It always seems impossible until it gets done.”

-  Nelson Mandela

story:
Welcome to Intangiblendity!

I'm a poet and graphic designer who has been self-publishing on scrolls for a few years. It is a really fun way to experience poetry and I want to take my poetry publishing to the next level!

  • A mobile workstation for production and distribution.
  • Making DIY machines to speed up production.
  • Enough stock to submit to a distributor.
  • An efficient website for better access to products.

I'm starting primarily with my own poetry and that of a few close friends but plan to grow as I find more poets with inspiring messages. These scrolls are super cheap to make albeit time-consuming.  The packaging I have designed is also easy to make with a few more tools.

The Means of Production!

To get this long term goal off the ground I need:

  • $3500 for my friends old camper for use as a work station/office.
  • $500 will make an awesome DIY die cutter for the boxes
  • $500 will make my amazing invention THE SCROLL ROLLER come to life!
  • All the rest of the campaign covers the first run of 1000 scrolls 300 boxes and all the little odds and ends including LLC and publishing structure.

The FUTURE!

It won't be immediately after the campaign ends, but after I am funded the work gets amped up. Collecting poets and reaching publishing agreements, editing and formatting with them and then on to production.  All of my poetry will be available right away and will be offered as perks. I have several printing shops I'm working with and ready to mass produce. Once the mobile studio starts rolling:

  • Physical products will be ready for shelves and the online shop with monthly new features.
  • I'll be on a regular open mic tour to find incredible new poetry.
  • Potential for advertising on the boxes and website.
  • Poetry reaches new audiences and a new era!!

Why Crowdfunding?

You might ask "Toast, why should I help you? Buy your own stuff!"

To this I say, this mobile poetry thing is going to happen but I want it to happen soon, I'm not sure how long the awesome deal on the trailer will last or how long I will stay sane NOT DOING THIS!

  • Your contribution is also encouragement!
  • I'm aware poetry is not a hot commodity, but my design will make it one of the coolest gifts you can receive! Especially if it's a poem that speaks to your heart.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on whatever interwebs you use!
  • Check out intangiblendity.com for updates!

Thanks for reading all the way to here, you must be amazing.

story:
BITÁCORA TURISMO TIC Y TERRITORIO es una empresa joven formada por un equipo multidisciplinar muy implicado en su principal proyecto, GEApp. Comenzamos nuestra andadura en noviembre de 2015 y gracias a nuestro trabajo y esfuerzo, GEApp está ya presente en seis ciudades españolas. María y Javier son los responsables de esta iniciativa que pretende acercar al turista al monumento más impresionante del mundo: la Alhambra de Granada.

Visitar la Alhambra de Granada de forma independiente y con un contenido original y atractivo es la experiencia que estabas esperando. Por eso, desde GEApp queremos que esta ruta multimedia en la Alhambra se haga realidad y que pueda acercar a la gente a este monumento para que descubran sus secretos, leyendas, palacios perdidos y todos los rincones que esconde en su interior.

Gracias a la colaboración de todo el que quiera aportar su granito de arena, GEApp podrá sacar al mercado una nueva ruta multimedia del conjunto monumental de la Alhambra y el Generalife de Granada, con un contenido único que incluye información audioguiada, cómics, vídeos y fotografías.

Necesitamos 6.000€ que irán destinados a la creación del contenido de la ruta para la Alhambra, ya que el soporte en la app ya está operativo. El contenido consta de una serie de cómics con locuciones y música, así como varias reconstrucciones en 3D de palacios y lugares perdidos. Además, estará disponible en español, inglés y francés. Por todo ello, necesitamos contar con profesionales como dibujantes, traductores e incluso músicos que creen un contenido único e inigualable para que la ruta tenga la calidad que el usuario merece.

Lo mejor de todo son las recompensas que ofrecemos. Por un lado, nuestros colaboradores podrán disfrutar de la ruta multimedia de la Alhambra de forma gratuita, una vez esté disponible en el mercado. Además, ofrecemos microtours guiados por la ciudad de Granada, una nueva manera de conocer la ciudad. El concepto es sencillo: pequeños recorridos por un precio igualmente pequeño y acompañados por los mejores guías.

Si no logramos la meta total, los fondos que consigamos irán destinados a lanzar la ruta de la Alhambra con el contenido básico monumental que podamos incluir con el presupuesto alcanzado. Sería una pena no poder incluir todos los cómics y contenido multimedia que tenemos proyectado, así que esperemos poder conseguir crear todo el valor añadido posible a esta nueva ruta.

Nuestro proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo entero porque va a permitir visitar el monumento más bello por un módico precio, de forma independiente y con un contenido único. El usuario podrá vivir una experiencia inolvidable en uno de los entornos más impresionantes de la historia: la Alhambra de Granada. Además, el contenido será audioguiado y enseñará las claves para comprender este monumento y su relevancia patrimonial e histórica.

GEApp ya ofrece rutas en seis ciudades españolas entre las que se encuentran Granana, Madrid, Córdoba, Málaga, Sevilla y Palma de Mallorca. Está teniendo muy buena acogida por la gente y día a día sigue aumentando el volumen de usuarios.

La Alhambra es una ciudad única que puede estar más cerca de ti gracias a GEApp. Con nuestra app podrás recorrer las calles de la medina, visitar la Alcazaba y sus torres, el Generalife y sus jardines, los Palacios y los rincones más impresionantes y bellos de este lugar. Además, podrás trasladarte a épocas pasadas y descubrir cómo eran algunos de los palacios perdidos gracias a reconstrucciones en 3D.

Desde que comenzamos nuestra andadura con GEApp nos hemos enfrentado a numerosos retos y gracias a nuestra creatividad y constancia hemos conseguido que los problemas de financiación no nos frenen en nuestro empeño por crear rutas que permitan al turista descubrir una ciudad a su aire.

Nuestro principal plan es seguir trabajando día a día para salvar los obstáculos y seguir consiguiendo los medios que necesitamos para seguir funcionando. Por eso, seguimos trabajando con nuestra informática, Asun, para ampliar las funcionalidades de GEApp y poder satisfacer todas las necesidades de nuestros clientes.

Si no puedes colaborar con nosotros económicamente, sí puedes hacer que nuestro proyecto llegue a más gente y pueda ser más conocido. Síguenos en Facebook, Twitter e Instagram (@GEAppSpain) y comparte nuestros post y nuestras originales fotos para que la gente pueda descubrir todo lo que ofrecemos.

Además, Idiegogo pone a tu disposición una serie de herramientas gracias a las cuales puedes compartir nuestro proyecto y hacer que llegue a más gente y que pueda tener más colaboradores.

Si has llegado hasta aquí es que estás convencido de nuestro proyecto y solo te falta el último empujón. Colabora con nosotros y no te arrepentirás. ¡Gracias por tu aportación!
story_txt:
BITÁCORA TURISMO TIC Y TERRITORIO es una empresa joven formada por un
equipo multidisciplinar muy implicado en su principal proyecto, GEApp.
Comenzamos nuestra andadura en noviembre de 2015 y gracias a nuestro trabajo y
esfuerzo, GEApp está ya presente en seis ciudades españolas. María y Javier son
los responsables de esta iniciativa que pretende acercar al turista al
monumento más impresionante del mundo: la Alhambra de Granada.
Visitar la Alhambra de Granada de forma independiente y con un contenido
original y atractivo es la experiencia que estabas esperando. Por eso, desde
GEApp queremos que esta ruta multimedia en la Alhambra se haga realidad y que
pueda acercar a la gente a este monumento para que descubran sus secretos,
leyendas, palacios perdidos y todos los rincones que esconde en su interior.
Gracias a la colaboración de todo el que quiera aportar su granito de
arena, GEApp podrá sacar al mercado una nueva ruta multimedia del conjunto
monumental de la Alhambra y el Generalife de Granada, con un contenido único
que incluye información audioguiada, cómics, vídeos y fotografías.
Necesitamos 6.000€ que irán destinados a la creación del contenido de la
ruta para la Alhambra, ya que el soporte en la app ya está operativo. El
contenido consta de una serie de cómics con locuciones y música, así como varias
reconstrucciones en 3D de palacios y lugares perdidos. Además, estará
disponible en español, inglés y francés. Por todo ello, necesitamos contar con
profesionales como dibujantes, traductores e incluso músicos que creen un
contenido único e inigualable para que la ruta tenga la calidad que el usuario
merece.
Lo mejor de todo son las recompensas que ofrecemos. Por un lado, nuestros
colaboradores podrán disfrutar de la ruta multimedia de la Alhambra de forma
gratuita, una vez esté disponible en el mercado. Además, ofrecemos microtours
guiados por la ciudad de Granada, una nueva manera de conocer la ciudad. El
concepto es sencillo: pequeños recorridos por un precio igualmente pequeño y
acompañados por los mejores guías. 
Si no logramos la meta total, los fondos que consigamos irán destinados a
lanzar la ruta de la Alhambra con el contenido básico monumental que podamos
incluir con el presupuesto alcanzado. Sería una pena no poder incluir todos los
cómics y contenido multimedia que tenemos proyectado, así que esperemos poder
conseguir crear todo el valor añadido posible a esta nueva ruta.
Nuestro proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo entero
porque va a permitir visitar el monumento más bello por un módico precio, de
forma independiente y con un contenido único. El usuario podrá vivir una
experiencia inolvidable en uno de los entornos más impresionantes de la
historia: la Alhambra de Granada. Además, el contenido será audioguiado y
enseñará las claves para comprender este monumento y su relevancia patrimonial
e histórica.
GEApp ya ofrece rutas en seis ciudades españolas entre las que se
encuentran Granana, Madrid, Córdoba, Málaga, Sevilla y Palma de Mallorca. Está
teniendo muy buena acogida por la gente y día a día sigue aumentando el volumen
de usuarios.
La Alhambra es una ciudad única que puede estar más cerca de ti gracias a
GEApp. Con nuestra app podrás recorrer las calles de la medina, visitar la
Alcazaba y sus torres, el Generalife y sus jardines, los Palacios y los
rincones más impresionantes y bellos de este lugar. Además, podrás trasladarte
a épocas pasadas y descubrir cómo eran algunos de los palacios perdidos gracias
a reconstrucciones en 3D.
Desde que comenzamos nuestra andadura con GEApp nos hemos enfrentado a
numerosos retos y gracias a nuestra creatividad y constancia hemos conseguido
que los problemas de financiación no nos frenen en nuestro empeño por crear
rutas que permitan al turista descubrir una ciudad a su aire.
Nuestro principal plan es seguir trabajando día a día para salvar los
obstáculos y seguir consiguiendo los medios que necesitamos para seguir
funcionando. Por eso, seguimos trabajando con nuestra informática, Asun, para ampliar
las funcionalidades de GEApp y poder satisfacer todas las necesidades de
nuestros clientes.
Si no puedes colaborar con nosotros económicamente, sí puedes hacer que
nuestro proyecto llegue a más gente y pueda ser más conocido. Síguenos en
Facebook, Twitter e Instagram (@GEAppSpain) y comparte nuestros post y nuestras
originales fotos para que la gente pueda descubrir todo lo que ofrecemos.
Además, Idiegogo pone a tu disposición una serie de herramientas gracias a
las cuales puedes compartir nuestro proyecto y hacer que llegue a más gente y
que pueda tener más colaboradores.
Si has llegado hasta aquí es que estás convencido de nuestro proyecto y
solo te falta el último empujón. Colabora con nosotros y no te arrepentirás. ¡Gracias
por tu aportación!

story:
A Brief Overview

Hello my name is Ashley Pinkerton and I am a writer and poet that has been given the opportunity to publish my first book, Spiraling Forward. The book will feature my personal collection of poems, all of which have been inspired by, and reflect, my own Spiritual journey and awakening. 

Through my deep connection to Mother Earth and Spirit, I have observed the cycles of Life and of Nature, and this humble witnessing has inspired within me the words that comprise this book. 

Spiraling Forward will take the reader on a journey through the cycles of Life, as the dance of the sacred Spiral carries the reader to places of deep reflection, realization and discovery. Inspiration and insight have flowed through me as I have written these words and it is my hope that upon reading them, the reader will be compelled to live with courage and strength, having the ability to face the darkness and rise above into the Light.

In addition to being a writer and poet, I also practice Energy Medicine and am a Practitioner who specializes in Reiki-Usui System of Natural Healing, as well as additional techniques I am currently going to school for. This work has been of additional inspiration to me, as I assist others in finding their connection to their own personal power and innate ability to heal themselves and bring relief to the conditions that are present in their lives. I am humbled and filled with gratitude to be able to hold space for this connecting to be made possible.

Your Contribution Will Go Towards

What is needed to get things started:

  • Minimum financing is $2,500 and includes full manuscript development, book design, printing, initial marketing and 100 copies to the author. This amount will be paid to the publisher, Poetic Matrix Press. 
  • Any additional money raised will be used toward the purchase of additional copies of the book.

The Perks

Perks and incentives will be given to all who choose to donate:

  • For donations under $25, the donor will receive a most sincere thank you from myself and through my Facebook page, as well as a PDF version of the book, which will be sent via email.
  • Donations of $25-$50 will receive a most sincere thank you from myself and through my Facebook page, as well as a personally addressed and signed copy of the book upon publishing.  
  • Amounts of $50 and more will receive a most sincere thank you from myself and through my Facebook page, as well as two personally addressed, signed copies of the book upon publishing. In addition, I will be donating a distance Reiki Healing treatment to these contributors, which will be given at a time that works best for all parties. 

This Is Just The Beginning

As a writer that has always had a deep passion for poetry, I feel that this is just the beginning for me. I can foresee many more books that will come in the future and appreciate very greatly that you have taken the time to explore the campaign and assist me with the realization of my dreams. Ever since I was a little girl I wanted to become a published author. I remember reading works by poets such as Robert Frost and so many others. I recognize how much their words helped me to navigate my own path and I am honored to now realize that my own words will be able to assist another in the same way. 

I have always has a tenacious drive to accomplish that which I set forth to accomplish and I know that these characteristics will assist me in the realization of this endeavor. The passion of my Heart and Soul will continue to lead me to places of new discovery and it is my hope that you will come along this continuing journey with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find that you are unable to contribute:

  • Please share this campaign with your own personal circle of friends, family and associates, as there may be others that will feel the call to donate.
  • Follow me on Facebook, Ashley Gene Pinkerton- Writer/Poet

May your life be blessed in the Light and Love of the Infinite and may the dance of the sacred Spiral always lead you on the path to your Highest Becoming!

story:
About Scablands Books

  • Scablands Books produces intrepid literature written by Inland Northwest writers.
  • We're based in Spokane, Washington.
  • We're an offshoot of the new literary organization Scablands Lit, a branch of INK Art Space, which hosts a variety of literary events in the Inland Northwest.

What We Need

  • Scablands Books wants to pay Ellen and Tim $1,000-$2,000 a piece for their manuscripts, the standard advance given when a poetry collection wins a manuscript contest.
  • We need approximately $1,500 or more per book to cover printing costs. We plan to produce 300 copies of each title.
  • We would ideally like to pay local designer Keely Honeywell $500 for each book.
  • We also hope to pay editor Maya Jewell Zeller (author of YESTERDAY, THE BEES and RUST FISH) $250-500 for each book.
  • Additional monies, if raised, will go toward promotional funding for the titles, such as travel costs to high profile events like AWP or the PNBA, and will support another of Scablands Books' authors, Simeon Mills.

The Impact

Your money will stay local: We will print the books with a local printer, Gray Dog Press. Ellen Welcker and Tim Greenup are both talented Spokane authors, beloved in the writing community here, as are editor Maya Jewell Zeller and designer Keely Honeywell. By publishing their work and promoting it locally and nationally, we advance Spokane's position as one of the major literary hubs of the Northwest.
